When it works, it works great at taking pictures in the daylight and night, but night pictures are kind of grainey. But then again this is a lower megapixel camera compared to many now.  I can get well over 500 pix on a set of batteries with most being taken at night on a food plot.  Quality wise I've been happy with it.  For a piece of electronic equipment that runs in temps of 10* to 110*, in sun wind and tornadoes, I think it has held up well and done a noble job.  I'lm looking to buying another camera soon......maybe a Browning this time.....

Reviews.Title: Gave a Second Chance and Still Didn't Work
Reviews.Author: Samuel T Hunt
Reviews.Content: The first camera I ordered arrived DOA. Primos customer service said it would be quicker to send back to Amazon (it would take them 3-6 weeks to resolve the problem.). Amazon graciously replace it with a new camera. The new camera however failed after one use. Primos customer service again was no help. The second camera is on its way back to Amazon for a refund and I will order a different brand the next time. Praise to Amazon for their quick and easy return policy. Shame on Primos' quality control and poor customer service. I will not recommend or buy another product from Primos.

Reviews.Title: Purchased 2...one worked. One did not.
Reviews.Author: KabulPickle
Reviews.Content: One of the cams simply stopped working after one day. very unimpressed.  for 100$ not good enough.  other considerations ...The cam set up was easy. Day pics are very clear.  Night images so so. But 50/50 chance of working.  Don't bother

Reviews.Title: Customer service? What customer service?
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The camera lasted for about (8) months until it stopped working. Standard use hanging on a few different trees doing what trail cams are supposed to do. Took great pictures and my son and I were very happy with it.So, as I had mentioned, the camera stopped working about (2) weeks ago and I wen through the process of changing out batteries, buying a new memory card, making sure things were formatted the way that Primo's says on their website. Still a no-go.I emailed Primo's support via email on Sept 8th and have yet to receive a reply back from these people.After doing more research on this product as well as Primo's support, I have found that [a] not too many people are happy with the product, and [b] their support staff is much less than "primo".Should they happen to address my issues with this camera and help my 10-year old son and I out, I may revise this review. However, until that happens, 1-star it is. Spend a few more dollars with a different company.

Reviews.Title: well worth the price
Reviews.Author: Brenda L. Shiek "brenda"
Reviews.Content: this camera works day or night, does not flash...so if u have an intruder in yard, etc...they dont know they are on camera... if u have problems with people tagging garages, destroying things in ur yard, etc....its great to have...its black so not real noticeable at night.  find a spot to put it in and TADA!!!! smile ur on candid camera.... Whose the fool now...hehehehehh

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: NMOtt "NMOtt"
Reviews.Content: we placed this high up in tree to document recent car burglaries.  good resoution  easy set up.  hopefully will catch on card scum that tries felony again.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Luny
Reviews.Content: I function tested the camera and all seemed well. It has now been in the woods for about 5 weeks. Went out to check the memory card, the camera no longer works and there were no pictures on the SD card. I swapped out 2 different sets of batteries and still no luck. Definitely would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Unsatisfactory
Reviews.Author: Mona L Loftus
Reviews.Content: Camera quit working 4 months after expiration of return opportunity; used it only 9 months.  Not a good investment of my money.

Reviews.Title: terrible
Reviews.Author: Bradley Maxon
Reviews.Content: terrible camera. worked for a month and died. Plus the battery life sucks. I would not recommend buying this camera nothing but trouble. Go for the moultrie instead.

Reviews.Title: BUY! BUY! BUY!
Reviews.Author: Isaac A. Halama
Reviews.Content: THIS BY FAR WAS AN AWESOME PURCHASE, THE CAMERA PICTURE QUALITY IS AS CLEAR AND CLEAN AS A WHISTLE. THE NIGHT VISION IS OUTSTANDING FOR THE PRICE OF THE CAMERA. IT IS DURABLE, DUMMY PROOF TO OPERATE AND UNIVERSAL. I USED IT TO SCOUT SOME HUNTING ARES IF THERE WAS GAME AND THE RESULTS WAS UNBELIEVABLE!IN ADDITION I USED IT IN MY HOUSE WHERE I HIDE THE CAMERA TO SEE WHAT NIECE WAS BREAKING THE RULES I GAVE THEM AND CAUGHT 1 OUT THE 3 WHO WAS DISOBEYING  AND EVEN LIEING TO ME AFTER I SHOWED HER IN THE VIDEO CAUGHT RED HANDED...DONT HESITATE AND BUY THIS...

Reviews.Title: Idiot proof!
Reviews.Author: Clayton
Reviews.Content: I have several of the Primos Truth Cam 35s.  Love them!  They work well and seem to last several years.  This is my forth season on the same cameras.  Hope noone steals them!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: tasi
Reviews.Content: It is everything its listed as, excellent! good clear photos, I love the night vision, I also had it out in the rain, worked fine.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35 Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Jones "Flower person"
Reviews.Content: This Primos Truth Cam 35 Camera takes really clear pictures.  What we like about it most is the time, date and moon phase are on the bottom of each picture.  Some of the pictures pick up deer from about 20-25 feet away.  Pigs for some reason even further away.  The daytime pics are worth keeping, the nighttime ones are pretty clear too.  None of the animals seem aware of the cam.

Reviews.Title: Primos 35
Reviews.Author: Terry Clark
Reviews.Content: I purchased an SD card used it for two nights and the number of pictures( 50 or 90)  will not erase. If I take out the SD card and put it back in the number changes from 50 to 90 or vis versa.  I called customer support and they said I have to send the camera in for repairs.  Two nights use and it needs to be sent in for repairs!  I will never purchase a Primos product again!

Reviews.Title: Big Steve
Reviews.Author: Shari22
Reviews.Content: I have now purchased a total of 4 Primos Truth Cam 35 Cameras, Security Boxes,  3 12' Python lock and cables, and one 6' Python lock and cable.  GREAT for seeing what goes on around the house when we are away, and asleep.  The videos have been very GOOD for seeing what animals have come thru day or night.  But for perfect pictures that were not grainy, we had to set the cameras to photo-Multi Shot with the quick retakes.  GREAT for catching the 2 legged game and their car with GREAT photos of their License Plate while it was moving.  GREAT for the LAW enforcement to be able to enlarge the photos and catch the prey!!!!!!!!!!!! We even had photos of them trying to use a crow bar on one camera in the box and on the Python!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, NO CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!
Reviews.Author: Orion
Reviews.Content: [See UPDATE at end]For a lower price-point game camera it is easy to set up and use. Images are good. I liked it well enough that I recently bought a second one.When I was cleaning my first camera (year old) this weekend the plastic white cover over the electric eye crumbled. I was using a damp cloth with gentle pressure to clean the camera a little before storing it for next season when it crumbled into 20 or more pieces.No problem I thought, probably happens all the time. It was very easy to open the back of the camera and remove the remains of the plastic cover with standard phillips screwdrivers; took maybe 3 minutes.I called Primos this morning to order a replacement cover and learned from the customer service rep that THEY DO NOT OFFER REPAIR PARTS! Primos was willing to swap out cameras with me IF it was still under warranty, but would not provide parts. Well, mine is out of warranty and ARE YOU KIDDING ME it would be really stupid for Primos to send me a new camera when all I need is a two-cent piece of plastic. The CSR I spoke with was cold and could only repeatedly say "Primos does not repair" and "does not have parts". She did offer to send me a new camera for $50. I asked her if Primos expected me to throw away my otherwise working $100 camera and buy a new one because the two-cent plastic dome was broken. She (predictably) repeated: "Yes", "Primos does not repair" and "does not have parts".I will not buy another Primos product and recomend that you consider this if service-after-the-sale is remotely important to you.[UPDATE] The Primos CSR called me back a few days later to tell me that they had searched for a replacement dome but were unable to locate one. She again offered to send me a new one [camera] for $50 which I declined. She then offered a replacement [camera] for $25 which I accepted. It arrived in the mail a couple of days later. I have not tested it yet.[UPDATE] I failed to mention in my first update, that it was the same CSR that called me back and she was much more pleasant and easy to deal with and, in fairness, I (we) all have our off days. The new camera is up and running and has recorded more than 800 photos with the same quality that I mentioned above. It is still a concern to me that they do not offer parts. How difficult could it be for Primos to order extra parts? Is this true with other Primos products?

Reviews.Title: Excellent multi-purpose camera
Reviews.Author: Vince Migliore "Fallen Guru"
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasantly surprised with the performance of this camera that I bought a second one. I bought the first one on a lark to capture the cats, squirrels and critters that run along my fence line, but it turns out to be an excellent security camera as well as a game camera. I have it pointed at the fence next to my house. On sensitive setting it will take a picture of the wind blowing the tree leaves, so I have it on "Normal" and it still captures creatures as small as little finch birds roosting on the boards.I love the range of settings - one picture, 3, or more, video or stills, and zoom function.The batteries seem to last forever. I have the same batteries as when I bought it 3 weeks ago, and it still reads over 95% charged. I also like the mounting options; there are grips on the back, belt loops, and screw holes. Several different options for securing to a surface or tree.The only drawbacks . . . the squirrel is pretty quick. Sometimes all he leaves is the wisps of his tail in the frame, as the camera is a bit slow to respond. Also, on foggy mornings dew can collect on the lens. These are minor points.The operation overall suggests it would be perfect as a security camera. Anyone trying to jump the fence would easily trigger the camera.The night vision photos are excellent too.Finally, I love the rugged construction. Nice job, and my hat's off to the manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: T. Davidson
Reviews.Content: This was a great buy IMO.  Trail cams can be very expensive but this one is the best for the money.  Did a fair amount of research on Amazon and this was the cheapest one I could find with positive reviews.  I've been extremely happy with this camera.  I configure it to utilize the camera and take burst shots every minute and am able to get  a couple of months out of the batteries.  The quality of the pictures (day and night) are great as well.  Will admit that I haven't used it for video yet.  If I buy additional trail cams for next season I will definitely be purchasing more of these.

Reviews.Title: Price to function.
Reviews.Author: Buruko "Tech Geek Professional"
Reviews.Content: While not the fanciest camera this guy gets the job done without any real fuss. Set it up 20 ft from where you want to take a picture, ensure you have decent light not directly in the path of the sun and you get clear color pictures, and decent night shots. You can buy more expensive units that may offer you more functions but for reliability and ease of use this is a great little camera to dabble into the game trail camera waters.You can also use this for urban trail watching, if you catch my meaning.

Reviews.Title: This was the best seller in its class
Reviews.Author: Antony S. Whittaker
Reviews.Content: Good feature set. Simple to use. Good price. I have only used it inside so far due to the cold weather conditions. It seems to work well. The  motion sensitivity seems a bit sketchy; inconsistent. It might work better outdoors. Night time images seem a bit washed out from the infrared, especially if the object is closer to the camera. Interestingly, when the camera takes a picture, you can hear it. I dont know if this would scare away critters, probably not. Also, I have used infrared before and never been able to see the lights illuminate, you can on this camera, again, not sure if this would frighten off animals. Video mode works well. I did not seem to have the delay problem another person here spoke of in either video or photo mode. All in all decent for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great Battery Life
Reviews.Author: Mitzy's Dad
Reviews.Content: Purchased Truth Cam to replace a Wildgame cam that went through a set of batteries in less than a week. With the Truth Cam, battery is at 98% after two weeks. Using it to capture deer and other wildlife in my backyard. Great trail cam.

Reviews.Title: Super Value & Performance
Reviews.Author: Inspector Slim
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for 2 months now - super battery life even in cold (<20*) weather. Great value, the IR does not spook game though there is a minor "thunk" when it switches from regular to IR mode. Easy to set up & change or adjust settings with the slide switches. Takes sharp pictures & good color during the daylight. For the price & overall performance I consider this a top value for a game camera, I'm going to get a second one very soon!

Reviews.Title: back  to the  basics!
Reviews.Author: Kenneth L. Petty "tauz"
Reviews.Content: this  cam was essential for  my  security  around  my  home! i  attached  it  to a  cut  off tree and  planted it on the  back of  my  home.durable,and  i camouflaged it  to  blend in  with surroundings so far so good its working! watch out  cat burgerlers!.tauz

Reviews.Title: Camera Noise is gone
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey L. Templeton
Reviews.Content: The camera has been improved and makes no noise when taking picture.  The battery life has been improved and it will take a 32gb scandisk.  Pictures are clear both day and night.  I am using it as a security camera and the only minus is that the red led's light up at night when taking a picture.

Reviews.Title: GREAT camera except for ONE thing.
Reviews.Author: prv8eye "Gus"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE the TruthCam 35 and I'm having a blast with it.Besides seeing all the critters that visit my little farm at night, including the $#@# coyotes that keep stealing my chickens, it's great to see who comes up my driveway when I'm not home. Usually just the mailman or UPS but I have had some wood stolen in the past and next time I hope to see who the thief is.I get a lot of videos of bunny wabbits jumping all AROUND my Havahart traps.I also now have PROOF that my neighbor's two big dogs are regular visitors to my property. They have also helped themselves to my chickens and my garbage cans and he promised to keep them off my property. He adamantly denies that they still run loose. But my TRUTHcam has revealed the TRUTH, along with the time and date!My ONLY complaint is the MINIMUM Ten second delay before it starts recording video. It is so ANNOYING to see videos showing only the tails of animals or no animal at all because they've walked by the camera, setting it off, without the courtesy of stopping to pose for the camera. A car can drive by and start the video AFTER the car is already out of sight.I can understand the reason for a delay but give me the OPTION of a shorter one or NO delay before recording video. Ten seconds is a long time.One bit of advice: Don't aim it at tree limbs or bushes that blow in the wind or you'll get a lot of videos of limbs and bushes blowing inthe wind <G>.Another caveat, for reasons of cost and LEGAL prohibitions in some states(to protect the privacy of people, not deer), this camera does NOT record audio. Still a LOT of fun and a GREAT tool to see Who Goes There!

Reviews.Title: Truth Cam 35
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: Great price on a good camera. Takes good pictures day and night. Does have a few bad pics when it seem the camera has to wake up. Most likely for battery saving mode I guess. Camera is a bit noisey spooks mainly the bucks and the leds glow for awhile after the picture.

Reviews.Title: Good job Primos
Reviews.Author: Johnny
Reviews.Content: This is my second trail cam and I must say it is awesome. The pics are great, both day and night. I would buy the truth cam 35 again. Very good camera at a price that is very reasonable. Good job Primos.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35 Camera
Reviews.Author: Vikkijov "Vikki"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a month ago but wanted to try it out for awhile so I could give it a fair review.  Here's what I noted.  The camera itself works excellent.  In daylight it takes color pictures or videos and at night time, it takes black and white pictures or video.  If you are using the picture format, you can select that if it detects movement, it will take 1, 3 or 5 pictures in sequence and you can set the time frame between each picture taken.  For video, you can set how long you want it to take the video for.  The pictures come out brighter than the video but both are of high quality.  There are only two things I noticed negative with this camera.  The first is right at dusk or dawn, when it should be doing nighttime recording, it is on daytime recording so the pictures come out dark, but that occurs only over a short period of time before it switches to the appropriate day/night setting.  It seems like the daytime setting stays on too long at dusk and comes on too early at dawn making the pictures in that time period dark.  The second problem I noticed is that when the battery starts going down a bit, the pictures start getting darker.  I guess the infrared lights dim down as the battery voltage drops.  I guess that makes sense though.  In the one month I've had it, I've caught all sorts of animals both in photo and video.  I definitely would recommend this camera.  One final note.  When removing or installing the SD chip, be sure to use the rubber sealing piece to keep bugs out of the unit. If they get into the chip area and you push the chip in, the bug will get crushed and then the chip will not make contact to work.  I did have this happen to me but it was my fault for not closing the rubber sealing piece.  Luckily I was able to clean it out with a small eyeglass screwdriver.  Overall, I would highly recommend the Primos Truth Cam.  It's worked great for me so far.

Reviews.Title: what a disappointment
Reviews.Author: Ronald D. Maurer
Reviews.Content: hung camera, later same day 15 wild turkey walked within 20 feet with no activation. New energizer max batteries installed. After 4 pictures taken, power went from 99% to 60% in 1 day with temps in the 80's. Not at all what I expected. Called amazon and returned camera next day. Not what I expected from Primos

Reviews.Title: Can't believe - D.O.A.!!!
Reviews.Author: Run and Dance "RunandDance"
Reviews.Content: Opened it up and put in new batteries... nothing.  Thought it might need the SD chip installed... nothing.  Plugged a 6V power supply into it... nothing.  I turned it over and the screws on the back were rusted.  I can't believe that they would ship me this garbage.  Not only that, I ordered the holder for it and Amazon won't let me return it because there is nothing wrong with it!!!  What good is the holder if I can't use it???

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Pictures, Some Problems
Reviews.Author: Lynsline
Reviews.Content: Primos Truth Cam 35 Camera It seemed simple enough to set up, but I got about 10 photos (which were as good as my digital camera-beautiful)and then it stopped working. I spent 3 days working all the kinks out of it and never got it to work right.  Their website was no help.  The camera damaged one 8 MB disk, so I tried another.  I got about 21 photos before it wouldn't take anymore.  The last 3 photos were infared and the batter life dropped from 75% to 20% with 3 photos. It may be that it was a bad unit, but I didn't waste anymore time, disks, or batteries on it.  But, it did take great photos!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: TurkeyHunter
Reviews.Content: Works well on short test run.  Put in action last week and look forward to looking at what it gets pictures of.  Easy to set up and seemed to work well.  Its Primos and I have had a lot of good luck with their stuff in the pastUpdated April 12th 2012Just got it off the mountain and it worked great.  It took over 240 pictures and used 1% of the battery.  I have attached some pictures to the item description as well.  Great Product!!!

Reviews.Title: Great outdoor cam
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I am not a hunter but wanted to track down those pesky animals around the house.  I have attached it to a fence, a tree and my deck.  I've taken pictures and movies.  It works great.  Battery life seems pretty good with the 4 D batteries - I've had it on over 9 full days and it still shows over 50%.  Quality of the images are ok.  Not fantastic but it's not designed to be a high quality camera.  Sensitivity works fine.  With it set to normal most animal activity sets the camera working.  Sometimes high winds can activate the camera.  Overall I'm very happy with the device as it does exactly what I need it to do and it meets my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Bad quality control
Reviews.Author: Patrick Moran "p0m"
Reviews.Content: I'm keeping the older parts of this review below the line, but I have new information that indicates that some of the problem may be caused by defects in Macintosh portables with an internal slot for the SD memory chips If you want to try this game camera, which works quite well other than the memory card handling, then you should buy one of the USB card reader devices (for around $8) and always use it to access the SD or SDHC cards. A search of Mac forums on the Internet shows that people have had trouble with the internal SD reader on the portable. Visiting the TruthCam's site shows that people reading the cards with Windows computers indicates that there are problems there too, because the website advocates reformatting the SD cards frequently.I have just recently purchased a USB-based card reader, and it read correctly the cards that both my Mac and my TruthCam treated as unmountable or "full." I'll keep watch for any problems. If using the USB reader is a reliable work-around, then I'll increase my rating for the TruthCam to four stars.--------As has happened with several other people, the unit I got functioned properly for one night. When I swapped out a new SanDisk memory stick, the same brand as the one I bought with this product, it said 0000 for a couple seconds and then flashed what looked like "50ful"-- which turned out to be "SDFUL", an indication that the unit reads new or reformatted SDHD memory sticks as "full" despite the fact that they have no files and are perfectly o.k. according to the computer that I read and reformat them with. (They can also accept files copied from my computer.)I like the unit. It seemed perfect for my purposes. But I have had to return the item to Amazon for replacement.The instructional booklet and the website make no mention of "SDFUL," and the website has almost no useful information.Other people have given this game camera high ratings, but if you buy one you are taking a gamble. The package comes with instructions not to return the camera to the place you got it. If you depend on sending it to them, then you will pay shipping + $20 to have it repaired.Later:My replacement unit came very quickly. So far it works well except for messing up the directory files on the SDHD card. As the company's own website says, reinitializing SDHD cards needs to be done frequently. There is no good reason for this requirement. It clearly indicates unreliable functioning of the TruthCam's internal computer, i.e., the part of the gizmo that set up files and records into them. After I had used my original SDHD card a second time of the new TruthCam I was unable to erase and/or reinitialize the memory card. It originally told me that I had permission only to read my card. I rebooted my computer and inserted the SDHD again. This time I was told that it would need to be reinitialized. I did so, and the SDHD now seems to be o.k. -- until next time, perhaps.I've lowered my rating from a 3 to a 2 since both units I've attempted to use have had problems with recording images to the SDHD card.After having used this unit for many days, I am sorry to report that it has once again left an SDHD with a bad directory. I had to retry to get my Mac to reformat the disk several times. Each time the disk utility would only try to verify the disk. It then would say that the disk needed to be reformatted, but the "reformat" button was greyed out. I finally shut down my Mac, disconnected all external disks, and restarted. At that time I was given the option to "repair disk." After the disk was repaired I went ahead and reformatted it to try to make sure that there were no lingering problems.It is possible that all units have this problem or that only units with minor imperfections will fail this way. Even their own website recommends frequently reformatting SDHD media, something that ordinarily would not be necessary.A couple of weeks later: I've learned that the internal SD card reader on Mac portables such as my MacBook Pro has a problem. If you get an inexpensive UBS reader for the SD cards, then the problems that I have had with TruCam will disappear. I've raised my rating accordingly.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth 35. excellent choice for the money.
Reviews.Author: Scott Knudson "CSI Technician"
Reviews.Content: I decided to retire my Wildgame IR4 cameras after two years of service due to repeated IR-filter failures. I was looking for a reasonably priced camera that would last more than a year with moderate use. After reading the reviews on Amazon.com and chasingame.com I settled on the Primos Truth cam 35.(78.03 at Amazon.com) I ran it all muzzleloader and gun season overlooking my food plot and this camera did not disappoint. The 4 D cell batteries lasted longer than I expected. dozens of pictures each day. The batteries lasted from early November to late December. The temperatures were extremely warm though, rarely getting below freezing all season. The pictures are good enough to determine what deer are patrolling your property but not Hi-resolution enough to pick out detail over more than 40 yards. The Infrared emitters didn't exactly reach out there but on a trail or in the woods made the grade. Don't expect much in a field or a food plot at night though. Trigger times are fast and this camera gets the job done in most situations. No problems with white-out or black-out pics at transition times.The camera did write a corrupt file to an SD card once ruining the pictures but has worked fine since, (this may have been a card fault). I placed it out after deer season and some budget batteries bit the dust after a week. I don't blame the camera though. I was slummin' it that week due to a small paycheck.I will follow up later with a long-term reliability report. Trail cameras offer lots of features at a good price point these days but few hold up.If small is what you are after better look somewhere else. This is a bigger camera. It has a solid mounting strap and seems pretty sturdy. 1 year warranty is pretty typical. I like the temperature, time and moon phase stamps on the images. I will include a couple for your perusal. Right now, I recommend the Primos Truth 35. If it gives me 4 years of reliable service I'll stick with them forever......We shall see.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, but missing a great feature: night-only
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Likes electronics."
Reviews.Content: Just as described in listing.But I miss one really valuable one:  the ability to only take images at night.Pros:a. switches make setup easyb. image quality great.c. works in cold weatherd. videos capture the feelingCons:a. No switch for day/night. Had it on prior camera, and stopped picking up hundreds of squirrel and bird photos. Now I get ten times as many low-interest day photos as interesting night photos.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: R. Stennett
Reviews.Content: I did quite an extensive review of trail camera's and the reviews for the "Primos Truth Cam 35" were quite good so I purchased one. The camera has some kind of software issues.  80% of the pictures are up-side-down.  20% are pure black.  When the IR flash works it does a pretty good job but day light pictures are variable.  Out of 150 day light pictures only about 5% are any where near correctly exposed. With a lot of picture manipulation you can get an idea of the wildlife in the area but if you are looking for some kind of picture quality this is not your camera.

Reviews.Title: Night time shot is poor
Reviews.Author: Hiker01
Reviews.Content: The daytime pictures are good with the 3 megapixels, but the distance could be better.  Don't count on the nighttime pictures as it drops to a 1.3 megapixel and unless the object is pretty close to the camera, it doesn't capture it very well.

Reviews.Title: Works pretty well....
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: I used this camera from mid summer for 4 months using 2 yr old but new alkaline batteries.  When first installed they were at 98%...when removed they were at 50% and around 1.32V.  The camera was still taking good daylight pics, just that the infrared shots at night were getting pretty dim.  The SD card was removed and reviewed every few weeks over this time....was taking around 100 pics every 24 hours.  An 8 G card would last over 4 months at this rate.Camera set at low sensitivity will catch squirrels within 20 feet and larger animals farther out.  Only con is the short range of the infrared pics...but things are reasonably visible within 15-20 feet.Did have one time where the camera had to have the date reset.  The camera also fogged up at one point for maybe a dozen pics...rain or the neighbors hose?  Would like an option for 12 hr time though.So far very reliable and can't beat the battery life.* Camera has been taking around 100 pics per day for a yr or so...going through 4 sets of batteries over this time.  Still doing it's thing...  Now has been almost 2 yrs at 100 pics per day.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Product!
Reviews.Author: AZ Ghost Hunter
Reviews.Content: I love this thing! I am a paranormal investigator, and I use this when I go on investigations and it works great! It shows the date, time, moon phase and the temperature of the area that the picture was taken. It was easy to set up the time/date for it and the instructions were easy to understand. It takes 4 "D" size batteries. I've had it for about 6 weeks now, and I use it daily, and the batteries are holding at a steady 85% capacity. When I'm not doing investigations, I use this in my room to catch any would-be roommates that might stray afoul. By motion sensing, it shoots photo, as well as video. The photo function has a multi-shot feature of 1,2 or 3 shots at a time. The video function can be set for 10 secs, 30 secs or 60 secs of recording time, and both functions can be set with a delay of 10 secs, 1 min or 30 mins. It supports up to 8gb SD cards. I use an 8gb myself.The ONLY detraction I can think of with this thing, is that the photo/videos can only be taken as a result of the motion sensor being triggered. Photos cannot be taken manually by a shutter button. That would've made it even more better, but still, I love this thing and I definitely recommend it!One last thought, the housing of this product, thought fairly rugged, is still made of plastic, and if I were to strap it to a tree in the woods, I would probably buy a protective housing for it that I've seen here on Amazon. Other than that, I give this thing 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera System...
Reviews.Author: chuckbobuck
Reviews.Content: When this showed up I was a bit surprized at the size. It's about twice the size I thought it would be at 7x9x3 inches, but I have to say it's an awesome camera system. I thought I had neighbor dogs in my yard, peeing everywhere and making my little Pug go nuts when he was outside sniffing around. Well, the first night I put the Truth Cam outside I was amazed. I had two foxes in my yard instead. The infrared images aren't perfect. The fox staring into the camera from a few inches away is out of focus and washed out, but that is exactly what I would expect from any camera. Two days ago I got a great video of one of the foxes rolling in the yard about 8 feet away. It IS in perfect focus and the exposure is precise too. I feel like a little kid when I check the SD card for new images and videos. I have only had it for a couple of weeks, so I can't say yet how it will hold up to the weather. My sister-in-law spent a few hundred dollars on a computer based home security system and after seeing the quality of my fox video she now thinks this would have been a better solution. I have two more of these cameras on order with home security in mind too.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, I'm so happy with this camera!  Great results
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: I got this scouting camera as a birthday present and I couldn't be happier.  I did have difficulty at first getting it to capture photos but I think it's because I was using an SD card from my normal digital camera.  For some reason, it seems the formatting between the two was an issue.  BUT I went out and bought an 8 GB SDHC card and I've only used it for this trail camera and I've not had any issues.  So I'd recommend only using a specific card for this camera to avoid any formatting issues from device to device.  Anyway, I've only had this camera out in my backyard (which is out in the woods) for a week and I've already captured photos of turkeys during the day and coyotes at night.  I've been more than happy with the quality of this camera.  A great value for the price and very simple to set up and see results from.  I can't wait to move this camera around to more spots and see even more wildlife!  The pictures come out very clear and colorful - and the date, temperature, time and moon phase stamps are awesome!  I would definitely recommend this camera to someone just starting out - this is a very good camera for the casual user.  I'm not very technically inclined so this was nice and easy to set up.  We are even thinking of purchasing a second camera for even more coverage in our area.  I haven't yet tried the video option on the camera so I'm not sure how that works, but I'm sure I wouldn't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: jim
Reviews.Content: We've been using this camera for over a month and it still has 85% batterri life.Takes great pics & videos.Great camera at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: juju
Reviews.Content: For the price this does a great job of capturing the wild life that roam our back trails.  Bought this for my husband, he and sons sit and ooo and ahhh over fox, how many points a buck has etc.  Of course night is in black and white.  Super duper easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35 Trail Camera
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: The Truth Camera 35 works flawlessly.  You can spend a lot more money for a trail camera; but, dollar for dollar you will not beat the quality, performance, and value of the Truth Cam 35.  This camera is very simple to operate.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35
Reviews.Author: Nebraska
Reviews.Content: A little slow to start up and snap first pic but you can usually get around that with how you stage the camera.  Sets up easily and is easy on batteries.  Overall, this is a good value for the $$ (I bought 3 of these vs 1 expenseive new camera).

Reviews.Title: Works good
Reviews.Author: Gerald Burnett
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for several days now. It has been working great, battery life has been better than I expected. Battery and card life do have a lot to do with the setting choices you make. Night pics are good but a little grainy out at 30-40' Day pics are pretty good. I compared this one to several of my friends different models and we both thought for the money it was a good buy.In one of the posts on another site it was mentioned that one burnt up after plugging it into a 12 volt power supply. I must add that the correct voltage for this camera is 6 volt external power.Gets the job done for the money.

Reviews.Title: great for the money
Reviews.Author: doss
Reviews.Content: u cant go wrong with this camera if u look at alot of the more expensive cameras it beats them. this cameras one of the most easy to use cameras u can get for the money and i have plenty pics of deer and it says this camera senses stuff 40 ft away but mine is sensing them further than that and dont worry if u think its not fast enough because the sensor detects it before the lense of the camera can see it GREAT CAMERA !

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: Greegor
Reviews.Content: Well, I have used this product for about a month and I could not ask for much more.  It's hard to tell if it activates with everything that walks by, but it certainly gets most things without shooting every branch that moves.  At this point I am quite pleased, but from what I have heard most every camera doesn't last forever.  I've also had it exposed to a lot of different weather and have not exactly been gentle with it.  Easy set up and removal.  Battery life has been satisfactory.  Comparing this to other cameras that my friends have I would have to say that this one is superior for a variety of reasons.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: tony3838383
Reviews.Content: This is a great trail camera.  Takes great pictures at awsome quality and it is so afortable.  I would highly recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth 35 Camera
Reviews.Author: jdaubs
Reviews.Content: Great camera and shipping speed.  Set camera up and was getting pictures immediately.  Battery life seems to be very good (4 weeks on 4 D batteries).  Day time pictures are good and in color and nightime pictures in black and white, but good quality.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed!
Reviews.Author: Flyboy_13
Reviews.Content: I am a deer hunter so I was aware of trail cams.  We had a series of break-ins around my neighborhood so I bought a couple of these cameras for home security.  They work GREAT!  I tested it out last night and during the day and the quality looks almost better than my 5MP Moultrie camera!  The distance is great too.  If you buy one, I would suggest buying the Python Master lock cable too.  That way nobody can rip your camera off the tree.  Awesome product for the price!

Reviews.Title: didn't fit my needs.
Reviews.Author: Ray "Ray D. Wolfe"
Reviews.Content: This cam is not what I had expected so I shipped it back. I needed a security cam for human theives! this one lights up like a christmas tree when someone crosses in front of it. A prime item for the thieves to steal.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC!!!!!!!! .......Busted My Neighbor
Reviews.Author: GrapplerInOC "GrapplerInOC"
Reviews.Content: Skeptical at first But after 1 week of use, this thing is Great!I just Busted my neighbor stealing stuff from my yard.Too bad he disappeared before I could call the cops to report it.Poor guy, disappeared without saying goodbye to anyone or packing anything for his trip.Anyways.....got this as a back up for my installed security system in case of power outage, etc.Very easy to set up, easy to hide and conceal and Very easy to use.A little sensitive on the motion sensor but easy to adjust.Like it so much, ordering 2 more as back up. Great Inexpensive Security option.

Reviews.Title: truth cam 35
Reviews.Author: Jim L. Temple "j ,t"
Reviews.Content: i wasnt able to use this model,both red and green indicator lights didnt work,and didnt work after trying it 2 times. I think i just got a bad camera.Amazon is sending me another one.

Reviews.Title: Decent game camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: JimE2 "TK560"
Reviews.Content: I got this trail camera for a small test I am conducting monitoring a game feeder, and the backyard experiments I have run are as follows: Camera wake up on some movement is about a minute. For fast moving animals this does not work so hot, but for game that is eating around a feeder, it should work fine. It will take images in 1, 3, or 5 round bursts, or video, but I really don't know how helpful the video would be vs. a 3 round burst shot. Seems to take images a few few seconds apart. There is a delay setting that pauses between shots and that is good. Downside, for me is, the camera seems near-sighted. Subjects standing only 20 feet away are out of focus, but up close, it's fine. The night time images seem fine for a camera in this price range. Flash works up to about 30 feet, but my camera sees the IR flash is over to the right hand side, not in the center. Images seem more clear in the IR mode than in the day light mode. IR images are 1.3 megapixel vs. daylight images that are 3.0 megapixel.The motion of trees and small animals is enough to set it off. It has a sensitivity setting that helps. The SD car slot is easy to remove, and reset on the camera, and all you need in the field to view the images is a laptop [PC or Mac], and a SD card reader, or camera with a SD card reader. The camera has a nice slot for a cable lock, and  MasterLock Python cable lock works great.I did not test the video mode, so I will not comment on it's function. Switches control the camera settings, and the whole thing is easy to set up date/time etc. About as hard as setting an alarm clock. For someone who wants an entry level model camera that does a good job, this is a good choice. Very easy to use and set up. There are more expensive trail cameras on the market, but for my needs this will work. I only wish it was not so near-sighted.

Reviews.Title: Good trail cam for the $
Reviews.Author: H. Moore "Fl,Ga,NC"
Reviews.Content: Every time the camera takes a picture it makes a noticeable "CLUNCK". The noise does not scare the wildlife away, but they can't keep their eyes off the camera.The photos are also a little fuzzy.The good things are I also use it as a security camera, and it goes unnoticeable. The cameras battery life (over 1500 pics) and one month in service still have 70% battery life left. Also this camera is taking photos of cars passing by on the Road which is over 150 feet from the camera where it is mounted and is set on normal (medium) sensitivity.I believe the good things out perform  the unfavorable ones.I would purchase it again.This camera has taken over 24,000 pics with FIVE SETS OF ENGIZER (TWENTY BATTERIES)= 1200 Pics per Battery,4800 pics per set of ENGIZER batteries.TWENTY MOUNTHS AND 24,000 PICS LATER IT IS DEAD.TIME TO PURCHASE A NEW NEW "PRIMOS 35".

Reviews.Title: Great fun, quality pictures at low cost
Reviews.Author: aka_mojojojo "enter stunningly witty comment ...
Reviews.Content: Bought this little unit a year ago to find out what was wandering around my suburban garden. Didn't expect too much, figured it would probably be dead in a few months.Well I was happily wrong - it has lived outside for 11 months (bought it inside when the snow got so deep it buried it). Two sets of batteries in a year (still on the second set).I mostly use the photo rather than video feature. This is because I keep forgetting to retrieve the info and the videos use a lot of card space, filling it up and corrupting.  Photos are clear in daylight and good enough in darkness. My only complaint would be that sometimes the unit is slow to shoot so you only get the rear end of a critter and only in the first shot but hey! I can tell a skunk tail from a raccoon tail.Sensitivity is set to max all the time and this does occasionally get triggered by shadows or other light changes; it's generally a question of placement.Got a few surprises - a random dude wandering around our house one afternoon, my son breaking the bird feeder, but also some confirmations of skunk, raccoon and possum routes through the garden as well as a bunch of squirrel, mouse, chipmunk, rabbit and bird picturesDefinitely a lot of fun to have watching visitors of all kinds to our garden

Reviews.Title: Worked Fine The First Time then nothing
Reviews.Author: bmac
Reviews.Content: Worked great the first time out.  Then stored it in a closet for a few months and tried it again and wouldn't work at all.  Went through 16 batteries in two nights with no pictures.  Primos should be ashamed of this garbage they put out.  I will not buy a Primos product again.

Reviews.Title: So far, I'm impressed
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey J. Reddy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in October 2013.  This was my first time using a game camera, so I wasn't sure what to expect. As of today, this camera has taken over 20,000 pictures.  I set up my camera initially facing south west.  This caused a lot of false images.  Once I faced the camera more to the north (per the suggestion by Primos), I rarely got any of these.  The quality of the pictures is great and I have been completely happy with the camera.I have used the camera in 3 shot mode and video mode.  Both worked fine, but I find the video is more of a pain to browse through when you have a few thousand pics.  The only problem I had with the camera is that when the temps got to -8, with wind chills as low as -25, the temp display on the pictures was out of whack.  It would show 2 degrees in one picture, 65 in the next and one even showed triple digits.  All in pictures taken just minutes a part.I should also note that along with extreme cold temps this camera has also been out in rain, freezing rain and snow.  It has been completely covered in ice as well as snow and it didn't stop working once.  I have read all the negative reviews and I'm telling you, I haven't had any experience like these.  I just put my camera back out after having it in storage for over a month.  I stored it without the batteries. When I got it out, I put in new batteries and it took a few seconds for the display to come on, but then it started working just like it always has.

Reviews.Title: Raccoons
Reviews.Author: Golfer 1973
Reviews.Content: I bought this to monitor raccoons on our deck.  I want to see how many and when they came out etc.  It works awesome.  The pictures are clear.  If you buy a 64 gig SD card which are fairly cheap, you can record a LOT.

Reviews.Title: Worked really well for the first 4 weeks, until just days after the warranty expired
Reviews.Author: mmm
Reviews.Content: It says it's for outdoor use.  It also says (if you read the small print) that you are not supposed to open up the door when it is wet outside).  BUT you can't get the photo chip out unless you open up the door.  So, being very careful in the weather, we opened up the door to get the chip to check the pics but it didn't work after that.  I doubt it would have worked much more anyways.  I don't really believe it is water proof.  I was very disappointed.  I would look for a different camera if I were you, better than wasting your money on this one! :(

Reviews.Title: So far, 5 stars.
Reviews.Author: John F. Monahan
Reviews.Content: There is a lot of activity in the desert behind my house.  I just bought this to try to capture some of it, not for hunting.  The picture quality really took me by surprise, particularly the daytime color.  I wish I could find one that does color at night, but apparently people think the flash will scare off the animals (there is no evidence of this).  Anyway, the infrared photos are excellent as well.  I got a beautiful color photo of a bobcat the second day I had it.For the money, I couldn't ask for more.  It would be nice to be programmable, but that's asking a lot at this price point.  I was a bit skeptical about the potential quality of the photography, but now that I know how well this works, I will be looking into a higher end camera.Update 2 months later:Because there is a bush near the camera that triggers it, and I have it set to shoot five times each time it is tripped, I average 700 to 1000 pix a day, so it's taken tens of thousands of shots (mostly daytime) and is still on the original 4 batteries.  The 4 D cells make the camera kind of bulky, but they last a looooooong time.The pictures are surprisingly good; I've enlarged a few to 8 x 10 and framed them.  That good.  Now if only the drought would end and bring more subjects around...

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: mike meneau
Reviews.Content: First one in two months stopped working, they replaced it,second one in 6 months stopped working , you guessed it ,they replacement  that one and now it has stopped working ,

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35 Camera
Reviews.Author: nanax2
Reviews.Content: Had to return the first one but the replacement has done wonderful.  we have a farm and it has helped with "watching" by taking pictures so we are aware of things going on.price was rightset was easyviewing is nice

Reviews.Title: Primos The Truth Game Camera
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I am giving it three stars at present.  I purchased two of these for my own Christmas Present.  They have been in the woods for a little over a month now.  Pictures are very good.  Overall pleased with performance.  BUT, each time I have checked on them there is moisture on the inside of the camera.  I am sure this will affect the longevity of the camera.  Not sure if it is lack of seals or design.  We have had a lot of rainy weather but my other cameras remain dry inside.

Reviews.Title: Takes Great Pictures Both Night and Day
Reviews.Author: John Thorsness
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera (my first 'game camera') to keep an eye on the porch and entry of our remote log cabin which is 90 miles north of Anchorage, Alaska. We'd had a gang of bears break in (now have an electric fence) and I was curious what other four and two legged critters came by. Bought a package of two SD cards, four 'D' batteries and set it up. Easy.So far it has photographed several moose, my neighbors checking on the place and my arrival before I turn it off. No bears. It ran all summer and so far this winter without any problems. Still on the same set of batteries (using the photo option not the video).I have no complaints whatsoever. For the price, it is a superb value.JB Thorsness

Reviews.Title: Great entry-level camera trap
Reviews.Author: Jake_K
Reviews.Content: We are using this camera trap on our property in Ecuador. The range is good. The daylight photos are good and the night photos are good too. Even the video is of good quality on this camera. The battery life is also really good. Over 4 months of taking pictures every day and it is still working. The animals in the forest are very curious about it. Lots of close ups of the pumas and bears as they check out the camera. I would definitely recommend this camera trap.

Reviews.Title: Only worked for a year...
Reviews.Author: Stoney
Reviews.Content: It took good pictures while it lasted.  Died a sudden death....  Avoid it.  Very disappointed.  The factory could do nothing.  Bushnell/Primos offered me a 'deal' on a new camera (different model) that cost more money than Amazon offered it for.

Reviews.Title: Buy one!
Reviews.Author: TLohse72
Reviews.Content: I did a little research and settled on the Primos 35.  I planned to use this trail camera to view the various wildlife that roams through our yard each day and night.  This camera works as advertised.  Great color pictures during the day, time stamped with Temperature, Time, Date is very helpful for other "intruders" as well.  I mostly operate in photo mode,  5-shot bursts.  It works great at night too.  The pics are black and white at night, on the infrared LED is hardly noticeable.The video is flawless.  This is a great camera for the price point.We live on a private drive consisting of only a few homes, we are using the camera to monitor the 'traffic' as well.  Before owning this camera, we had a burglary at a neighbors residence.  It would have been nice to own this sooner to identify the criminals.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, but should have been built with a steel case.
Reviews.Author: Heather N.
Reviews.Content: Camera is easy to use (my first) but having the steel case would have kept it secure.  Jerk knocked off the lock in the plastic case cover and stole the $7.00 chip out of it.  Now have to spend ANOTHER thirty bucks for a steel jacket to keep the batteries and memory chip from being stolen.

Reviews.Title: Good cam for the price...just not that good with night vision shots
Reviews.Author: Blackie "Chris"
Reviews.Content: Has been some time since I made this purchase but I have to tell you it works like a charm. Night shots are not too good unless the subject being photographed is close. Day time stills and video are great...especially on a sunny day when the sun is high above. I used this cam for two types of scenarios. First we have some knuckleheads jumping the wall and are cutting through our complex...which seems to be about the time we go missing holiday decoraction and misc items in our front yards. Next was a visit to Yellowstone and hoped to capture some animal images but managed to catch more of our own activities in the area....which was quite comical considering the situation that I won't... uhhhh can't go into detail here. If you want a reasonably priced cam this is the item for you. Batteries do last a reasonable amout of time in this product but stay up with fressh batts it if you are getting a lot of images in a single day. Windy situations create a lot of movement and the cam will do exactly what is supposed to do and capture MOVEMENT.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive Trail camera that delivers high quality.
Reviews.Author: morphine
Reviews.Content: Nice easy to use camera. This is as effective a trail camera I could ever imagine anyone would need.  Day pictures are very clear and night pictures are clear and have nice range.I may have had a very small number of false triggers, but expensive trail cams false trigger too and it just doesn't seem to be an issue with this camera.I am using a Transcend class 10 32gb memory card without any problem.The 4 "D" cell batteries (required) last a very long time.After many rainy weeks, the Primos Truth 35 still functions perfectly.Things a buyer may consider: Some of my buddies have expensive trail cameras with built-in L.C.D. screens that are really nice. However, most all of these screens I have seen are small and have a low pixel count and the image is never going to be as clear on the trail camera as it will be on a computer monitor. My brother found a buck in the top right corner of his monitor while viewing images from his data card at home on his pc. He never did see the buck when he viewed the same frame on his trail camera's L.C.D. Some will say that the built-in screen helps with camera placement to take practice pictures. Well, if that makes you feel better thats good. Just know that the field of view of this Primos Truth camera is pretty wide and your going to get perfectly good pictures.Theft.Another reason I bought this camera. It's inexpensive.Camoflage.I wasn't impressed with other camera's trademarked camoflage schemes. In November, you can easily spot a camera that is camoflaged for spring Turkey season. You can also spot a camera that is comoflaged for regions other than where you will be hunting. I bought camoflage tape from my local farm store and used camo grease facepaint to perfect it.  The best part of using your own camoflage is that you can make it perfect for your area at the time of year you will use it. Remember this...... no matter how well you camoflage it, that olive drab strap around a tree is going to stand out like a sore thumb, so its very easy to spot a trail camera just by seeing that strap around a tree. Be clever, old rotted stumps have worked well for me, dig into the side of a little mound of dirt and place it upright, pack the dirt back around it and use whats laying around to conceal it. Felled rotten tree on the ground makes a good little hiding place with a little creative effort. Those L.E.D.'s? Go get some cheap dark window tint and cut out a piece to fit over them. If you're sneaky and keep your mouth shut, that camera will be very very hard for anyone to find.Practice:Practice makes better with trail cameras but never perfect. Specifically where good concealment is concerned. Remember, its going to do its job when you walk away from it.

Reviews.Title: Primos S**ks
Reviews.Author: N. D.
Reviews.Content: I've had 2 Primos cams and neither one is working after 3 mos and Primos warranty service is as bad as their cameras. I see Bushnell has bought them out and maybe their cameras will improve. Bushnell makes a good camera.  I wouldn't buy Primos anytime soon though.

Reviews.Title: Marginal
Reviews.Author: What Else?
Reviews.Content: First use was good but after that it keeps losing date and time settings and sometimes does not take pics even though there are people or animals in the shot area.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this camera
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: absolutely TERRIBLE. If you buy this camera be ready to see this one day randomly. "SD FUL" on the screen. Primos makes a chinese crap camera and will not stand by it. They offer only a small discount on a new one. Believe me I have bought 4 primos cameras that would NEVER buy another one.CHeck reviews other places and on youtube and you will see thousands of other people have this same problem with SD FULL

Reviews.Title: Poor performance all around
Reviews.Author: Jaghunter
Reviews.Content: Spent all last year with two trail cams taking pictures of the deer on my property.  I was actually looking to step up, from the basic Wildgame cameras I had, when I purchased two of these Primos cameras.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! ALL of the night shots that this camera takes are out of focus. The flash distance in my experience is about 3 feet.  The batteries do NOT seat well in the camera even with the cover closed, they tend to shift causing the camera to shut down. I'd love to post some pictures here to prove my point, because Im very very disappointed with this product. I do not write many reviews on here, but I just HAD to share this.. Primos you have a lot of work to do on your cameras.. If I had bought just one and had this experience, I probably would had chalked it up to a bad apple.. I bought TWO, and had the same experience with BOTH of them..

Reviews.Title: Not Happy with 35 LEDs
Reviews.Author: MBF
Reviews.Content: My Primos 60 had 60 LEDs that provided very nice night time photos at a distance of about 50 feet. I bought this one thinking it would be fine for night time. But alas, it is not. The 35 LEDs can accurately capture images of objects that are within 10 feet of the lens. Objects that are farther away are completely black, except for an occasional eye, whose reflection has been captured looking into the camera.I should have ordered another Primos 60.

Reviews.Title: Only lasted through one set of batteries
Reviews.Author: Dave Johnson
Reviews.Content: Wen first set of batteries was done, so was the camera.  Now it will not turn on at all.  Did not last one whole season.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after 3 days
Reviews.Author: Jerry Collins
Reviews.Content: I purchased this after reading some of the reviews. It was to be used indoors only, trying to see which dog was using the carped as their commode. The first 2 days it worked like a charm. I went into the Primos troubleshooting page and found this to be a very common problem. The Primos person was very helpful in telling folks that they would be replaced. Problem is, some people found the replacements defective. I understand that items can be defective, but this seems to be the norm.I don't know what I will purchase, but it won't be another Primos product.We absolutely love Amazon and the fact that we can return items with absolutely no hassles.

Reviews.Title: bad product
Reviews.Author: arlyce watkins
Reviews.Content: had this thing one year just used couple of times big peace of junk gets an error code that can not be cleared..made in china also ....should have known it would go out when one year warranty was up....stay away JUNK........

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: bethany bradley
Reviews.Content: Even if there is a small light, it takes white pictures. Returned it. As the saying goes, you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: Customer Service is terrible
Reviews.Author: 2nume
Reviews.Content: Purchased this trail cam with plans to attach an external power source. Received the camera, then called Primos customer service for some technical information. Never have I ever talked to such an incompetent and rude person. From the moment I asked the first question, she raised her voice saying statements that made absolutely no sense. I have a Masters in Electrical Engineering and listening to the crap coming out of her mouth made me want to jump out the window. I even asked to speak with another rep or possibly and engineer and she replied there was no one else....In the end, filed a return with Amazon. Never used the product. Will never use Primos again.

Reviews.Title: Very poor product
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera arrived and did not work at all...I returned it for a replacement and it doesn't perform well either. The daylight pictures are fine but night pictures (when it actually snaps one) are such poor quality that they are useless. I kept trying to figure out a way to make this camera work until the time frame to return it was past. I will probably junk it and buy another brand. I have been buying from/thru amazon for years and this is the first product that has been completely useless and of such poor quality. I am VERY disappointed with this camera...a waste of $$$.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35 not so truthful
Reviews.Author: TN BOB
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after taking back the Wildgame Innovations IR4.  I wanted to use it for driveway surveillance in hopes of catching on tape some of the 2 legged bandits that may want to visit for a few minutes from time to time in broad daylight.Before using the camera I tested to see if it would record a car coming up the driveway.  For a camera that is supposed to have a quick trigger speed, it was really great at catching me on camera while installing it.  However, it completely missed my car driving up the driveway, recording no useful pictures at all.  The set up is extremely easy.  The picture quality is very good if used in Hi Res mode. I imagine this would be a great camera if used in the woods where your quarry is enjoying a casual walk down the trail or eating the cookies you left for it.;)  Anything faster may not be captured on video or still.  The viewing of pics is very easy.  You just remove the SD card and plug into your computer.  I was not too happy with the results for my application and plan on returning it.  Happy Hunting!

Reviews.Title: SD full error
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: worked excellently for 2 months then went into 'SD full' error mode. Tried reformatting SD cards even replaced SD cards. I checked the user forums and apparently this is a common occurrence with this product.  Really frustrating...buyer beware

Reviews.Title: Buggy, intermittent operation
Reviews.Author: Artichoke Books
Reviews.Content: I've had a lot of trouble with this camera. For a while it wouldn't read the SD card, so I tried several and found that anything over 8gb the camera couldn't handle. Now, it will read the card but will go weeks without taking a picture, then randomly resume normal operation. I've reset it per manf. recommendations, replaced the cards, replaced the batteries, no luck. Frustrating. When it does take pics, they are good quality. I have some nice shots of bear, foxes, raccoon, deer, dogs and numerous smaller animals. It also took some wonderful shots when placed by a bird feeder.

Reviews.Title: Value!
Reviews.Author: Robert Hutchings
Reviews.Content: We get bombarded on TV about the various trail cameras out there of various prices.  I am not a guide or professional and retired.  We can put 3 of these out for the cost of the so called premium cameras.  Been using them for 3 years. no trouble.

Reviews.Title: So much fun to see what goes on after dark!
Reviews.Author: Caryn Colgan "Caryn"
Reviews.Content: Family members have three of these on their farm and recently one of them shot images of a bobcat. They had heard it screaming a month or so ago and now have confirmation. We bought one and have captured images of neighborhood cats and a bunny. We're okay with that because we like the intel. It's like Christmas every morning as we eager check the card to see what was going on the previous night.

Reviews.Title: 2 GONE BAD !!!
Reviews.Author: Cookie Puss
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these camera's from Amazon and thought I'd get a good deal and two great camera's considering the deal.  Before I even got in the woods it stopped working on me.  The second one I put out on my club in Georgia and came back 30 days later and it took 40 photo's and just stopped working.  I tried new batteries and to no avail.  The return was quick on the first camera, but now I gotta send the other one back!!!  Primos should really be checking these items before ole WILLARD puts his name on it.  I am slowly not using Primos products anymore.  Do not buy this camera!!!

Reviews.Title: slightly disappointing performance
Reviews.Author: S. Hopkins
Reviews.Content: This camera has some very positive attributes, but is let down by it's performance somewhat.Pro's:Very sturdy caseeasy to mount with a quality strapEasy to get pointing to the right placeGreat battery lifeReally easy to useCon's:Takes to long to fireLow light picture quality is very poorTon's of false positives (pictures of nothing) on high sensitivity, but misses what it should capture on low.I bought it to get pictures of the deer that have been pillaging our garden, it was up in various (hot spot) locations for several weeks before taking good pictures.I don't have a plethora of different trail cams to compare it against, but I do feel it needs more technology in it. For example, it should pre-focus when setup (it's a static camera, so shouldn't need to focus for each shot). That would improve fire time.The sensitivity should be either adjustable on a dial (rather than just 3 settings), or automatic. Generally if the environment is monitored for a few minutes, it's not difficult to adjust sensitivity to a little over the environment (branches swaying in the wind etc).It's ok, but I'll try a different one next time.

Reviews.Title: Not quite pleased!
Reviews.Author: Riky
Reviews.Content: I use this on my backyard next to my designated parking space to catch whats going on [there's was a break-in on our neighbors car before]  but notice that there's a lot of misses [picture] even during the day you would see a car,a person or a cat just all of a sudden appear and  sometimes you'll see it every movement made on the same spot. I read the manual and checked online of any possible setup but still the same. I have not  use the video yet. The battery Duracell Coppertop D Batteries 8 Count i bought October 2012 here at amazon and i started using it May 29-2013 is 60% 2 months and 8 days of use and still works.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: L OM
Reviews.Content: I had know idea what I was looking for when I bought this camera for my husband as a gift.  I (and he) was pleasantly surprised!  It has great clarity in the woods day or nighttime.  Beautiful pictures with snow on the ground too. Perfect for capturing animal pictures and unsuspecting human visitors too.  Needs an SD card.  Excellent product.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Teacher
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my husband and he loves it. We have gotten a lot of great pictures of deer, turkeys and other wildlife. The pictures are good enough that we can tell the different deer apart. It is easy to use, which is great since neither of us is technologically inclined. A great buy.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ofp4life
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the money. I already have great day and night time pics of deer in my area. The camera was perfect for me, I don't need to spend 150, 200 plus on something I'm going to leave outside for months on end. The only thing I've had problems with was that the camera has trouble distinguishing going from night to day  and vise versa in low light. So it helps to put it in an area with light or an opening in the woods. All and all great camera!.

Reviews.Title: Takes pretty good pictures
Reviews.Author: bobeve
Reviews.Content: I have not put it out in the field yet but one of our cats was missing the cat box and I wanted to find out which one it was and sure enough, we got the culprit.  Anybody want an older cat. :-)

Reviews.Title: Customer service for broken part impressed me!
Reviews.Author: Jackie Pascoe
Reviews.Content: I borrowed this camera from a friend - and broke the rubber attachment "nipple" on the rubber SD card cover. I couldn't find it listed as a replacement part so called customer support to see if I could purchase one. They said, no problem, no charge, we'll send one to you right away.Now granted, the fact that the sd card cover came off and broke was not a good thing -- still, I hadn't expected to be offered the free replacement just like that.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: nicole price
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my husband. We are in Florida and the weather isn't an issue for it. The quality of the pictures are great at about 20 yards. Night photos are clear and I would buy these again and again to put on my property. Well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Got the job done
Reviews.Author: MB
Reviews.Content: I got 2 of these cameras to figure out what was eating my garden.  They took really nice pictures in both day and nighttime conditions.  After a month, the original batteries are still going strong at 85% charge.  I do wish the video capture had more timing options, and sound would be nice, but the price for cameras that do those is quite a bit higher than the Truth Cam 35, so I can't really complain.One thing to note: the infrared LEDs for nighttime illumination glow a visible red, so the cameras may attract attention at dusk or during the night.  I got a few up-close pictures of  a deer staring at the LEDs from just a couple feet away.

Reviews.Title: Helped catch the skunk
Reviews.Author: Agility Girl
Reviews.Content: I got this mainly to find out where the skunk was living that got my dog a couple times. I only had to set it up 2 nights to find the skunk hole and then it was just a matter of setting up the trap. Now I use it to video the other critters and owls at night. It has settings for photos and video (up to 60 seconds). The motion detection works well. Website gives lots of info.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture Quality - Below average battery life. (updated)
Reviews.Author: Holyoak
Reviews.Content: I've had this for a 5 weeks now and went to collect the pic.s off it for the first time. So that others know what to expect I'll try and be complete in my description.  1st: The first thing that jumped out at me was the excellent picture quality both night and day. There seems to be a specific time of day when the camera can't figure out if it should be in night mode yet or not and so a few of the pictures it took were very dark. (not a critical issue in my opinion but it did cost it 1/2 a star)  2nd: The range and focus were impressive. I had a red tail hawk that spent 4 days hunting and in general posing in front of my camera. He perched on a limb just 12 inches in front of the camera and the detail on him was excellent. Both day and night shots of the deer both close up and at 35/40ish yards was also excellent. Moving or standing still it didn't matter.  3rd: Battery life: This is what cost the rating a full star. Again to be fair I've got the camera set to it's highest sensitivity and set to take cluster shots of 5 at a time so these do have an impact on battery life. BUT the camera took 325 pictures from 5/19 to 6/21 at these setting. When I arrived to swap out the memory card it was at 50% remaining battery life. These were four brand new out of the box D copper top Duracell's. Given how far you hunting grounds are from where you live and how accessible the area may be then this is something that can be a big deal. As hunting season gets closer I'm going to have to be very careful with this issue. I don't want my prey to become skidish because of numerous trips into my hunting area. I don't know if my expectations are a high but I thought I would get at least 3 months of battery life and 800 to 1000 pictures.  Lastly: Over all the construction and setup was easy and I was pleased with everything else about the trail camera making it worth the price. Good luck with yours.  3 1/2 stars is what I would have ultimately given this trail cam.Update 8-1-13: After several more trips and checking the cam I have found that battery life has increased enough to warrant the return of the half star it lost. The unit charges the internal battery off the first set of D cell batteries you install. Once this is accomplished the battery drain has seemed to slow.  Additionally, a friend of mine purchased the same cam and has set it to video and loves it. Understand, the area he hunts is just a few hundred yards from his back door though so battery life isn't an issue for him. He transfers the video to his Iphone using "pineapple" conversion program(I have an Android) and has brought them to work to share. They are really nice videos.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35 Camers
Reviews.Author: John Guillott
Reviews.Content: I have bought several game cams from the most expensive to el cheapo. Primos is a good game cam and we use several on our youth hunts to see when animals are coming to the feeders. I bought this one to put near my wife's flowerbed to see when the hog's and armidillos are visiting her flowerbed and digging up her flowers. It worked and traps were set and animals were re-located to other parts of the county. The camera is still up and waiting for the next event.

Reviews.Title: Dim pilot lights but excellent product
Reviews.Author: E. Roth
Reviews.Content: After reading through Amazon reviews of similar devices, I decided on the TruthCam 35, both because it was nearly the least expensive and because the reviews were better than any of the other similar cameras.  The set up was just as simple as people said it would be.  The instructions are detailed and clear. The only hitch occurred because the red and green "pilot" lights that tell what the camera is doing, are very hard to see.I strapped the camera to a tree where it had a view across my back yard for about 80 feet.  I wanted to see what was stealing suet feeders and wrecking the bird feeder, and I wanted to see what was eating lily flowers before they opened.  I went out the back door (about 15-20 feet from the cam) at midnight to see if I could see the camera work at night.  I saw the "invisible" flash go on and I finally saw the red light.  In the morning I went out the deck door (about 80 feet from the cam in the line of the lens), and I went to the Truth cam and removed the card to see what I had photographed during the night.  The card had about 15 images.  Half were of my leaving via the back door at midnight.  The pictures were clear and I was fully recognizable.  The other half caught me the moment I opened the sliding door on the deck, even though I was 80 feet away.  It continued firing shots until I was face to face with the lens and turned it off.  At 80 feet I was not recognizable. At 60 I was clear and easy to identify.After a night of operating, the LCD indicated that the 4 "D" cells were still 99% full.The only thing at all disappointing in the camera so far is the two indicator lights which are just too dim and recessed to be clearly seen from a distance in daylight.  Otherwise, the prices is right, and the camera worked as indicated.  Excellent!  I only gave it 4 stars because of the pilot lights and because picture quality could be improved, but for this price I'm not complaining.

Reviews.Title: Works well, has lasted
Reviews.Author: Charles Dale
Reviews.Content: This has lasted through nearly two years of weather, including rain, snow, heat, humidity, freezing temps. Would like the distance to be better at night, the IR reaches only to about 40'. And it sometimes triggers when I can find nothing in the pictures, but it does the job.Deer, rabbit, crows, foxes, turkey, wife, etc.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Reader Pane "Reader Pane"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use as a low-budget security device, and it does the job perfectly.  It doesn't require any knowledge or tools--no wiring, no trying to get it to connect to a wireless network or figure out how to record.  It handles everything itself--power (D batteries), storage (SD card), programming (slide switches).  It takes pictures or video when it senses motion, even in the dark.  I'd give it five stars, but the flashing LEDs (?) give it away in the dark. Overall, an excellent product at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Great Camerea
Reviews.Author: Eddie Wells
Reviews.Content: Camera is very easy to set up and use, takes great pictures. Still using the original set of batteries so the camera seems to be esy on battery usage. Overall I am very pleased with this product.

Reviews.Title: Primos is Primo
Reviews.Author: edward zine
Reviews.Content: does the jobI used for security on my house while building and it caught subs stealingThank you to Primos for this reliable camera

Reviews.Title: Great product at reasonable cost!!!
Reviews.Author: Danilo K. Cachuela "Amazoner"
Reviews.Content: This camera is good for the money. I don't really need a high quality camera since I just need to know if there is a deer in the area. I will not be using the picture for video production. Yesterday was the first time I used it, and I was not really very hopeful that I will find a deer. Low and behold... I found a deer! The only comment I have is that it is being advertised to accept a 8 MB disk, while the instruction that came with the unit said it could use up to 32 MB. Also, there is a minimum delay of 10 seconds. At this setting, I am missing some of the pictures, although I would consider it acceptable since the captured deer is moving very slowly. That being said, I still wish that the minimum delay could be set at 1 second.

Reviews.Title: bad camera
Reviews.Author: Hunter "Peanut Photography"
