Reviews.Content: very bad experience with my primos camera. first it stopped taking pictures, then the replacement was taking blurry pictures. wish i would have bought a different brand.

Reviews.Title: FABU! We use this inside our home - issue with housemate/relative and IT WORKS PERFECTLY!
Reviews.Author: BestDayofMyLife "Great Shopper"
Reviews.Content: This is the second one we bought from Amazon.com because we like the first one so much.  Night pics/videos are in greyscale, daylight shots are beautifully sharp and in color. Pretty amazing. It's bigger than you might think even though they give the dimensions, but we don't care for our particular purpose, and I certainly don't think wildlife would care either. If we used it for wildlife, which we don't. heh heh, unless  you count a "special" housemate climbing through our windows while wearing pantyhose, skirt and heels. LOLOLOLOLOL!  This camera provides perfectly viewable proof in court.FABU! We use this inside our home - issue with housemate/relative and IT WORKS PERFECTLY!

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35 Camera
Reviews.Author: Stavros Boinodiris "sxb"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product for my driveway security. I went through great pains to protect it by encasing it in a marble structure that prevents tampering and impact from rain. It was  intended for limited, periodic attendance. At the beginning it worked very well for about 5 months. When I checked it though this winter, after 7 months, the camera was dead. Not because of the batteries (which had plenty of charge), but because moisture rusted the battery springs and other components. I tried to replace the springs, but it seems other components were affected as well and the circuits were impacted. The camera simply was not durable enough to withstand moist environments. It needs a dry, secure place... to operate. Having purchased it as an outdoors camera ... I was disappointed. For places, like Arizona it may be ideal. For places like Seattle, forget it.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Reyes
Reviews.Content: Well the truth cam seems to work fine, but this is the first camera I have had like this. I didn't like the all black look so I repainted it camouflage to match the suroundings. I use on the 4.5 acres I live on to see what is wondering around at night and in the morning. I really only had two problems with it. First off, the motion sensor is very sensitive. I have to set it on low and make sure there is no vegetation in front of it that can blow in the wind and set it off. Even with the procautions I still get a lot of pictures with nothing there. I made a stand for it and it sits about 2 feet off the ground. The other problem is that it has about a 10 second delay before it snaps the first shot. That is the lowest setting and the quickest it will snap the first shot. Why would they make it with such a crappy delay. I can't put it on trails because by the time it takes the picture the animal has already left the veiw or you might get a shot of their butt. Like I said this is my first camera like this and maybe this is typical of a game camera. Other than that it functions pretty well and the shots are nice and clear.

Reviews.Title: Apartment Surveillance
Reviews.Author: M. Denise Kerr
Reviews.Content: OK yes this is suppose to be used to monitor the woods for hunters, but I mount it on my camera tripod and use it to monitor my apartment when I'm not at home.  I use to put a piece of paper in the door jam, and after finding the piece of paper gone when I had come home from work...I knew someone had been in my apartment but I didn't know who.  Now it will be recorded.  I also purchased and 8 GB SD card and a padlock.  I tried using my web-cam set on motion detection (web-cam doesn't work after computer goes to sleep or after dark).  I work 2:00 pm until 10:30 pm and this Primos Truth Camera takes pictures after dark and I don't have to waste money keeping the lights on in my apartment while I'm at work.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: Bad Product
Reviews.Author: Chris Sharkey Solitaire "Lonesome Advocate"
Reviews.Content: Worked great ONE time. Now does not work at all. I only used it in a sheltered environment (garage). Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Pretty shoddy quality
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera up in a few locations and when it works, it works well.  For 80 dollars, it takes good pictures.  However, it also takes a lot of photos of absolutely nothing and doesn't always trigger when I walk in front of it, leading me to question just how many critters it's missing.  I just came back from the camera being out for 2 weeks.  It took 785 pictures.  12 (4 animals X 3 shots) were of actual animals, and literally 773 were of nothing.  Is it the sun?  The wind?  Who the heck knows.  I'd give this thing 1 star if it weren't for the good quality photos it takes, but I can't give it more than 2 because it seems to take a lot of pictures of nothing.  This is also on 'Low sensitivity' option.Edit:  I had to change this to one star.  Just got back from picking up the memory card.  I placed the camera three weeks ago.  Upon retrieval, it took about 450 pictures right after I placed it out there 3 weeks ago of nothing and then died of battery. This camera is useless.  I DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Reviews.Title: Great unit for the Price
Reviews.Author: HempKnight
Reviews.Content: I was having issues with someone trespassing on my property. I sat this up and was able to catch the perpetrator within a week. I would have given it 5 stars, but it is lacking a lot of features from the other camera trail units. It is easy to use, and I found the night pictures very clear out to about 30 feet. Daytime pictures are great quality and the battery life is great in this unit! I would recommend this product for the hunter on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Fun and helpful
Reviews.Author: Marie E. Larry "rodeo1953"
Reviews.Content: We set it up to catch the coyote, and found much more!  We can even see if anyone has driven up to our house at night or when we are not home.

Reviews.Title: Nice for me
Reviews.Author: Wayne Oliver
Reviews.Content: I got this to see whats happining at my home while im at work , the sensor is great takes photos  up to 300 or more feet away, and see as far away as  my neighbors house 200 yards  away  in the back ground.  The maga pixles aren't much on the cam,  I  think like 1.5 not sure, now so you get that, but  I still love it gets the picks  without all the false pic's of bush movement.Anyway im happy with it so far.

Reviews.Title: Worth the price
Reviews.Author: John Doe "John"
Reviews.Content: Simple to set up and operate. Great photos during the day and very good battery life. Night photos not as sharp.

Reviews.Title: nice product
Reviews.Author: kathy
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, the quality is great day or night , we ordered a total of three cameras and but could have got all the angels we wanted with two

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Josephine Lupo
Reviews.Content: No problems with this at all.  The battery life is great!  Still going strong on the first set of batteries even after a year and running 24x7.  Was so happy with it I bought a second one!

Reviews.Title: Very heavy, tricky motion sensor
Reviews.Author: R. Miller
Reviews.Content: If I were starting over, I would look for something that takes AA batteries, not 4 D cells. It also is hard to predict how much this unit will overreact to snowflakes, moving grass, etc. It takes a LOT of pictures of nothing, though also some good ones of deer and elk.

Reviews.Title: Lots of options for cheap
Reviews.Author: Brett
Reviews.Content: Jusging by many reviews even the most expensive of these cameras have the same problem, false triggers. I didn't have a lot of false triggers with this, but at the same time I wasn't picking up much wildlife. There is a 10 second movement delay which I think might be too much. Many animals will come in and out of view within 10 seconds. Picture quality is decent and the SD card allows for easy download.

Reviews.Title: Bought 2 more
Reviews.Author: gaw in FLA
Reviews.Content: Bought one for seeing what animals (deer, fox, racoons etc) were visiting the homesite - just bought 2 more to monitor recent neighborhood breakins. Hopefully all we'll see is more wildlife. Nice clear photos. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for the money
Reviews.Author: W. Waterson "Wetwat"
Reviews.Content: Fair picture quality at night but the video is rather good as long as it's within about 20 feet. The information supplied on the product page is wrong however because it will take up to a 32 GB SD card not just the 8 GB card listed on the site. This is confirmed by the instruction that came with my Cams.

Reviews.Title: Works like a champ
Reviews.Author: D. Roy
Reviews.Content: Have had this over a year now...very very nice unit and sturdy. Stood up to all sorts of weather and made it though a tornado that leveled my parents house about 30 yards away! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Super fun camera
Reviews.Author: A. Bennett
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to see what animals are coming through our yard at night, and man o man have we gotten some great pics. For the price you can't beat it.Two criticisms:- I wish it remembered the last filename it used. As it is, it names pictures like "0000213.jpg", "0000214.jpg", etc., but if I remove all the pictures from the card, as of course everyone does all the time, it starts back with "0000001.jpg". That means you can't dump all the pictures into a single folder on your computer, but instead have to create subfolders for each dump. Ugh.- it should really have a way to stand it up vertically without propping it up, but that's easily solved with a couple of bricks or whatever.But with its great pictures, automatic switching to night vision, amazingly long battery life with the 4 D batts, and great picture quality in the day (night pics are definitely a bit blurry, but I see that as understandable), it still gets 5 stars from me.

Reviews.Title: Water damaged...
Reviews.Author: Larry Hall
Reviews.Content: I bought this in Nov 2011, used under a big oak tree for 6 months, camera was in a lock-box and secured with a Master Python cable lock. I used the photo mode. No problems there, pics came out good.Then..I moved the camera and lock-box to a palm tree in front of a house, kinda close to the side of the house...I left it there for 4 months, when I opened it up the batteries(Duracell) were corroded. The SD card was a bit corroded and wouldn't work when plugged into another sd card reader, so it died. There was a white crusty film inside the camera. I tried to clean off the battery terminals  in the camera but it did no good. The camera doesn't work anymore. I tried with new fresh batteries, the camera IR lights came on and there was a faint glow in the green and red lights by the lens. The LCD panel did not work..I thought the camera was more exposed on the oak tree than the palm..I don't know why the camera box seal failed..but water evidently got in. By the time I discovered the damage the warranty was expired..I don't know if I can send it back to AMAZON for a replacement..I think the lesson here is check the camera /lock-box more often..

Reviews.Title: Super simple to set up
Reviews.Author: SEAN O'BRIANT "ROUND O"
Reviews.Content: Getting a new electronic device and not having to read the directions is always nice. I put the batteries in, set to photo (versus video) set it to a 1 min delay between pics and told it to take 3 pictures per, all via the well labeled buttons right on the front. I inserted my SD card, closed the cover and hung on the tree. Came back 24 hours later and had great pics of the local wildlife along with some cool pics of a storm that blew through and shook tree branches. The night pics are clear and the daytime pics have good color.I think I'm going to buy another one.

Reviews.Title: primos game camera
Reviews.Author: Nannyk
Reviews.Content: easy to use and works great. set it up on a tree and started taking pictures right away. great price compared to cabelas.

Reviews.Title: deer trail cam
Reviews.Author: william r armstrong
Reviews.Content: great cam so far  easy on battiers and takes great pics,easy set up and mount will be buying another next fall

Reviews.Title: Lasted about 3 weeks
Reviews.Author: bsm999 "bsm999"
Reviews.Content: Camera did fine for about 2 weeks.  When I changed the batteries on the 3rd week (they weren't dead but the cam said they were at 10%) the LCD wouldn't come on but the red light indicated the camera was alive.  I left it for a week and then took it down.  There were no pictures for that week and the LCD still refuses to come on to indicate number of pics or anything else.  Checked the batteries.  Put new ones in.  Nothing.  So I am junking it as a bad purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: candace venners
Reviews.Content: My husband thinks its one of the Best Gifts he has ever gotten. Thank You.. Im thinking of getting him another one down the Road.

Reviews.Title: Husband loves it!
Reviews.Author: Brianne Seelman
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures! Works great. Good deal for the price! Great idea for a christmas present.....he loved it :) :)

Reviews.Title: Excellent thus far
Reviews.Author: danielleb.
Reviews.Content: So many times we hear the bad. Well here is some good. I received this item for a Christmas present and thus far it exceeds my expectations. I have it out in the back of my yard which on the other side of my fence is woods and a stream. The pictures at night are OK but the daytime pics are exceptional.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35
Reviews.Author: Chris Blair
Reviews.Content: Works great, surprisingly clear pictures.  Purchased an SD card so we could use it.  Works indoors through the window or outdoors.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: d0pe0nar0pe
Reviews.Content: i use this all year, in the summer time i take it to work and get pictures of bears climbing the ladders on the front of semi trailers. and in the winter time i use it at home as a security camera.

Reviews.Title: My husband loves his Truth Cameras!
Reviews.Author: Sherri T. McAlhany
Reviews.Content: He is very pleased with the ease of camera setup & picture quality.  The best Christmas gift I ever gave him.  Glad I bought 2.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Solid.  Weatherproof.  Reliable.  The 4 D Batteries give it months of life, even in cold Idaho winters.  The photos are good.  I would love to see a stronger infrared light source and a larger diameter hole for the cable to slide through for locking.  Maybe the new models are better in that respect.  Also, head over to your local hardware store and make your own cable lock.  They have various diameters of coated cable.  All you need after that is a few stoppers to bind the cable back to itself and badabing! you have a custom length cable.  THIS IS VERY HANDY since it allows you to fit the camera around larger diameter trees...  Most cable locks are waaaay too short.

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: mark klaene
Reviews.Content: using it more for security monitoring traffic, response time is too slow for some vehicles, night time all you get is head and tail lights  but it does pick up dear and people and in daytime sees through windshields and you can pick out people faces.

Reviews.Title: Completely Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: FatFatallThat
Reviews.Content: I order this camera and a Spypoint5 MP 35 InfraredLed to try out based on reviews and Close Price. Being a Fan Of Primos Cameras I was Extremely Disappointed in this Camera. I set up Camera at home prior to putting out in the woods. Seemed to work Acceptably. Once set in the woods next to the Skypoint on a Feeder Site, it took 93 Pictures in 4 days then the Batteries went dead. They Skypoint took 567 pics in 7 days with hardly any battery usage. They were both set on 3 pic burst. So far this Camera has been through 5 sets of Batteries In the last few months and the performance has gotten worse. The last check they lasted 2 days while only taking 7 pics. Maybe I just got a bad one,  but this Camera is Garbage.

Reviews.Title: Love this trail camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Matthew Henry
Reviews.Content: I love this trail camera. it has a very nice infra red system for night time. i caught a coyote and some coons on it the first week i got it!

Reviews.Title: Great Picks
Reviews.Author: wesley cloud
Reviews.Content: It was everything I expected and more, would recommend it to anyone and everyone. Was not sure if any action was going on in the back yard but this caught everything.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin Mcateer "gracegift"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a cheap camera from wal-mart, only to find that it was a cheap, unreliable product.  I read great reviews about this camera and bit the bullet.  I was very pleased to find that it took wonderful pictures during a two week period.  I will be looking for more of these in the future.

Reviews.Title: Good, solid product - delivers what it promises.
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Dullien
Reviews.Content: Would like higher resolution in night images - that is my only reason for a 4 out of the 5 allowed stars.

Reviews.Title: big bucks
Reviews.Author: Bob Kruska
Reviews.Content: Works perfect all the time. Good price, easy to use, great pictures day and night, the thing has a great range, and depth of field as well

Reviews.Title: great!!!!
Reviews.Author: myers
Reviews.Content: I have owned many different cameras over the years at many different prices and i have came to find that the ones that are right at 80 to 100 dollors are the best but this camera wow everything i have wanted a camera to do it does the only thing i would like to see added is a higher mp 3.0 is ok and you can make out everything from a coon to a deer very well made camera best one ive owned

Reviews.Title: Great product.
Reviews.Author: ibknswife
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my son. He loves it. Great fun for the hunter or even use as a security camera for the homeowner. Great pictures for the price.

Reviews.Title: Just received mine today... And...
Reviews.Author: TechnicalDude
Reviews.Content: I haven't really tested the camera much yet, other than to verify it works and that it takes pictures in bright light as well as dark. I was pleasantly surprised to learn the camera has been upgraded to a 1 second trigger (was 1.5 seconds) and can take 32GB memory cards (was 8GB) and now supposedly has double the battery life than the Truth Cam described here. The description above needs updating and you should receive the newer model as I did!

Reviews.Title: The Primos Truth Cam 35 works as described.
Reviews.Author: Ken Buehler
Reviews.Content: The Primos Truth Cam 35 works as described. This is my first experience with a Trail-cam and I am satisfied with the results and performance. I'm using it to monitor traffic in my large wooded yard, and after a month's use on one set of batteries in cold weather, I am considering buying 2 additional units for other areas of the yard.With the camera set to take a burst of 3 shots, it usually captures the subject center frame in at least one shot. In the case of a running deer, it still got a good photo before the deer left the frame.The only dissapointment I have with the unit is in the night-time shots. Any photo within 25 feet is fairly well lit, but any shot at a distance father than 25 feet is not lit well by the flash. The IR detector still detects animals and movement at at longer distance, but they are not very visible in the shots. This may be caused by my set-up. I have it mounted high enough in a tree so that it can't be reached from the ground by trespassers.All in all, a good camera, great day-time photos. It would be nicer if the memory card could be removed without opening the case, but I suppose that's to keep it weather proof.UPDATE 12/14/2012 - 1800 photos taken so far, original batteries still at 60% operating in a temperature range of 0-65 F. No issues with downloading photos.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and takes great pictures
Reviews.Author: Tom Duggan
Reviews.Content: The switch-based settings are easy to use.  I've gotten some great pictures with this camera and very few false triggers.  The only reason I don't give it five stars is because it is clearly not totally silent. Not only can I hear it when it triggers, some of the animals that it's photographed are clearly hearing it also.

Reviews.Title: Use for minimal operation
Reviews.Author: Lawrence D. Riordan
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much for this price and that is what I got.Daylight photos are acceptable.IR night photos are very poor and the effective range for identification (deer) is less than 30'.My higher priced game cams have double that range for night photos and much finer focus.I would consider this game cam adequate for detecting something showing up at night and the time but identifying individual deer would be a problem.

Reviews.Title: good things do come in small packages !
Reviews.Author: cheryl fuller
Reviews.Content: this camera works as good as a few cameras that we paid three times more for,also so simple to use,so tiny it does'nt  get noticed as much,by people or amimals.

Reviews.Title: Excellent trail camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've used it now in 3 different locations and am very satisfied with the quality of the photos and how reliably it works.  Also, it is so easy to operate and set-up.  I expect to continue having fun with this product for many years to come.  Truly amazing what goes on in the dark of night out in the country.

Reviews.Title: game camera
Reviews.Author: Gale
Reviews.Content: This my first game camera and I can"t imagine a camera working any better or any easier to use than this camera.Gale

Reviews.Title: Excellent value!
Reviews.Author: Art Armfield
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT value for the money! We've never had a trail cam before so I was kind of flying blind when we bought this one. Night time picture quality could be better but for under $100 it does exactly what we need it to do. Only thing I'd recommend is be sure to set the camera to only one picture per motion sensed. I had mine set to three as I was afraid I'd miss some action but in 24 hours it had taken 1,342 pictures I had to sort through. They were all good pictures, even caught a big coon, probably 50lbs or more and numerous bluejays, squirrels, and Turkeys. I would buy this again in a heartbeat and may buy a second to cover other spots. Buy a second SD card, that way you can just swap them out.

Reviews.Title: Good bang for buck until they raised prices.
Reviews.Author: D. Knapp
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera, with security can and cable lock. I've used it about a year. I liked that one, so I bought two more of the same configuration. One of those two was defective, and wouldn't trigger but rarely, so I lost a lot of actually important shots (these aren't all used as game cameras).  Amazon did accept a return but for a restocking fee. When I told them I found this disappointing, they refunded that charge. Kudos Amazon! They continue to impress me.  My opinion? Products like this should fail very, very rarely. What's inside is not that complex. Ask anyone who's worked on military electronics in the field. We need to hold vendors to higher standards to compete on the world stage. Battery usage is good, although buy Tenergy rechargeable D Cells and a good charger, it will save you quickly because wow, D cells are expensive.  Two of the Transcend SD memory cards I bought failed in these cameras in just a few months. So far, Kingston and Sandisk SD cards have been working fine for me.  This camera has given some really nice shots, although, of course, I have never seen a picture as nice as what they advertise in their package. It's not very different from a cheeseburger commercial in that regard.This seems to be a situation where a couple guys come up with good idea, find some local talent to get the ball rolling, then take their idea to China get it made for pennies, then reap the rewards. (God bless America?)  Some of you may say this is simply fair trade. I'm beginning to wonder, frankly. If we don't start producing products domestically for the world market soon, I fear we're in deep trouble. As far as I know, there is no American equivalent of the game cam.  Please let me know if I'm wrong on this.  I know we can make quality products.They claim in their package that I have to return the registration card to receive the warranty, but I believe this is incorrect. Please read [...]before you "fall for that".  I find this to be subterfuge - a bit shady on their part.Aside from misgivings related to foreign trade and some not-necessarily-true statements, the camera has indeed worked in general, and has produced some important and enjoyable images. The rest are easy to delete.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price, very impressed
Reviews.Author: Northern Sport
Reviews.Content: I seriously considered going with a 7 mp cam and spending twice as much, but I am very glad I didn't. An LCD screen would be nice, but not worth the $$ to me. And another thing to break, freeze, etc.I have the camera set on the highest sensitivity setting.As a test, I set this up in my back yard, hoping to get pics of my dog running around in our fence. I got some of him, but it also picked up my neighbor walking along the other side of the fence, and separately picked up his medium sized dog, both of which were 50 feet from the camera. I was pleasantly surprised!When I set the cam up in the woods, I put out corn piles a few feet away and about 15-20 feet away. When I first started going through the pics, I was disappointed because the pics looked empty, which is why some people say not to use the highest setting. When I looked closer, there was something moving in every pic. The camera picked up a red squirrel coming down the tree and at the far corn pile, 15+ feet away! It even picked up that little bugger in complete darkness with the flash (the glowing squirrel eyes were pretty funny). I also got pics of a blue jay at my corn and some crows.After a couple days, the deer found the corn and I got a ton of deer pics after that, along with more squirrel and bird pics. The pics are very clear. I don't know why you would need 7 mp pics. I was hoping for about 50 pics after the first four days. My first set was 510 pics(!), with about 2/3 being squirrel/birds and the last 1/3 being mostly deer.In my setup along a trail in the woods with a semi-clearing, I do not have an angle to test how far away you would get good pics in a field with the flash, so I cannot speak to that. I also have not tried the video, but I will update this if I do. But for an entry level cam (it was $77 when I got it), I am very impressed with this cam.It is not completely silent, but very close and it has not spooked the deer. You will not hear it unless you are within a couple feet and the deer sometimes look at it, but don't leave (when they are really close). It also glows very slightly if you are close to it and look at it, so it may not work as a security cam (unless well hidden or out of reach).It takes 4 D batteries. After two weeks in the woods, with temps in the 30s at night and 1300+ pics taken, the battery indicator still says 99% (which is the max).Get a big SDHC card. The ad says it will only take 8 GB. I am using 16 GB and it works great. If you are putting this out somewhere remote, get two cards, so you can swap them out and view the pics at home (unless you can pull them into your computer or phone). I got the 16 GB, which will hold thousands of pics. Not that you need all that, but better to get too many pics than blanks. I suggest using the 3 shot burst. When something moving goes by, I find the first shot or last may be empty, but one of the three gets the culprit (if not all three).UPDATE:Last year was brutal in MN. Most of deer season was 5-10 degrees for a high, with lows below zero. This camera worked great for a second year. I do not get blank shots. If I look close, there is always some movement (animal or bird eating my corn). I do not get phantom shots of trees or bushes moving.I moved it to a new, more open spot. I get day and night pics 40-50 feet away. After deer season, I dumped the last of my corn all over the cut out area, to see which deer made it through the season. After about five days, I had 2,340 pics. All the deer I was getting pics of pre-season were still there. They patterned us! That week, it snowed and was an average of about 5 degrees for a high, and the camera kept right on taking all week, both night and day. I am buying another one to expand my coverage.

Reviews.Title: Husband is pleased with them.
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these items for my husband.  So far, we've had several clear photos of wild game - both day and night.  Set-up was simple and removing/replacing SD cards couldn't be easier.  I'm sure we will be purchasing more of these cameras for birthday/holiday gifts.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam Model 35
Reviews.Author: Shell Ghillie
Reviews.Content: Received camera within 7 days of order.  Installed camera on game trail with fresh batteries and sim card. Had 456 pics in 3 days.  Exchanged sim cards every 3-5 days for 35 days continuous operation in central Florida rain and heat before pulling camera.  It functioned flawlessly without changing batteries.  Tested batteries after pulling camera and still had ample battery life remaining.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with product
Reviews.Author: underhi2p
Reviews.Content: I bought this trail cam to scout my property in Maine.I checked the results after two weeks and noted a moose stopped by to say hello at 3:30 a.m.  The pictures were clear considering it is in the deep woods and at night.  The batteries still had 85% of their power.  I set the camera up to take a three-picture shoot.  It's fairly simple to set up.  The range is probably about twenty feet.  For what I am using it for, it's perfect and at a good price.

Reviews.Title: Met Expectations
Reviews.Author: edwoz
Reviews.Content: This trail cam worked as expected in that it's not a high dollar camera and it lacks some features included in the more expensive models. I wanted simple and got it. It takes pretty good night time pics and is simple to use. Battery life seems good as I haven't had to change them yet. Pro: East to set up and use. Con: Had a little trouble getting it to save the date and time to the internal memory initially. So far so good.

Reviews.Title: No night ops off function
Reviews.Author: Big Mike
Reviews.Content: Although the camera takes good shots, come to find out after I got them there is no way to shut off shots at night. I guess there are those that like night shots, problem is the flash consumes a lot of juice and drains the batteries quicker, given I don't care about seeing deer at night. I've owned four different cameras and this is the first that doesn't have a day/night op function or switch. They said they'd take them back but then I'd have to pay for shipping.If you only want day shots to extend battery life, suggest you look elsewhere and suggest, like I should have done, you call the company to verify if it has a day only function.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality
Reviews.Author: Ced
Reviews.Content: I purchased this cam and returned one week later to find the cam saturated in water and non functionable. The SD card was saturated when I removed the card from its slot. The batteries were corroded. This device is not worth the money spend $100 dollars and get a cam that actually lists that it is weatherproof as one of its features.

Reviews.Title: HAS WORKED GREAT
Reviews.Author: cagskp1020
Reviews.Content: This trail cam has been through one deer season and it did an excellent job!  I don't think you can go wrong with this one!

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Larry Thomas
Reviews.Content: WORKS GREAT EASY TO SET UP . ONLY COMPLAINT IS THE COVER DOR THE CHIP IS HARD TO CLOSE WITHOUT TAKING THE CAMERA DOWN

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: tdghvvhcvh346646
Reviews.Content: This Camera has worked great for me. I set this camera up near a stream, and in one day I got 14 pictures of Moose, Deer, and Bear. I hope it continues to work this good, and I hope it works this good for you too.

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: Robert F. Grosko
Reviews.Content: I've had this in the woods for several weeks now and it is currently recording on video. The videos are a good quality. I've tried the still pictures as well with good results. I have the sensitivity set on high so I am getting videos of fox and raccoons as well as deer and what ever else passes by. I have this setup watching a waterhole so it is well used on my property. I did camo paint the unit and it blends in with the surroundings better now. I camo all my cameras if they come in black. The "D" cell batteries are not my favorite because of the size of the unit to accommodate them, but it still is reading 70% power after constant use during this trial period. I recommend this unit as it is a great value for the price. I'll purchase more in the future as I always keep several cameras going year round.

Reviews.Title: Low price, big features
Reviews.Author: Jason21
Reviews.Content: I needed an inexpensive trail camera alternative which could provide me quality functioning and had a long battery life.  This camera has delivered on all fronts.  The image quality is superb considering the price.  Battery life has impressed me so far.  This camera provides everything most outdoorsmen will need to cover all their scouting needs.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied so far
Reviews.Author: Chuck B
Reviews.Content: The camera has been set up only three days and nights so far. It has captured clear daytime images of rabbits and pretty good infrared-illuminated black-and-white images of a coyote in the yard at 2:30 am. Looks as if nighttime range is at least 20 feet, maybe a good deal more. I have taken photos off the camera twice now and onto a Linux-OS PC and used the PC to delete the images on the SD card. Worked fine. Most of the photos were deleted from the PC then because they were of me walking by or were otherwise uninteresting. Did get a photo of the back half of a coyote as he passed by so there may be a wake-up time issue in some instances. Will try other areas of the yard. Still have some deer and javalina pictures to take.

Reviews.Title: waste of money
Reviews.Author: ruth weigand daugherty
Reviews.Content: worked for two weeks  i have tried several sd cards still does not work  wasted money on the camera and the sd cards

Reviews.Title: would buy it again
Reviews.Author: Kathy b
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use right out of the box.  I am still on the original set of batteries and have been using it every day/night since I got it the first part of April.  The pictures are very good and most of ours are taken at night but are still clear.

Reviews.Title: good while it lasted
Reviews.Author: Paul P
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera 14 months ago and used it about 25 times total. The rest of the time it sat. It failed to work after 14 months. It worked great while it lasted.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: Got this camera to watch some fox that have moved in. Works great. My only issues with it is that it doesn't have great night range and that the raccoons seem to love it. wherever I put it, they have their little faces in it.

Reviews.Title: Works great- updated product info
Reviews.Author: Tom Plum "Tom Plum"
Reviews.Content: Takes good pics,and seems capable at what it is meant to do. The new manual says it will take up to a 32GB SDHC card. Plus the shutter is silent. Just the infrared lights up for evening pics- with no sound.

Reviews.Title: NOT VERY SATISFIED
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: I recieved the camera in the promised shipping period and everything seemed to bein good condition. I purchased the proper batteries and card, set up the cam as perinstructions (even viewed set-up on line). the next evening I put it out along witha fresh bucket of feed. The next morning the yard was full of tracks, the feed wasgone and there were NO pictures. Turns out the camera was defective. I sent it backand as yet I have not seen the replacement. I don't think I'll be buying another oneof them anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: Corrupts memory card frequently
Reviews.Author: Sports Guy 318 "Sportsguy318"
Reviews.Content: The camera worked fine for about a week, then the memory card was corrupted changing from jpg format to an .if format. When I sent in a work ticket, I was told to reformat the card, which I did and it worked for a while. I would take a separate disk to the camera and swap them out, bringing one back to upload photos to my computer and a separate disk was corrupted when I tried to read it.Today, the card was not readable again. When I called customer service, I was told I was number five in line and it would be approximately 20 minutes until someone could speak to me.Previously, I called and was told I was number three in line and the wait time was approximately 12 minutes. I don't have time to wait on a phone.The written response I got on the first contact was simply advising me to reformat the card and they sent directions on how to do that process, which I already knew how to do.Simply stated, the camera is taking good photos, but it is somehow corrupting the disk. My PC is fully-loaded with the best virus scan software and my registry is checked daily for any errors.This is my first camera of this kind and it is enjoyable to see what creeps around my property, but the next time I use it I am going to dump all the photos onto my PC's HD so I don't lose them anymore.

Reviews.Title: Very picky on brand of SD card
Reviews.Author: Jaeger
Reviews.Content: I used 2 different PNY brand cards and neither one worked.Tried those same 2 cards in my normal digital camera and they work fine.Tried 2 Sandisk brand cards in the device and both worked.So clearly the device does not work with a certain brand of SD card but will work with others.Once you get past that hurdle, it works as you would expect and I'm happy with the quality of the pics and videos.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: gg
Reviews.Content: This camera works fine if you live in a dry part of the country.  I gave this review 3 stars because, the camera is suppose to be waterproof.  After just one night out in the cold low lying clouds it had accumulated enough moisture to make all the pictures come out blurry.  The other thing that I did  not like is that the camera's range at night was maybe 20 ft at best, this was with the highest sensitivity set too.  This was advertised at about 40 ft at night.  Other than these 2 issues the camera works fine, which is why if you live in a part of the country that's dry most of the time, this camera will work just fine.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: LarryM "LarryM"
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera in all kinds of weather and it always works great. Hss good battery life to.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35
Reviews.Author: Alan Kidson
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money. Battery life is excellent, daytime picture resolution is very good. Night shots are ok, effective range seems to be about 25 ft, but very few false alarms. Usually when a photo is taken, there is an animal captured on screen, unlike other cameras I've used that will false constantly. Very good product.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Psyched123
Reviews.Content: I bought a game camera a few years ago that never really got good pics.  This camera works!!  After the success with my first one I bought two more and, now, I just ordered another three.  It is super easy to set up and maintain.  I go out on our ranch every morning to collect the memory cards and my wife and I enjoy watching all the activity that happened last night - foxes, pigs, deer, coyote.  I can't believe the high quality for the low price.  I've found the video to be the most satisfying and with an 8GB card you have plenty for room for it.  Also, the batteries last and last.  Congrats for making a great game camera!

Reviews.Title: Primos truth cam 35
Reviews.Author: Rodney Joe Engle
Reviews.Content: I haven't used any other cameras but I love  the Truth Cam. Inexpensive, idiot proof and does what you'd want a trail cam to do. I bought a Python cable lock and a pair of SD cards and I was off and running. I can look at the pics on my camera in the field but not video (my camera is a bit older). I didn't think I'd use video but it's a lot more useful than a still pic. Some of the day time pics are dark, the night mode is black and white but easy to see. Using multiple shots per event helps see what triggerd the camera. Cost vs. performance combined with ease of use makes this a steal. I've since bought another one.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA FOR THE PRICE!
Reviews.Author: Willysdee
Reviews.Content: We have paid up to $500 for hunting/game camera's in the past - and all of them have been fine - or just okay, but for the price of this camera - it's by far the best one we have.  It does not flash at all - it has night vision - super important so anyone or anything in view is not made aware of, or scared off by it; it's lightweight and has great battery life, and with a 2G card, also purchased with AMAZON - I left it outside for 2 weeks and it's still clicking away.  Also does not have to be reset with time, etc after changing the batteries - it saves the info - how great is that!  SUPER great deal.  I should have bought 2, but I thought I would see how it was first, for only $88. When seeing AMAZON prices and deals, I always think "great deal". But then I worry "you get what you pay for" - not true with this camera - you get SO much more than expected. I will definitely be buying another one or two!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Buck Huntin "fishnfool"
Reviews.Content: Didn't experience any of the problems from previous reviews that I had read about this camera. No audible clunking from the shutter, no blur in the photos etc.  Daytime photos are excellent and night time photos of bucks from close to forty feet showed visible definition of the antlers.  I couldn't be happier with the value that I received in purchasing this camera.

Reviews.Title: I'm impressed
Reviews.Author: Theodore John
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to get a motion sensor camera for my second home in upstate New York.  Primarily for security purposes and also because I am a wildlife nut.  I've been curious of what animals are roaming around my back yard when I'm not there.  I got the camera when I was on vacation and I set it up, sadly my generator did keep the wildlife away, but it did take a picture everytime I walked into the back yard.  I have the camera set on a tree in a rear corner of my grassy area in the backyard and it's approximately 55 feet from the corner of my driveway and it detected my movement and took a picture (daytime).  It did take a few night time shots and did catch a deer from about 20 feet away and it was crystal clear.  All of the pictures it took so far are fantastic.  Clear, no blur and sharp.The one error I did make was with regard to the sensitivity.  The instructions state that during the warmer months you'll need to set the sensitivity to "High" so the camera can differentiate between body heat and other objects.  My home is in rural farmland and forest and I've been trying to determine if I have a bear or coyote (or both) roaming through my backyard.  I left some chicken bones out one night and they were gone the next morning.  Sadly the sensitivity was on "Normal".  Had it been on "High" I would have captured the critter that took them!  Other than that, the camera has been great and I plan to buy a second or third one.The camera does not come with an SD card so you'll have to get those.  I did and I also got the cable lock (highly recommended).Well I've been away from the house for two weeks and I'll find out this coming weekend what's been going on there.  I hope I see lots of critters!!  I'll let you all know how the camera did.Ted

Reviews.Title: The Primos Trail Cam 35 exceeds my expectations!
Reviews.Author: ralphtt
Reviews.Content: Previously considered purchase of a trail camera on several occasions but was concerned about reliability and picture quality. Read reviews here and on other websites and decided to try the Trail Cam 35. At this price, how can you go wrong? ;^)Received the camera about 4 pm and had it installed and operating by 5 pm. Drove by on my garden tractor just after 6 pm and the doggone thing took my picture! Then we got multiple pix that night of deer visiting our salt block and even a couple of racoons that I didn't know about.Looking forward to learning about other critters that frequent our back yard here in the hills of northeast Tennessee.

Reviews.Title: Ok in day, but flash not working
Reviews.Author: Johan
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I did not have a great deal of satisfaction so far. The flash started giving problems right out of the box. First I thought it was my SD card or batteries but I connected it to a 6V wallplug transformer and still had the same problems. It stops taking photos at some point and sometimes the flash just remains on. I am still very hopeful though that it was only a factory dud or something and wish to return it soon. The photos that it took seemed ok and was basically what I expected (quality wise) for the price it is good. If I remember I will try to give an update on their service and whether they could fix the other problems.

Reviews.Title: Everything I read it would be.
Reviews.Author: Melissa Howard
Reviews.Content: This product was true to the description and I received it very quickly.  I was pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Truth Cam 35
Reviews.Author: SBT
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent well priced automatic camera to leave outside on the trail. I use it to track the movements of game. It is not useful for anything else. The camera will not stand by itself on a table, it prefers being strapped to trees.You might think, "I could use this to keep track of who's coming into my garage and borrowing my tools".They'd have to be as slow as deer because the large case is very conspicuous, as well as are the bright red LEDs that it uses to illuminate the subject. I think they could have done better with the design. It looks like a camera, but I guess that's fine if all you want to keep track of is deer, which are usually very truthful anyway so I don't understand the implication of the name.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth
Reviews.Author: bdb
Reviews.Content: Very happy with purchase. I've had it in the woods for a month now. Processed about 3000 pics all on the same set of batteries. For the money this camera performs very well. I would buy another. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: great pictures
Reviews.Author: danj65
Reviews.Content: this camera replaced my Moultree D-40. The Truthcam 35 is,1 easier to use/program, with switches instead of menues, memory card difficult to remove on moultree.2 sharper daytime photos3 inferred, no flash, Moultree had better (color) nighttime photos, but they were flash photos. Truthcam had black and white night photos, but adequate detail.4 not sure of battery life at this time.

Reviews.Title: Grangerman
Reviews.Author: Grangerman "Mike"
Reviews.Content: Nice camera and a good deal for the $'s. Only thing I do not like is the camera makes a click when taking a picture and it tends to spook the deer. I have the unit set to get 3 quick shots, and practically every second and third picture show the deer breaking into a run. Otherwise, I like the unit and it provides good pics and battery life.

Reviews.Title: Quality product
Reviews.Author: William W. Lachowecki "Polish Pounder"
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful. For 100 bucks you can't go wrong. I have had it in the woods a month now and it has taken well over 1000 pictures. The batteries are still at 70%. I am getting there higher end camera for xmas. It does make a slight clicking sound when taking pictures but it doesn't seem to scare the game.Update. Have had this camera I. The woods since I bought it. Replaced batteries once. Hast taken many great pics.

Reviews.Title: Truth Cam 35
Reviews.Author: Sid V
Reviews.Content: I'm satisfied with the picture quality and ease of set up however the temperature reading and battery life meter is not at all accurate.

Reviews.Title: Really Great Bargain
Reviews.Author: Debbie "debbie"
Reviews.Content: My husband LOVES this camera. We have 12 acres in the country that we visit on weekends, and he feeds the wildlife. We get beautiful daytime shots and nice night ones. Pictures are clear and crisp. The photo quality is amazing for the price. It is extremely simple to use as well. This is our second one....the first finally died after much use and abuse. Remember to purchase (4) D batteries and a 7 or 8 GB SD card so you'll be good to go when you receive it.The only negative that I can come up with is that they use the plastic packaging that is molded to the camera; SO hard to get open. I almost always cut myself trying. But that's the packaging, not the camera. The camera is fantastic....highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Nancy
Reviews.Content: We spent several hours trying to get the camera to work. We called customer service and spoke to a very helpful tech after spending 57 minutes on hold. After trying all of the things suggested, it was finally decided that it was defective. We returned it and bought a different one.

Reviews.Title: Night pictures??
Reviews.Author: DJP
Reviews.Content: I would not get an infrared camera again...not this one at least.  It reacts too slowly or not at all for night pictures.  I wanted to be able to get night pictures and would only get a flash camera again, if I reordered.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: T. Smith "Pubert Adams"
Reviews.Content: Six words, buy it, buy it buy it!This is used in ghost hunting, fantasic unit, easy to set up, I hate to use this but it is "set it & forget it".You will not be disappointed, I liked it so well I bought a second one, I know I will be back for more.

Reviews.Title: Junk. By far the worst!
Reviews.Author: jake
Reviews.Content: Received it in no time which was a big plus. Easy to funtion. Took it to a nice hunting spot to try out the device, left it there for exactly 5 days and when I went and got it, it wouldnt turn on. Replaced batteries and it still didnt work. I contact the seller and he refused to exchange or hand me my money back. His reasons was that the camera was perfectly fine before hand and wasnt tampered with. So the seller pretty much blamed me and screwed me at the same time.Horrible customer service over this item. Very very poor and its sad how other americans will screw us over just to get money in there pocket. I DO NOT RECOMMEND PURCHASING FROM THIS SELLER!!!

Reviews.Title: Bad Trigger on first time set up
Reviews.Author: J. St Pierre
Reviews.Content: I set up the camera for the first time with  new batteries and a new SD card.  I went back 2 1/2 weeks later and it had taken over 19,000 photos of NOTHING in 3 days and wore those new batteries down to 10% and filled the SD card!  I called Primos and was told I had to return the camera at my own expense to have it looked at, but it sounded like a trigger problem!  I lost new batteries and 2 weeks of camera time! Thank God for Amazon's return policy so I was able to return it to them.  I have a replacement coming and will decide whether the one I received was a bad camera, or whether the Truth Cam 35 is a bad camera!

Reviews.Title: No night pics
Reviews.Author: J. Bambule
Reviews.Content: Camera takes pics great during the day but at night not one picture deer and other animals have eaten up all my food without a single picture. This is a brand new camera. Unacceptable!

Reviews.Title: Just a couple of remarks from a "newbie"
Reviews.Author: Lost in the Forest
Reviews.Content: I was not familiar with critter cams, so I was unaware that you can't use the camera to view the pictures taken.  You need to remove the Sandisk (not included) and view the photos on it with another device.  I have a Cannon Powershot, and it read the disk just fine.  You should also be aware that the camera requires four D-cell batteries (not included) to operate.Setup was fairly easy.  One minor nit on the user manual -- it should show the proper orientation for the Sandisk when installing it in the slot (Sandisk label facing the front of the camera, end with the copper contacts goes in first).  And note, it's much easier to install/remove the Sandisk with the camera "door" open -- it says that in the manual, but I missed it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for a reasonable price!
Reviews.Author: Kacie G.
Reviews.Content: This camera is quite easy to use, takes clear pictures, and the night shots are great and can be easily hidden!

Reviews.Title: Lasted only 6 months
Reviews.Author: Brewtown Stumblers
Reviews.Content: Bought this in April, 6 months later, the infrared light stopped working so no more night shots, then a couple days later the chip will no longer click/stay in.

Reviews.Title: Non-performer
Reviews.Author: JMG
Reviews.Content: Bought the Bushnell Trophy Cam and was less than satisfied.  So, reading the reviews that were pretty positive I thought I'd give this one a try.  I set it up at the same location as the Bushnell. Wouldn't take any night photos.  Returned and replaced by Primos. Second camera took some night photos but the resolution was terrible.  Smaller mammals unrecognizable.  Deer a little better. But, then I noticed that even in the daytime smaller mammals usually weren't triggering it.  For instance, the Bushnell got a good shot of a bobcat and the Primos didn't even fire.  This was true for a couple of dogs, as well.  Decided that even though it was half the price of the Bushnell, it was less than half the performer.  Returned for refund.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable
Reviews.Author: Clinton in WA
Reviews.Content: Sure, I bought this camera to merely prove a point. I feed birds in my yard and noticed a year ago that bird seed would mysteriously be empty by morning every night. I have come face-to-face with deer in my backyard and had observed them eating the bird seed and told my girlfriend about it and of course she didn't believe me. I bought this camera, pointed it toward the feeder and the very next day I was able to prove to her what was happening...there were 3 deer that night and we had beautiful night-time pictures of the creatures feasting. The camera is very easy to setup and use and even takes great videos. The camera is about 10 yards from the feeder and it took a very neat video of squirrels raiding the feeders as well.

Reviews.Title: I like, NOT love this camera. It has its imperfections.
Reviews.Author: UniversityDoc
Reviews.Content: I live on acres of forested land with lots of wildlife and wanted to capture them in their habitat. I also needed a new camera to replace an old film type Stealth Game cam. I did a great deal of research in order to purchase a new game cam that would do a satisfactory job without costing a lot of money. There are many game cams out there, some low priced to higher end ones, not necessarily getting what you pay for anymore. I settled on this one because of the more positive views, and weighing them with the negative reviews from various websites. The price was right beating out Bass Pro shops by $16.00 plus the free shipping made it a terrific deal for me.I like this camera. It is very easy to set up and operate. It's nearly ready when you pull it out of the frustration prone packaging. All you need to do is add the SD card and batteries, adjust the settings to your choice and set it up outside. I used a 16GB card and had it sitting up for two weeks. It took 124 photos and the batteries were still charged. I replaced the card and moved it to a new spot. Be forewarned: This camera is very sensitive: most of my photos taken were of leaves from a nearby flower. I did get two nightime photos of deer, but due to the limitations of the camera at night, I believe other reviewers mentioned this, also, it is difficult to see them clearly. Though, their eyes glow from the IR and I see the deer's outlines, they're not what I expected. I want to see the deer. The day photos are sharp, clear and vibrant. The camera shows, date, time and moon phase. All in all, I like the camera, but I don't love it because the nighttime photos leave a great deal to be desired. I'll probably buy another brand of camera due to this so I can see what animals do show up.UPDATE TO MY REVIEW, UPDATE ON 12/31/11: I went out and bought two more game cameras, but this Primos wasn't it. As I already said, I don't like the b&w; nighttime infrared shots, so I went looking for a good game camera that took nighttime color photos, yet wasn't too expensive. I also don't like the cheap rubber strip at the bottom of the camera designed to keep the card dry. Mine broke after a month. I'm not a hunter; I like to view the wildlife on my property. I paid $85.00 for the Primos cam here, and for the inadequacies with that, I didn't want to spend as much for another one. I found the one I was looking for: the Moultrie D50 5mp Camera while searching the Amazon site. The reviews and capabilities and reasonable price made the decision for me, as did my personal experience with this Primos.Unlike this Primos cam, which has a cheap, rubber, breakable strip that protects the media card at the bottom of the camera, the Moultrie has the slot in the camera inside the case. You press in the card and it snaps back out. You don't have to struggle to get to the card. With the Primo cam, you need tweezers or fingernails to get the card out. The manufacturer says the D batteries should last 60 days. I had it up for three weeks for the 2nd time, and the batteries were at 0%Whether you're a hunter or a wildlife enthusiast, if you're in the market for a camera to view wildife with great day and night color photos and don't want to spend a lot of money, this isn't the camera for you. Check out the Moultrie D50 5 MP Digital Game Camera. If you're into night time infrared shots, and don't mind the rubber strip that keeps the media card dry  breaking on you, then you'll like this camera.

Reviews.Title: Multiple Issues
Reviews.Author: 4BigFish
Reviews.Content: I have 2 Truth Cam 35's.  Very easy set up out of the box.  Initially worked great for about 4 months.  Batteries last several 1000 pics.4 months later, 1 camera couldn't get it together after replacing batteries.  Eventually, after burning through 2 sets of new batteries in a couple of days it somehow has "reset" itself? and is working again.2nd camera, after 3 sets of batteries in 5 months is now blinking 0000 with the last new set of batteries installed, which is a signal it is setting up, non stop.  Can't get it to get started again.I've sent an email to Primos hopefully will hear something soon.UPDATEPrimos repaired camera at no cost.  It has been working fine ever since.

Reviews.Title: Good overall
Reviews.Author: Chmiel03
Reviews.Content: I bought these products to watch my cars in my driveway. We have had a couple incidents of vandals and I wanted to get some photos.First thing I learned is that the PIR sensor will not work through a window. Thats OK, it wasnt advertised that it could...So I set up the cameras on my basketball hoop facing my driveway. I added the 4 batteries, a 8GB SD car, turned the unit on to photo and put it on the low setting.24 later I checked the evidence. The card had recorded about 1900 images! A bit unexpected...I started going through the photos ad it seems like the unit took photos every 30 second or so (5 at a time). It was great for watching the day go by but not what i wanted.I'm surprised that at the low setting the sensor just kept going. I actually purchased 2 units and both do this. I don't know if my neighborhood environment messes it up because its not in the woods.One camera was placed near the roof of my house pointing down on the cars the other was on a pole pointing level with the ground. So IR interference was different for both cameras. Its not like both were picking up heat from far away.Anyway its not too big a deal because i can just hold down the next button on my image viewer and go through the batch in about 6-8 minutes. The real problem is that 1900 photos kills the batteries in less than to days.

Reviews.Title: Not worth a hoot
Reviews.Author: J. D. Rogers
Reviews.Content: I've had this and other Primos trail cameras and they consistantly have a slow shutter and fail within 18 months of first use. On two of them the SD card reader failed and the other just would not function. Your money is better spent elsewhere. check out [...]

Reviews.Title: Card Reader Unoperative
Reviews.Author: gene
Reviews.Content: .I have about 20 cameras scattered around my 310 acres.  I have been a believer in Stealth and Moultrie game cams..which is mostly what I have.  I ordered the Primos Truth Cam about six months ago...Regretfully I didn't attempt to use it until last week..  Even worse I couldn't find the paperwork on the cam...since I have never had a problem with the Stealths and Moultrie cam, I didn't think I would need it...When I attempted to use it, I kept getting a"no SD" signal. .  I used MANY SD carts in an attempt for it to operate... Nothing happened...I called Primos and they said "you must show proof of purchase" before we can issues an RMA (return material authorization)...  I fully understand this and will not discredit their policy, however this camera is the worst I have encountered and will NEVER buy anything from Primos again... Lost only a few dollars to learn a valuable lesson.  My advise stay with Moultrie and Stealth.  (Moultrie will repair without a rma, but of course you have to pay for the repairs)  I told them I was willing to pay for the repairs, but to no avail....  Gene Delp  Salem, Va, 540 312 1979

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Lalie
Reviews.Content: I'm a birder, photographer and my husband and I love scenery, travel and animals.We live in a condo.A lot of people said this is not for taking photos of birds.  Wrong!We have hummingbirds.  We set this device up.  As most photographers know, you have to take a lot of photos, and pick outyour best.  Yesterday after work, we took the memory card out, deleted the unwanted photos and a lot of photos of thehummingbirds showed up.Our condo is in the back which is the best.  You get to see more wildlife and have a great chance for photos.This camera does the work!

Reviews.Title: No nighttime pictures!
Reviews.Author: wertach
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures during the day, but for some reason it doesn't take nighttime pictures.I forgot to register it because I bought it months before I planned to use it, so I don't think I have a warranty.

Reviews.Title: Well made, works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Watson
Reviews.Content: I bought this to see what kind of critter was digging a hole in our backyard.  The camera has a delay before it takes a picture, so quick moving stuff will trigger it, but not be caught on photo mode.  Video works better for stuff that moves in and out of the scene because once triggered (10 sec later, I believe), the critter may return.  Wouldn't leave in a place where it could get stolen, though.  You can buy big metal boxes with locks for these.  Needs SD card and 4 D batteries.  Night vision works pretty well.  It was a bird, by the way.

Reviews.Title: These are junk
Reviews.Author: CEEBEE
Reviews.Content: I have two of these cameras used on our property to watch who may come in when we're gone.  They have been VERY UNRELIABLE!  The sensitivity is hit or miss.  I''ve tried all the settings and sometimes it will trigger and sometimes it won't.  Both cams do this.  The worst part is the SD cards will be automatically reformatted when the batteries die.  This means ALL your stored photos on the disc to that point are erased.  The battery life is horrible... they each take 4 D cells.  When you swap out the batteries you must reprogram the date and time settings.  It's a hassle to work with these.  One stopped working early on and the company did eventually replace it at no charge to me.  I think they're used to this as these are pure imported junk.  Counting the replacement, I've had three and they all were the same... so I doubt I "lucked out" and got 3 lemons.  I can't believe they've sold these things for as long as they have.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Adam Kanczuzewski
Reviews.Content: Camera works amazing in all conditions. It works well in the night as well, the photos needed some photo-shopping to brighten and darken some images but after that everything was awesome. Beautiful pictures of deer, turkey and etc.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: Robin "Goat Mom"
Reviews.Content: We enjoy seeing what animals are up to on our property and also understand why are dogs bark sometimes! Night quality allows for easy identification of animals, daytime quality fantastic and love tracking movement patterns. I bought for my hubby but we have both enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: Does not work
Reviews.Author: Madden
Reviews.Content: This is a horrible trail camera - I wish Amazon had a rating of less than 1 star as this camera doesn't even deserve that. I have used several different trail cameras to monitor wildlife as part of my job. I know how to set one up, and I know how it should work. I bought this camera for my boyfriend for Christmas but we had not had an opportunity to use it until this weekend. We spent 2 hours messing with it and trying to get it to trigger. The batteries were brand new, we adjusted the height, the settings, etc and could not get it to take a picture when anyone walked into the field of view. The only time it took a picture was when I was setting it up and had my face right in front of it. It's too late to return it as I missed the return window. Guess we are stuck with a $100 piece of junk. Will NEVER buy a Primos camera again.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: Greg Poncelet
Reviews.Content: I have the 35 Ultra and this camera is almost impossible to get to work because it is very, very, very finicky about the SD card you put in it!! Do NOT buy this piece of trash!!!! Mines going back!

Reviews.Title: bought for boyfriend
Reviews.Author: jessy
Reviews.Content: He has several of these cameras and he always wants more of this product. I will be buying another one real soon.

Reviews.Title: Bought, used once...2 months later will not turn on
Reviews.Author: Susan Haymaker
Reviews.Content: I bought this through Amazon in Jan.  Tried it out at home and it worked great.  Took it to our mountain cabin and set it up in March.  It would not turn on at all.  Because I bought it through Amazon, I was past the return deadline.  Now what do I do??  I have contacted Primos via email and have not heard back.  Hope they cover it. , otherwise I wasted $80

Reviews.Title: Great Cam for price.
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Great quality pics.  Have not shot any video at all yet.  Battery life is amazing!  Only Con is lots of false positives or something is going in and out of frame very fast, maybe weather.  For the price you still cant beat this cam.

Reviews.Title: Great "PASSIVE" home security system
Reviews.Author: JM "Jason"
Reviews.Content: It's not going to stop an intruder, but it'll definitely get a parked vehicle's license plate #, time, date, and a face for identification.  Also provides entertaining cat/skunk/dog pictures.  Very easy to use, and pictures are sharp.My wireless LAN cameras failed in a storm, but this thing kept working and gave me a pic-by-pic play of who visited my house and when.  No-one noticed it in the tree (nobody looked at it directly) so I think if you planned out the location, you'd be pretty safe to hang it in a vacant building like I did.Battery life seems to be indefinite - ran for 3 months without issue.  Card size was SANDISK 16Gb and took a hundred pics or so.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Margaret L. Cooper "Maggie Cooper"
Reviews.Content: The primos truth Cam 35 gives high quality pictures at night or during the day.  With its motion activated sensor, you can capture wildlife in many activities.  A great way to start a new photography hobby.

Reviews.Title: So far it's just OK
Reviews.Author: R. L. Baker "the Critic"
Reviews.Content: It's lost the rubber gasket right off the bat. It came loose/off and there was no way I could coax, wiggle, jiggle, trick or manifpulate with sweet talk that fandangle thing.Well if it's raining and it usually is here....the pics are blurred by rain. I will give more feedback after more experience with it. Having just purchased the tree attaching arm.I will keep this, but so far I'm not impressed as all the other reviewers who influenced my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Better options are probably available.
Reviews.Author: michael b
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these, one works the other did not.  It would not even turn on. The one that does work has been up for about a month. No complaints yet, but I don't know what the battery life is.  Could get expensive.  Also, these lower priced cameras DO NOT come with a memory card.  If you factor in the cost of buying a card after you get the camera, its probably best to spend a little extra.  Amazon return policy was very easy and the refund was prompt.  Manufacturer does not repair these cameras at any time, will only send a replacement so they must know they are crappy design.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with product
Reviews.Author: Vicki L. Chilbert
Reviews.Content: It works great, pictures very clear, just as advertised. Batteries seem to last longer than I expected too!  It shows the time of the photos also which is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: Get about 50% satisfaction
Reviews.Author: Matthew Creighton
Reviews.Content: I have one camera that works well.  It takes OK pictures in the day and night, but sometimes are difficult to count points accurately on the antlers.  The other camera will not save pictures to the disk. That has been frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I used the 'normal' sensitivity which is pretty good at captures birds & chimpmunks on that setting.  Very good product for the money as well.

Reviews.Title: Great until batteries wear down a bit
Reviews.Author: C.L. Crabtree
Reviews.Content: Once the batteries get low, the trigger speed and flash get terrible on this. It's almost like you have a 3 week window where it works good with batteries, then you have to replace if you want optimum quality. Still a great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: R. Cole
Reviews.Content: I set this up to capture both video and still pictures.  Quality is very good and captures nighttime animals well enough to see them.  Sensor is sensitive to capture animals 20 feet away and image quality is surprisingly good.  You can set to still image or video and high or low sensitivity,  No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Rhonda G.
Reviews.Content: This camera was about double the size I was expecting. I have not actually used it yet, but I am very pleased with it as it came.

Reviews.Title: worked for 2 days
Reviews.Author: travis mathwig
Reviews.Content: I got this for a friend who was suspicious of activity around her home .I tested it first at my house & took a whole bunch of boring pics of my dogs laying around all day doing dog stuff. It worked as I thought it would. Although all the photos & videoss were black & white. When I brought it to where it was needed, it took a couple videos of me setting it up and basically stopped working from then on. I can dance around in front of this thing for hours and it doesn't record anything. Once in a while when I first turn it on after the 30 second  boot time it will take a single occurrence string of photos. so something must we whack with the motion detection part of the cam? either way, it's going back.  we've decided on a DVR surveillance system for the application.

Reviews.Title: Not Very Good
Reviews.Author: Eugene McDermott
Reviews.Content: This camera performed acceptably at first.Then it would just stop working, even with a new set of batteries.After a reboot, or a different set of batteries, it would usually "come (back) to life".I'm sending it back to Bushnell/Primos now (communication with them, and the return process, is a bit convoluted compared to other companies I have dealt with)Time will tell

Reviews.Title: Christmas Gift
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Flanagan
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my Hubby for Christmas and he loves it! Shopped around online here on Amazon and on the net in general and found this to be the best product for the money in this price range.

Reviews.Title: takes alot of pictures
Reviews.Author: Tuco S.
Reviews.Content: Pictures look good, good quality. I keep it on "low sensitivity" and it still snaps 700 or photos in a few days, pictures of nothing, there is no movement directly in it's path. It takes more pics in the day than night. It's a fun toy that works.

Reviews.Title: Stops working
Reviews.Author: houtex
Reviews.Content: I don't remember reading all of these bad reviews when I bought this turd, but I guess I should have paid more attention. Worked for 3 months now won't power up. Pics were pretty good, but reliability is the most important thing and clearly there is an issue with Primos cameras.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy Primos products!
Reviews.Author: Ricky Gerontis
Reviews.Content: In less then 2 years the control buttons gave out, which makes the purchase a waste of money.  Cheaply made.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: donald archambault II
Reviews.Content: For the money this camera is the bomb, easy operating long batter life and great pictures cant wait to show my hunting buddies!

Reviews.Title: Very sensative
Reviews.Author: Bigfoot
Reviews.Content: Takes to many pictures.  Affected by wind, leaves, birds, just about anything.  Can take 200-300 pictures a day. Lot of wasted time deleting pictures.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for the price!
Reviews.Author: Jake Burke
Reviews.Content: I had read up on some of the reviews on this about SD cards not working and it failing after a few weeks so i waited to write this.All i can say is so far so good, i bought the SandDisk 16GB SDHC memory card for it and even with a house with 4 animals i have yet to come even close to making a dent in the memory, i have it on 3 shot so it snaps 3 photos and it is very quick to do so, the wake up time is a bit of a drag but once it is up it works perfect.I have been using this Inside and out, i tested it inside for the first week and caught everything that went by my stairs, tried it outside in Minnesota weather and it still works like a charm! Lots of cars driving by, but with the cold and snow it is a solid little box!

Reviews.Title: Love Primos
Reviews.Author: C. M.
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad to say.  Cam has worked flawlessly.  Picked up animals farther away than what the specs said.  Great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: It was not working after using it for 3 weekend...
Reviews.Author: Marcos Salama
Reviews.Content: Hi,Used it 3 weekends in a row, on the photo mode. No problem till then.The fourth time I tried to use it for, it would not turn on. This is very disappointing. I stored in inside, during the week, and on the weekends it was inside a shelter, so it could not get wet. Still it broke down.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: mindytyson3
Reviews.Content: The camera works great and it captures lots of deers and hogs!  My boyfriend checks it everyday and it takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: Alexandra C. Walsh
Reviews.Content: These cameras are worth the money. The night time shots are perfect and crystal clear, The day time photos show everything. Well worth the money and plan on ordering more! Great use for home surveillance

Reviews.Title: Truth Cam 35
Reviews.Author: Gary Stanke
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera for the price. Very easy to operate. Good battery life. The only thing I would like to see incorporated is a  5 minute delay between photos.

Reviews.Title: Solid camera
Reviews.Author: B SYKES
Reviews.Content: It's a solid camera.  Some people may want higher resolution photos.  You can't beat the performance at this price, they are tough.

Reviews.Title: functions good
Reviews.Author: Linda Dorr
Reviews.Content: Have tried several others and this camera seems to function better.  Drawback is that sometimes you have blank pics or partial pics of deer...nighttime shots are just okay, could be better.

Reviews.Title: 1st quit working, 2nd one is fine
Reviews.Author: Jim Heid
Reviews.Content: Amazon shipped a replacement to me the next day.  It takes nice photos and next fall I'll use it to really get a handle on where the deer are.  Until then I might use it for home security if I can mount it in the right inconspicous place.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: On the negative side, with normal sensitivity setting it took empty photos every couple seconds in more than one location with no branches or leaves in front of it.  When I switched it to low sensitivity it took almost no pictures, including when I walked by at a normal pace.  The night time pictures were all black so the flash not working or something.On the plus side good battery life - after taking thousands of empty pictures still had 80% battery left.

Reviews.Title: Great Critter Cam!
Reviews.Author: Katz07
Reviews.Content: This was a gift to a nature loving brother. He is very pleased, especially that it uses infra-red and not a flash, so the critters aren't startled. He found it easy to mount and operate, and is happy with his preliminary results.

Reviews.Title: A good basic trail cam
Reviews.Author: Michael Hedlesky
Reviews.Content: Excellent battery life, very easy to operate, pictures not great quality but clear enough to see details. good sensitivity adjustment

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Linford Brown
Reviews.Content: This is my second one because I love to see whats going on outside in the woods. they are dependable easy to use and take great pictures for the price.

Reviews.Title: An Easy Setup andReliable Night Cam
Reviews.Author: PDot4
Reviews.Content: I have problems with raccoon ruining my grass but couldn't confirm if other animals/vandals are involved.  I ordered this cam because of its reviews by others and its price.  It really works.  It has be left out in front of my house for about 3 weeks with 4 batteries.  Every other day we retrieve the SD card and sure enough we see raccoon, scums, and peacocks roaming around.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: wayne purcell
