Reviews.Content: This is a high quality product and very easy to install and use. The disk works great as well. Not much range at night however.

Reviews.Title: Lasted a week
Reviews.Author: Ryan J Affleck
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 like a idiot.  One is still working we will see how long that lasts, the other one wont even turn on after about a week of use.  We will see how warranty works with company, will report back

Reviews.Title: 4 DAYS ONLY
Reviews.Author: Dreamcatcher "Douglas"
Reviews.Content: After only four days this camera stopped working completely. I did everything I could to to make it work again.  A Primos product will never grace my door again, never.  Not only a waste of my time, but when I needed it most, it wasn't there for me...  The price was right for what the add said I would get, but that old saying (you get what you pay for) still applies today.

Reviews.Title: Lasted 1 season
Reviews.Author: ThisIsTheBestDayOfMyLife
Reviews.Content: It lasted 1 season and then no more night shots.  Forget this brand, they offered to sell me another one.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Tomi Lee
Reviews.Content: Takes great pics in day and night! Captures anything that moves!! I would highly recommend this camera! Perfect for the first time user.

Reviews.Title: Great Hunter Gift
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Prestage
Reviews.Content: Got this gift for my husband for Christmas. He has had several deer cameras before but this one is by far his favorite! He has taken several thousand pictures and the battery is still going strong.  I would suggest it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35 Camera
Reviews.Author: a57302
Reviews.Content: Works fine during the day but really excels on taking completely black pics at night. Piece of nightime crap, not worth the shipping cost much less the retail price..

Reviews.Title: Night pictures were dark
Reviews.Author: Annliz
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to view the wildlife in my yard especially during the night.  The daytime pictures were stunning and very clear.  Yet the night vision was dark and sometimes every blurry.  I thought maybe outside porch lighting was causing a problem, but after just a few nights use, the images were almost completely dark and you could hardly make out the deer being captured.  The deer were fairly close (within 15 ft) of the the camera so the pictures should have been much clearer.  Sadly I returned the camera for a refund as I believe there was something wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: Love the Prismos camera
Reviews.Author: gabriele mellott
Reviews.Content: I have tried many trail camera's over the years.  These are the best trail camera's for the price.  If you want to see what is going on during the day or night then I highly recommend that you get this one.  This is my second one to replace the other camera's which have to slow of a wake up.  Save yourself the headache.  The tree strap is also easier then the old shoe string style.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Dane
Reviews.Content: Great game/security cam day time pictures are clear an detailed night time is good easy set up an battery life is crazy! 4-D cells hold up nice will catch a lot of action or thief trying get away! Got one of the “ultra” cams took it back was pile of junk plus takes 8 AA batteries to run that’s bout the only difference I see in big cam verses little cam save the money!!

Reviews.Title: This thing is HUGE!!!
Reviews.Author: xacex
Reviews.Content: This is almost twice the size of most trail cams, and would be difficult to conceal. I didn't even take it out of the clam shell before I sent it back because of its size. If you want a trail cam to use on your own property where no one enters but you it will work. You wont be hiding this thing out in public land.

Reviews.Title: Great for the Price and Quality!
Reviews.Author: Autumn Love
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera in early September, 2013, to use this season. Battery life of this camera is excellent as one set of cheap batteries lasted about 3 months. I got several photo's and for the price the quality of the photo's taken by this camera are great, sometimes a little soft but for the price totally worth it. The infrared light is great when you use them correctly at the right distance between 5-20 feet, too close blown out too far not light enough. The transition between night and day can sometimes be a little dark as the infrared doesn't go off sometimes. It does make some noise when it takes a picture but it did not seem to bother the deer too much. The strap to secure the camera to the tree is very sturdy but can be a little tricky at first, it really depends on which direction you run the strap through the loops. Overall I am very pleased with this camera and will be purchasing another very soon.

Reviews.Title: Deletes photos
Reviews.Author: cyson orr
Reviews.Content: This camera sucks, i checked it last week and had like 15 videos, I went to check it today (2 days later) with the same SD card in it and it said it didn't even have one pic on it when there was sighn everywhere and there was already photos and videos on it before!

Reviews.Title: batteries die fast
Reviews.Author: jast0019
Reviews.Content: owned for a day and returned the product.... put in new batteries... and within a day all were 60% used and only 10 pictures... the batteries are used to charge some "internal" battery.  like I said, returned and bought a different brand and much more satisfied.  the camera does not like cold temperatures either...

Reviews.Title: Cannot recommend. Not reliable
Reviews.Author: G Kent
Reviews.Content: Not reliable, difficult to see if its working , not a good buy. I would not recommend it . Read reviews before buying. Not easy to return. manufacturer wants $20 up front.

Reviews.Title: Forest cam
Reviews.Author: Susan M. Williams
Reviews.Content: Great battery life! Easy to mount. Larger than expected but worth the purchase. I'd buy the same cam all over again.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures for the price
Reviews.Author: Mark Hackford
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised at the quality of the photos that this camera takes, even at night.I have some photos that look like they were taken with an ordinary camera. The batteries lasted for months and took thousands of pictures. I could not believe the size of the deer visiting my apple orchard in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera by Far!
Reviews.Author: Dfalk "Deba"
Reviews.Content: Love the day and night photos.  I have had three other brandsthat cannot compare to Primos.  The drawback is after 1.5 years, it startseating battery life and the batteries do not last a month.  I keep coming back becauseof the excellent pictures.  If you are looking for quality pics of the animals, this is it!

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC
Reviews.Author: Stacy N. Shetterly
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my boyfriend for Christmas from the kids and he LOVES it. It is posted in our backyard right now catching anything that happens... Great Quality photos and videos!

Reviews.Title: works some of the time
Reviews.Author: Eglide
Reviews.Content: Not sure if it's me or the camera but sometimes it's perfect and others there is nothing on it. Does ok on battery useage and the night shots are not that great.

Reviews.Title: Got the DREADED SDFUL Error
Reviews.Author: Randy L Henderson
Reviews.Content: When it worked, it was GREAT....But after about three weeks of use, spread over a couple of years, it is now DEAD with the SDFUL error that apparently is unfixable....I have bougth a total of 4 Primos Cameras, to include TWO of the newest Blackout Ultra Cameras this month...AND ALL FOUR are now DEAD. The newest models have a MAJOR battery issue that not only chews up batteries like crazy, but also blanks out the SD cards after it consumes the batteries, so you get no pictures to boot...

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: Deb Adams
Reviews.Content: bought as a gift for my dad, I had given him one last year and he wanted another. He enjoys watching the wildlife on his land.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: tim
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with all 4 of my Primus Truth Cam 35 Camera's! All look new and are working perfect! Also ordered one day and received 6 days later!

Reviews.Title: CAUGHT
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We've had some things stolen from our barn and workshop so we put this camera up and caught the little culprit. The police were very happy that we finally had proof and the kid was very sad.We've since used it out in the woods to locate wildlife and man has it worked there also. We've not only seen deer, turkey and fox but we also caught a little black bear on film..it's an awesome little tool.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat the Price
Reviews.Author: Erick J.
Reviews.Content: This the best camera on the market for the price.  The picture quality is better than some of the $200 cameras.  The only drawback is the size.  It is a little larger than a lot of the newer cameras.

Reviews.Title: Review of Camera
Reviews.Author: Phyllis English
Reviews.Content: This is a gift to our daughter-in-law and she loves this camera.  They are amazed at all the activity that goes on in their yard with their houses of chickens, rabbits, and ducks  The camera helps them to know what is in their yard at nights.

Reviews.Title: Camera is a good choice for game pictures.
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Cantrell
Reviews.Content: Camera makes good pictures, day and night.  Easy to setup and use.  Battery life has been good also.  I ordered another one because of how well it worked.

Reviews.Title: Great gift for my daughter!!
Reviews.Author: Diana Wurster
Reviews.Content: My daughter just loved her Christmas present this year both our kids love the outdoors and will really love the pictures that she can share with us of her back yard Thankyou!!

Reviews.Title: an entire year's worth of entertainment!
Reviews.Author: amazon fan
Reviews.Content: I got this for my parents last Christmas, and they have had so much fun with it. My dad moves it to different locations around the yard quite frequently and they have gotten pictures of skunk, deer, possum, raccoon, cat, squirrel, fox, the newspaper person, and trick or treaters. While some reviews have complained about the picture quality, the pictures I have seen have always surpassed my expectations. The camera continues to work well a year later. I think it's very neat that the night pictures are taken in the dark, so the animal doesn't even know its picture was taken. My family bought two more this Christmas for gifts for others. This is a great gift.

Reviews.Title: camear in the woods
Reviews.Author: bill shack
Reviews.Content: this is a great product that I had a lot of fun with this deer season. took hundreds of pictures that helped me locate some nice bucks. had it hanging out from September to December still have 60 percent battery life left. very enjoyable and useful product for extra hunting fun. if you buy it get the cable to secure to trees.

Reviews.Title: eats batteries
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: LEDs glow red; so, no good for people security. The images are good for critters that linger. Anything walking past may not be seen as there's a trigger delay.  Possums are fascinated by the lens or the lights. Eats d-size batteries like crazy. About 3 days on good batteries, 1 day on cheap ones.

Reviews.Title: Good basic trail-cam
Reviews.Author: Player Two
Reviews.Content: Catches squirrels, rabbits, raccoons, house-cats, birds, pickups, etc.  I used the default settings and had good results the first time.If you set it up aimed at bushes or grass, the sensor will pick up the grass moving in the breeze.  I found this out when I had 10,000 pictures to go through the third time I set it up.  However, after a week and all these pictures, The batteries were still showing mostly full, so I was pretty impressed with the battery life.  It also survived a couple rainy days.Cons: the infra-red led's are very visible at night.  The trail-cam may go unnoticed during the day, but becomes very obvious to anyone at night.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: A. P. Sisson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for backyard use.  It has performed exactly as I expected.  Very happy with this product.  It can be easily moved to various parts of our acre home lot to see what goes on out there.  We have a lot of wild birds, raccoons and squirrels that entertain both when we can see them as well as when only the camera sees it -- human activity can also be seen!Edited to add: This camera performed well for a month or so until I noticed that the 30 ft. reach the flash was supposed to have at night was definitely not 30 feet.  Then I began to realize that it was not picking up movement which I knew had taken place within camera range, so early in March I contacted Primos and was given instructions about sending it to a repair lab.  I did that, and about 10 days later a new camera was delivered to our home.  It is the same cam, but this one has performed less well than the first.  No night shots of any description.  I reviewed the settings with the customer service rep.  and checked them as I replaced the SD card, and still got fewer and fewer shots over longer and longer periods of time.  I asked for my money back and submitted my original invoice.  In place of a refund I've been offered an upgrade as a replacement for the camera.  I would rate their customer service as helpful, but this camera was not a good buy for me.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: David Gerlach
Reviews.Content: An excellent alternative to the Primos Trurh cam 46, 60 ,and Blackout.  A shorter range version and only 3 megapix. but great for feeder monitoring where deer are close.  All there are solw to wake(1 Sec trigger speed) but work well on mulit-picture setting(3 pic burst).  Gave it only 4 stars because I prefer the digital menue over slide switches.

Reviews.Title: Good security Camera also
Reviews.Author: C. Bass
Reviews.Content: Takes good day pictures, but night pictures have to be about 20 feet to get a clear photo. Easy to set up and use.

Reviews.Title: I like this camera.
Reviews.Author: James C. Meeks
Reviews.Content: very nice camera for the money.  I have used it a complete year now and only had to put batteries in it twice.  Takes pretty good pictures also.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Theses camera's are easy to set up and use. They work well for tracking game, etc. They do not deliver a "high" quality picture in the day time nor does the red infrared night beams light up the picture very much but again for the price you pay they do a decent job. I had a more expensive Moultrie that took great pictures but it did not last very long. Only long enough to get out of warranty. I would suggest the primos to others.

Reviews.Title: good value
Reviews.Author: mark rose
Reviews.Content: good overall quality, image's fairly clear.  the battery life is not quite as advertised but pretty good.  overall a good basic camera for the money

Reviews.Title: Fun camera
Reviews.Author: R. Runyan
Reviews.Content: Bought this to see what was wondering up and down the wash behind my property.  Got amazing night time pictures of coyotes, javelina, raccoons and the occasional human.  I put it next to my bird bath and I got some great pictures of a couple of hawks and got sampling of the neighborhood birds.  It takes some pics of waving branches and flying birds will set it off and be long gone before the 10 second delay sets in.  Not the greatest resolution but I know an artist who uses the same camera model to take pictures and then enlarges the pics to poster size and then paints and draws on the images to produce remarkable art.  Overall, its been more fun than useful but I'm not a hunter and the price wasn't bad.

Reviews.Title: GOOD
Reviews.Author: Cimacol "sace"
Reviews.Content: GOOD PRICE QUALIY CAMERA, AT NIGHT ANIMALS HAVE TO BE CLOSER, IS OK. BATTERIES LAST FOR 4- 5  MONTHS, AT DAY WITH SHADOWS EXPECT REGULAR QUIALITY

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Karen Forehand
Reviews.Content: Great pictures in light and in the dark.  Way better than expected for low price.  Would definitely recommend others to use.

Reviews.Title: works and cheap
Reviews.Author: BB
Reviews.Content: works, cheap, wont cry if stolen, cant ask more for a cheap trail cam.Had it out in West Texas sun for last year with no problems

Reviews.Title: second camera worked but also had issues
Reviews.Author: nalbert mac muffin
Reviews.Content: The first unit worked but not right would not power up by turning switch on unless you lifted the battery up to break connection then unit would power up and work fine. returned for replacement second unit working fine. Update: took the camera to my camp notice two l.e.d.s did not work when taking pictures or video. also the camera would not come out of sleep mode after a few hours of operation unless power is switched off then back on. unfortunately this is the second defective unit I received but the seller was great and shipping was fast and I really like the camera but the quality is just not there and I am forced to return yet another defective unit.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: James Beckman "Jim Beckman"
Reviews.Content: I have this camera set up at a watering trough in the desert behind my house and it has worked flawlessly.  I've captured great shots of javalinas, deer, bobcat, coyotes and birds.

Reviews.Title: Excellent wildlife camera.
Reviews.Author: D. Vetrano "DV"
Reviews.Content: Really good. Takes lots of pictures. Extremely intuitive to use and set up. Only took a few minutes. Photo quality good. Battery life great.

Reviews.Title: Does what we needed!
Reviews.Author: Andrew Ellis "radioalbany"
Reviews.Content: A reasonable "Crittercam."  Takes a while to "awake" when triggered, so it can miss the beginning of activity.  Infrared video is of marginal quality, but it does provide what we needed:  A time-stamped photo or video of nocturnal doings around the place.  Uses "D" cell batteries, which seem to last quite a few nights.  There's no port to download images, so you have to swap out the SD card to retrieve the shots.  (The LCD display DOES tell you if pictures were taken or not, though, so you won't waste time on a blank card.  Daytime full-color video is much better.

Reviews.Title: Dead on arrival. Inaccurate description.
Reviews.Author: M. Dionne
Reviews.Content: I could set the time and date, and it seemed to take three pictures each time I was done accessing the menus, but otherwise it did not work. I got no pictures either in daylight or nighttime and the green and red LEDs never lit up.The main switch to turn the LCD display on/off was flakey and I had to press it about 10 times to get a reaction. Apparently there is no quality control in the manufacturing of these devices. The low price is too good to be true.The description on Amazon says there is a back-lit LED display. NO, it is an LCD display and you'd better bring a flashlight to see it.The description says "Live screen preview for setting up field of view." This is incorrect. There is no way to set up the field of view. You just have to guess.The description says "Password protection..." There is no password protection.BEWARE: read the fine print in the manual: If you press both the UP and DOWN switches simultaneously your memory card is erased. The sticker on the device ought to tell you this.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Pia T Chrum
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my Dad it was great the picture are clear, never thought would work so well. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Camera is simple to use
Reviews.Author: Jakob
Reviews.Content: This camera is simple and works. It has held battery even through sub zero temps. After 1000 pics the battery is at 85%. It is important to note that there is a backup battery that will initially drain the four d-cells to around 70%

Reviews.Title: great value, very simple, access card from front while still mounted, no video/pic combo though
Reviews.Author: S Mac
Reviews.Content: Very simple, its either on or off.  Some of these can be so complicated you risk not getting squat cuz it was off.  I like that you can check the memory card while mounted without having to take it down.  Again, my brother has a very expensive unit (about twice this) that must be taken down because the chip is accessed through the back, not the front like this one.Pictures are what I expected day or night, good value.  I haven't tried video yet.If there is a con, I wish it let you take pictures and video with a combo button.  This unit forces you to pick EITHER pictures or video.  That's the only reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5.For the price, great value and I'll probably buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Primo Primos
Reviews.Author: NoBS
Reviews.Content: We have 6 of these now. We live in North Idaho and have had four of them for a year and a half now and two newer ones. We have never had a problem with any of these and recommend it as a very reliable and long battery lifed camera. Picture quality is superb for its resolution and the night vision is as good as you can get for this type of price point.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: L N Smith
Reviews.Content: Great product, very easy to use. Wonderful pictures with excellent definition. I was able to get a large enough flash card to hold multiple photographs or videos. Would highly recommend running when looking to monitor outside activity.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: VALVAL
Reviews.Content: Got two cameras to replace the expensive ones that quit working.  I didn't expect much for the price but they are great! Easy to set up and use and very good pictures.  I liked them so much I bought another one tonight even though I don't need it really.

Reviews.Title: Could be 5 stars..
Reviews.Author: Steven Clark
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in Nov 2012. It died suddenly 12 months later. It took many great nighttime and daytime photos...very satisfied with the quality and value. I never used the video function as I wanted  to conserve power to capture mostly nighttime activity. This would be a 5 star rating if it lived longer than 12 months. Unfortunately, its warranty expired 3 weeks before it quit.

Reviews.Title: Amazingly rugged.
Reviews.Author: Emily Rizzo
Reviews.Content: This camera gets bonus points for durability.  It has survived several bear attacks including once when the bear carried it several hundred feet then  dropped it into the snow and it still works fine with just some tooth marks on the case.  Daylight pictures are in color,  night acceptable in black and white although as the batteries wear down the pictures get darker.  Controls are so easy that even a hunter can use it.  I have personally recommended this to several friends  who were looking for an inexpensive trail camera.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: JRC2
Reviews.Content: not the best camera money can buy, but not the most expensive either.  this model is good and functions very well for the price

Reviews.Title: Not stellar
Reviews.Author: Brad Keel
Reviews.Content: Seems to always have something wrong! I bought 3 and tee is always something not working with one of them

Reviews.Title: Great Product at a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Marc
Reviews.Content: This camera has operated above and beyond what I expected. After reading some reviews for this and other cameras, I was hesitant because you tend to get what you pay for. However, I have been happily surprised by how flawlessly this camera has functioned. Pictures both day and night come in clear, and the battery life has been great. The camera has been in the woods  now for a month and has taken hundreds of pictures of deer, raccoons and even a bobcat; and the battery life is still at 88%. I will definitely be buying one or two more of these cameras in the near future.

Reviews.Title: Great value - images show enough detail.
Reviews.Author: R. Martini "-martini"
Reviews.Content: Lots of good pictures, long battery life.  Only complaint is that it sometimes seems confused in the mid afternoon hours.  I tries to take 'night time' pictures during the day and it results in over exposed images.With that said, the batteries last a long time- I have gotten thousands of pictures already this year.  Sensitivity seems appropriate at the 'normal' level, although I know for sure I have missed a few deer with it, I have gotten many pictures.

Reviews.Title: Worked then stopped
Reviews.Author: Hunter
Reviews.Content: It worked well for a week and half, then just stopped working mid week, not during battery or sd card switch, with good batteries.  I will get in contact with Primos and see about another.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: anonymoose
Reviews.Content: This is the best trail cam out there for the money.  It's large, but with the D batteries, I have it working for months on end.  It's super simple and easy to use and all you have to do is throw a few switches to set it up.  The image quality is as good as any other trail cam out there and it's nighttime photos and range are completely adequate for trails and anything other than open fields.  It's been through two Alaskan winters and it's still going strong.I would recommend buying a mount so that the camera can be swiveled and mounted up high away from thieves and larger animals.

Reviews.Title: "critter cam"  is better
Reviews.Author: cvaden
Reviews.Content: not as good as "critter cam"  that I had used before.  the pictures are not as clear and Icannot figure out how to delete old pics after downloading.

Reviews.Title: Location of Memory Card
Reviews.Author: Beverly S.
Reviews.Content: The pictures are very good.  The memory card is located on the bottom of the camera exterior, and is very hard to reach.  It is extremely awkward to retrieve without taking the camera down each time.

Reviews.Title: Decent for the price
Reviews.Author: ROCKYLAB
Reviews.Content: wish this camera gave you instant shots not a 10 second time lapse; batteries lasted for about 600 shots which I can live with.

Reviews.Title: This is great!
Reviews.Author: janice wooten
Reviews.Content: If you are wondering what sorts of critters (animal, not human) are meandering around your yard at night, this will satisfy your curiosity!  Coyotes, skunks, bobcats, as well as rabbits, squirrels, etc) were using our stock tank as their watering hole.  Very interesting!

Reviews.Title: Thousands of pictures later...
Reviews.Author: Michael Wagner
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my brother.  He has it up in his yard, on a tree, and has since last Christmas.  Since installing it in early January, it has taken just short of 8000 pictures, on the initial set of batteries.  He loves it, and plans on buying a few for himself, to try and trace specific paths taken by the animals through his property.  The night time images come out great, showing great detail (enough to count the deer, and the points on their racks, and the spots on the sides of the fawns).

Reviews.Title: Takes beautiful pictures
Reviews.Author: Alicia K. Kearney
Reviews.Content: The plus on this camera is the quality of the photos it takes, the minus is it's size. It takes "D" cell batteries and the camera itself is really big and bulky so it can hold such big batteries. You can't hide something this big, so I would be reluctant to put it out where it might get seen and stolen. It works for us because we use it for a campground camera, and even at that it might make an attractive item to steal. The bigger the tree you strap it too the less obvious it is and it's hard to strap to anything else. For instance you can't strap it to the legs on a fifth wheel. We tried, it just slides down to the ground. It doesn't have a threaded hole for a tripod, but it does have recessed threads on the back for some kind of optional mount, sold separately, of course.  All in all it's a trade off, picture quality against size and bulk. The pictures do not prepare you for it's size.

Reviews.Title: It works really well.
Reviews.Author: Bobster
Reviews.Content: I have used it to detect some teens who were meeting behind a shed at our school. It took pictures of them as well as a cat, skunk and raccoon in the dark.

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera
Reviews.Author: Scott Gibson
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these cameras. So far they are doing ok. I am not real impressed. The trigger speed is good but sometimes i get black and white photos in the daylight. Battery life is excellent and the video option is superb. I guess for 74 dollars you really cant beat them.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: james mcnulty
Reviews.Content: I currently use 2 other brands that also work very good,but setting them up takes a lot of messing around. These truth cams are so simple to use you can literally set them up in about 10 minutes.For the price you cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Kinda big but EASY to use
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The first camera we got did'nt light up for the night shots but Amazon quickly replaced it and this one works perfectly. It is pretty big but it works great and the set up is super easy, which is what their Primos ad claims and their right.

Reviews.Title: Failed after 3 months
Reviews.Author: Bestek Solutions
Reviews.Content: Unit failed with a SD FUL error.  Appears to be a known issue with the unit based on investigation on the internet.  Formatted the SD Card and replaced it with another with the same SD FUL error..  Placed the SD card in another unit and the SD card worked without issue.  They indicated that they will replace under warranty, however I have to pay the shipping to send it to them and get it back +- $20.  And it appears that it could take months to get it back.  In my opinion I would be throwing the $20 away.  Last Primos product I will buy!

Reviews.Title: okay
Reviews.Author: Chad Pichotta
Reviews.Content: the camera works as described. it takes decent pictures and the battery life is great. it does make a click sound that can spook deer.

Reviews.Title: Nice shots
Reviews.Author: Dean Franklin
Reviews.Content: This takes good clear video,it's easy to set up and use.First night out it took 21  1 minute videos of critters and the battery still showed 99%.Great gadget for a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Camera.
Reviews.Author: Don Yrjo
Reviews.Content: I have used this for some time and am very satisfied with both day and night photos.  Reasonable investment with good results.

Reviews.Title: easy to set up
Reviews.Author: preacherman
Reviews.Content: The picture quality could be better but not bad. The battery life seems to be holding up well. okay for the money.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic and over achieving for the price
Reviews.Author: Rick A.
Reviews.Content: I have three now and they have performed greatly over their price. I use the normal settings and have gotten great life from the batteries. I get clear pictures at around 30 to 40 yards away. For the price of some higher priced cameras that underachieve, I got three that may not be the highest tech but got me into watching multiple spots very economically. After reading some of the feedback from higher priced cameras that are horrible performers, these Primos 35's look better by the day. If I have a complaint it would be that some deer seem to notice the infrared at night but the deer do not seem to be spooked. It did not come camo but for the price some masking tape and spray paint took care of that.  I will probably add two more next year!

Reviews.Title: It's a tank
Reviews.Author: E. Munzer "EliM"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these 4 seasons ago hoping to get a single season out of it.  I've been hunting for decades and have experience with dozens of trail cams, mostly bad.  Most of the low to mid range units seems to malfunction after a season or two (if you're lucky) or be completely drained of batteries long before it's time to go back and check them.The Primos Truth Cam 35 is a tank!  It's big, ugly, bulky and weighs a ton (compared to the little tiny ones out there) and that's good and bad... The good is that trespassers will think twice about stealing it (size and weight, had someone snag the incriminating memory card once, but they left the camera), It takes 3 full seasons for the batteries to die (you can leave this thing up all year) and the 3 mega pixel pictures take up very little space on the memory card (you can store thousands of pictures.)  The bad, is that's it's big, bulky, heavy and uses lots of D batteries.Picture quality is good enough for the purpose, day photos are good, night photos really depend on the outside temperature, the colder it is, the better the pic but the game is recognizable in the heat of the Florida summer nights and the blur is acceptable for moving game.The camera range is good during day light (about 30 yards) and acceptable at night (10 to 15 yards at night.)The motion sensitivity setting is something I now can't live without, If the camera is set up at a funnel such as an opening in a fence it can be placed nice and close (10 yards) with a low sensitivity setting, if you're facing an open field, set the sensitivity to high.  Remember to face the camera North or South so it won't be blinded by the sunrise or sunset.I now own 6 of these and have no reason on the face of this earth to even think about buying a different make/model.  8 Gig memory cards are cheap, and if you buy the micro ones that fit in a full sized adapter, you can pop that card in your phone and transmit the pictures to your favorite picture sharing location in the "cloud" for all to see back at the camp instantly (3 MB pics won't abuse your wireless data plan as much as the newer formats.)I gave this thing 5 stars based on value and reliability.  Good luck and good/safe hunting.

Reviews.Title: one year later
Reviews.Author: mine and yours
Reviews.Content: good camera while it worked took many clean photos and a few videos. Not treated roughly but less than a year later the power supply went out now on the look for a different unit type. Did notice some blank pages no game etc in frames need less than one second camera triggering. I will recommend it due to the fact it functioned great for the time used.

Reviews.Title: Color and Resolution Limitations
Reviews.Author: Kenneth C. Jessen
Reviews.Content: The color and resolution are poor - not up to standards for publication.  Otherwise, the camera works great, snaps photos when there is movement even for relatively small animals.  It does not, however, require an 8 mb flash card as the directions indicate.  It works fine and any newer SDHC card.

Reviews.Title: primos truth cam
Reviews.Author: Orland K. Leland "Multi04"
Reviews.Content: The camera works well for it's intended purpose , the night time range is about 20-25 ft. I have some interesting photos of game on my property and day time photos are very good .A very good camera for the price , set up is very easy as well.

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: Matthew dempsey
Reviews.Content: Takes good pics , an can't beat the price , an good battiery life.i would buy another one no question

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price (Hunting)
Reviews.Author: Garrett W.
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera up for about a month now and I've gotten some great pictures. It will have some pictures with the so called "white out" but its not enough to really drive you nuts, just position it away from the sun and it'll be fine. Dawn and dusk pictures are the least quality but you can still see what your looking at. I was impressed by the video. For the price, its a sure thing. Would recommend it again. Had mine set to 3 shots and when I checked it I had three shots that all looked the same, until I flipped through them real fast and in the second shot you can make out one side of an 8 or 6 pointers rack, about 40 yards off in a very conjested hunting spot. I was impressed.

Reviews.Title: FAILED IN SERVICE AFTER 15 MONTHS
Reviews.Author: T. RANEY
Reviews.Content: The photo quality was OK, but not at its maximum range for small animals. I had an issue with a lot of false triggering from falling leaves too - even after adjusting the sensitivity. I know most folks would install this camera for a week or two and take it down. However, in my application, I installed it outdoors to monitor wildlife long-term. So, perhaps not a fair test.

Reviews.Title: Truth Cam 35
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Snow
Reviews.Content: Product works great for the money!  The only problem I've had so far is that the camera date/time has began to reset to factory settings by itself................But like I said it's a good deal for the money I spent on it.  Picture images are very clear day or night.

Reviews.Title: Great devise
Reviews.Author: Steve R. Johnston "Gica"
Reviews.Content: Extended battery life. Tough exterior-dropped many times without damaging. Shudder speed is very fast. Picture quality is very good. A wonderful gadget.

Reviews.Title: Great daytime color, a bit fuzzy night photos
Reviews.Author: John M "jmarovi"
Reviews.Content: This is my first such camera and I am very happy with it.  I wanted to know what kind of critters are visiting the front of my home next to the windows.  No mice, just squirrels, birds and a neighbor's cat.  Day pictures are sharp and in color.  Nighttime pics more grainy, black and white, but they give me enough info.  The cat seems to stare at the camera for the three picture sequence I use, so the lights must be noticeable.There are lots of options that are easily set with sliding switches.  Select Photo/Video, number of shots in sequence, length of video, duration between shots, sensitivity of motion detector. I plan to move it a bit as it seems to sense my motion walking to my car(about 20 feet away from the camera). The SD cards have so much room that I am going to give the video a try.This is a good value.

Reviews.Title: Great day pics but night pics not as good since subject must be fairly close.
Reviews.Author: W. Knapp
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Seems to be sturdily built. Not good pics unless subject is fairly close, especially if at night.

Reviews.Title: simple to use
Reviews.Author: dawson
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, quality of pictures are okay.  If you want better quality and definition, not gonna get it with this one.  However, you can't beat the cost for what it does.  Would recommend it to anyone wanting to see what critters are coming through the back yard!!

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Curtis & Sarah Kenney
Reviews.Content: Worked great right out of the box.  Easy to use but some of the low light pictures are pretty dark.

Reviews.Title: Camera works great
Reviews.Author: Jaclyn Dilallo
Reviews.Content: We hooked up the camera and within a few days we had perfect  pictures.  We had brought a camera similar to this one a few years ago and the batteries would be dead within a few days. I like this camera because the batteries last a long time.  Great product for the money

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Keen "2012!"
Reviews.Content: I asked for and received this camera last Christmas as a gift.  It has been out every day since then with only one exception of about two weeks (got some ants in it and had to pull it apart to clean them out).  I have only changed the batteries once.  Camera takes excellent pictures.  Actually asking for a second one this Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Game Camera Does The Job
Reviews.Author: J. Seastrom
Reviews.Content: The game camera was easy to set up and did the job I wanted it to do. I was able to catch pictures of wildlife, both at night and during the day, on my one acre forested property. The need to remove the data card to see the results on my laptop was a little cumbersome; I would have liked a WIFI ability included for this price.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Austin Keller
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera for the money. It takes good quality pictures and the batteries last for a while.

Reviews.Title: Great cam
Reviews.Author: steven dauster
Reviews.Content: I have 2 of them for the price in my opinion best trail camera. Easy to use decent quality photos.

Reviews.Title: Great Pics
Reviews.Author: Ruby
Reviews.Content: What I like best is the simple setup instructions. Our other brand was near impossible to figure out. Would like another.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: james simons
Reviews.Content: Takes good pictures. Sure it's not a high end camera but it does the job. I would suggest this to a friend.  BLACKPOWDER JIM

Reviews.Title: Love it and received it FAST!!!
Reviews.Author: Vincent P.
Reviews.Content: Received very quickly and have the item set and taking pictures as I type. Cant wait to check it in a week and see how it did.

Reviews.Title: nice cameras
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: nice cameras, both have perfomed like I expected them to. battery life continues to show in the 80% after a month of use.

Reviews.Title: It works Okay, nothing special
Reviews.Author: Joel Lee
Reviews.Content: I've been using this for a few months now on our rural property.  It works fine, the picture quality is adequate but nothing special.  Seems to work best in either bright day  light or total darkness when the flash kicks in.  It must make some small amount of noise because all of the photos of deer are looking directly at the camera.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: Donna Barnes
Reviews.Content: Present for hubby.  He is thrilled with it.  Allows him to see what is roaming around the yard at night.  Works well.  Easy to install and view.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: JOHN A.
Reviews.Content: This is SOOO EASY TO SET UP AND USE!  For the Price You can't go wrong!  I am very glade I bought this Truth Cam 35.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: nygirl
Reviews.Content: Gift for my husband. This works quite well and takes very clear photos. We will be purchasing two more in the near future.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised.
Reviews.Author: Dranzerk
Reviews.Content: Waterproof, hot/cold proof, does what its suppose to do.If i had to pick a downside, which is not really a downside just something that needs to be improved, is that it needs to include a lock with it.The camera is super sensitive, so make sure you put it not very close to trees/brush that will blow in the wind.  My first time out I have about 100 pictures of nothing because of that.  Just set it up about 10 feet in a open area or big trees so it won't detect small changes.

Reviews.Title: Awesome unit!
Reviews.Author: R. Blasi
Reviews.Content: Camera works very well and is very simple to operate. Bought it to see what was eating my garden at night. Attached it to a tree close bye, set it in photo mode and went to sleep. Found out the next day that deer were having a buffet at the garden. Camera can be set in photo or video mode. You just need to purchase a SD card for the unit. Housing is built very well, hard plastic. Easy to use,water resistant,reliable,fun. What more could you ask for! I would highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Best Buy, Good Performer
Reviews.Author: Pat Munday "EcoRover"
Reviews.Content: I have used a Primos 35 intensively for more than a year. Daytime photos are as good or better than MUCH more expensive cameras, and night photos are nearly as good. Batteries last 2 - 3 months of continuous use and you get about 1,600 photos on a 4 GB memory card. I preview the photos on a small digital camera, and only the occasional photo is unreadable due to some format glitch. You can "fast forward" through the photos--it's like watching a movie and you can stop when you see a photo you want to keep. The motion detector is VERY sensitive, and if you have windy conditions set the sensitivity on "Low" to avoid getting hundreds of photos of blowing grass and tree branches. The "Low" sensitivity level is still triggered by birds and small mammals, as well as megafauna. You MUST set the camera within range of the critters you hope to photograph--c. 40-feet day and 20-feet night. Also, the field of view is narrow compared to regular cameras, so aim carefully. The camera, even with the night infrared flash, does NOT spook birds or mammals--many sense something and come for a VERY close look; I have some great photos of elk and coyote eyes and noses etc.

Reviews.Title: Bought this for the 5th time!!!
Reviews.Author: emtx3015 "emtx3015"
Reviews.Content: Well, my husband has bought a total of 5 of these cameras in past 6 months.  It's simple to use and captures clear and crisp pictures.  Fantastic price tag of $70 is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: Great deal for the money
Reviews.Author: Gerald B.
Reviews.Content: Although the unit is physically large it is a great deal for the money. I would purchase another one if I needed a second one.

Reviews.Title: Great daytime pics
Reviews.Author: FWNEPA
Reviews.Content: The pictures taken in daylight are great... twilight and after dark are not so good. Overall I think it's a good value.

Reviews.Title: Good quality camera / Great price
Reviews.Author: Monika Soria Caruso
Reviews.Content: Recommended for first time trail camera users. I'm sure the more expensive cameras are for someone, but this camera is perfect for everything I have asked of it so far. I've done night and day light tests in various weather and all the pictures look great so far. Would not recommend this for most security purposes (From what I've read it doesn't sound like it would be effectively compatible with an EYE-FI card for instant broadcast due to it's auto power off). It will work to let you know after the fact if people have been around in a remote area of your property and you WILL have their picture, if they don't steal your camera. Careful placement and use of security cable or lock box or both (separate purchase)  may stop all but the most determined camera thieves. The pass through for a cable lock is a bit small and will not fit the bicycle style cable lock that I already had, so go with the cable lock they recommend. I do not suggest that you listen too much to any "advice" that Amazon gives you about pairing products though. I had a bad time with the 8G SD HC Memory card that Amazon suggested I add to this purchase and ended up using instead an old 2GB SD card that I bought retail maybe 5 years ago, works fine and has more than enough memory for my uses so far, as I check the camera pretty often, I may get a second card so I can switch them out quick and leave the camera in place.

Reviews.Title: Easiest to Use!
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: I did my research for the easiest, most reliable and this is it!  Terrific pictures - day and night.  Could not be happier with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Look out Brier Fox!
Reviews.Author: computer potato
Reviews.Content: Fox in the hen house but not for long. The digital time stamp tells me when s/he is coming through. I will be waiting one night soon. Set up was a no brainer. And I'm not technically handy. I'm very satisfied with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Game Camera
Reviews.Author: Scooter
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera and easy to use. It took 2,450 pictures in 6 days and 98% had some type of animal in them. Picks up deer running by in the woods at 50 feet easily. Trust me when I say it is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Broke in less than a year
Reviews.Author: Anne
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to see what was killing my chickens.  It originally didn't want to accept the memory card and continued to be moody about recording images to the card every time I reinserted it.  It did make a decent quality photo and video though once the card decided to work.  I used it through the fall and it was fine.  We had a mild winter, so I left it out to see what was ranging around in the winter.  At some point in early spring I turned it off.  When I tried to use it again this summer it wouldn't turn on at all.  I tried multiple sets of fresh batteries to no avail.  The manufacturer says I can ship it back for repair, but even under warranty I have to pay for shipping both ways.  After paying almost $90 for the camera it seems a rip off to have to pay another $20 when it is less than a year old.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Smokrr
Reviews.Content: Really low battery usage and  pictures are really clear. As with alot of cameras out there time will tell. So far 2 months of elements and it is working great.

Reviews.Title: Big!
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: This trail camera is BIG, much bigger then I expected. Has a problem when in direct sunlight, otherwise works well.

Reviews.Title: I own 5!!!
Reviews.Author: Crinnaj
Reviews.Content: These are the best camera for the price. I own 5 of them; enough said! :-)Great pictures day and night, holds up to bears playing and clawing it.Easy to use, install, program, and retrieve pictures!Even takes video! Very long battery life when used for pictures!!

Reviews.Title: great photos
Reviews.Author: Flynt001
Reviews.Content: This camera takes some very clear photos day and night. And it has very easy to follow instructions on how to use it.

Reviews.Title: Photogenic Thieves
Reviews.Author: Hanging On
Reviews.Content: I painted mine to match the house color and to point at my front door.  I probably expect to see a lot of animals, dogs, etc.  But on the outside chance it snaps a pic of a burgler that can be I.D.'d by the police, then my money is well spent.

Reviews.Title: Good basic camera
Reviews.Author: Carl S.
Reviews.Content: Good basic camera for daylight photos.  Doesn't have flash per se for night, so get a 'ghostly' picture at night.  For price good deal, easy to set and use.

Reviews.Title: Worked for 6 hours!
Reviews.Author: William H.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take outdoor pictures of a bird box nesting by Western Blue Birds.  I bought it on Amazon and it came in 5 days, I set it up with a 8GB SC card and placed it by the nest.  The next day I turned it off and took out the card and saw great pictures.  I put the card back in and turned it on and nothing was showing on the LCD window.  So I replaced the batteries with another set of new D cells then tried again.  Nothing... except the camera did take pictures without the LCD window on.  I went to the website for Primos and contacted them, they were NOT helpful at all, just told me to return it to Amazon for replacement, which I did today... now I wait for a replacement and read all the problems in the reviews that others have experienced..I would rate this camera 3 stars for picture quality and 1 star for performance.

Reviews.Title: works fine
Reviews.Author: Kim Oldfield
Reviews.Content: Bought for Christmas present, and hubby doesn't use it to often, but says he like's it. Seems to work just fine.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Sue I.
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier with this camera. Great quality pics for both day and night shots. Plenty of memory with an 8 gig SD card. I didn't get this camera for a game trail but for affordable home surveillance. It is doing it's job and then some!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Chris/Michigan
Reviews.Content: This is a very simple to use camera.  The camera sets up easily and takes really good pictures.  The battery life is excellent as well. I will buy another.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the money with one complaint
Reviews.Author: D3 Design "mark it 8"
Reviews.Content: Great quality, good motion detection. My one complaint is the 10 second delay between motion sensing and taking the photo. I'm unsure why this is built-in / the minimum time between detection and photos.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed for hunting
Reviews.Author: Alan D.
Reviews.Content: I needed a game cam to take pictures of hogs during the day, and around the feeder at night.  This camera does it well.  I don't need professional photos in the 9 mega pixel range.  You are just using it to find out if anything is coming to your feeder!  For that use, it's great!

Reviews.Title: Definite recommend this camera
Reviews.Author: Jim A. Griffin
Reviews.Content: This has been quite impressive camera. Great daytime photos and ok nighttime pics. 4 stars cause distance, clarity at night could be better, but I am satisfied. I will buy more of these cameras. I've had mine for 4yrs and have gotten all critters in northeast oregon on it, for the exception of a squatch! I would recommend this camera to anyone. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied with this product.
Reviews.Author: Rudy Casillas
Reviews.Content: This item meets my requirements for day and night photos. I have several of the Cam 35, they resist the weather perfectly. I do recommend this item to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Hawaii
Reviews.Author: sh
Reviews.Content: The camera did worked as we wanted it to.  Easy to handle and work with.Shipping was fast and nothing was wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: No 40 foot range here
Reviews.Author: Parker T
Reviews.Content: I have only have this unit for two days, and have not gotten one pic of an animal yet.  It is in an area where I have seen cats walk by it.  Sensitivity set to high, I have to get within 10 feet of it in order to set it off.  I am giving it one more night and then will have to make different arrangements for this system, so far it has not lived up to its claims.  Update:  Second night it seems to be picking up some things now.  Couldn't trigger it myself the first night unless I was very close as stated above, but now it does pick up from beyond 30 feet, maybe it is getting better.  Will give a final note in a week.

Reviews.Title: okay, not great
Reviews.Author: Ibi Ubu
Reviews.Content: This probably performs exactly as it's designed to, but the picture quality isn't great.  I probably wouldn't buy it again.  Kinda fun, though.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: pat
Reviews.Content: I love it!  shows very clear pics, and picks up everything, easy to operate, don't forget to get your sandisk memory card

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Dean Henson
Reviews.Content: This is a fun camera to have. I have already got pictures of several coyotes along with birds, rabbits and moving tree branches.

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: Rex E. Cole "Rex E."
Reviews.Content: It is a good bang for the buck.  I don't think I could have found the battery at a better price.

Reviews.Title: Does what it's supposed to do
Reviews.Author: Sandra Gibson
Reviews.Content: At last we can see who is raiding the birdfeeder. It's a very large raccoon. The camera let's us get to know our nighttime backyard guests.

Reviews.Title: Great Item
Reviews.Author: mae EvansLee
Reviews.Content: The camera does exactly what we would be told it would so it is doing exactly what we need it too.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35 Camera
Reviews.Author: mkb2012
Reviews.Content: This camera works great and covers a huge area. Veryclear pictures.  Feel much better about leaving ourhome having this planted for security.

Reviews.Title: not IR and doesn't have a 1.5sec motion trigger
Reviews.Author: M. Cook
Reviews.Content: This is takes reasonable video for the money during the day. How ever the LED lights are not true infrared and the trigger speed is more like 4 to 5 seconds so anything that isn't walking slowly will be blurry or out of frame. I had an SD cards full of pics with nothing in them. The 60sec video was better. Only used it for a week and the batteries were still going strong.

Reviews.Title: Seems slow
Reviews.Author: David Berry
Reviews.Content: While it takes pictures/video, it seems to always be too late for whatever triggered them.  Probably OK for grazing animals, but too slow for passing ones.

Reviews.Title: Nice trail cam
Reviews.Author: DrDenny
Reviews.Content: I have been using this for several weeks now and like the way it operates. Battery life is amazing and really takes good pictures, even at night with the lower megapixel resolution. I would recommend to point it away from objects which are always moving such as tree branches or else you will have loads of photos resulting from movement. Otherwise, well worth the value.

Reviews.Title: Great brand and quality
Reviews.Author: dfong
Reviews.Content: Great product,reliable and easy to use.Fantastic image quality and sharpness.I highly recommend this cam and brand.I would buy Primos again

Reviews.Title: Surprised at the great output
Reviews.Author: davetucaz
Reviews.Content: A gift for family member/hunter. He reports satisfaction with the output. He wil buy another to cover the area better.

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: DeWitt Hantz
Reviews.Content: It works well and no problems. The only problem was when I ordered a "Quanity of 3" I intially recieved a involice for one of one. However we got past that and I will order more.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is the best trail camera I have ever owned. I am using it for property security and it is awesome. Great photos day or night, great video day or night. Only critique is that video takes a second or two before activating to record so placement must be well planned.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: SReaves
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  Our house backs to a creek.  We have been using the camera to record wildlife in our backyard.  The camera is easy to use and take good pictures and videos, especially considering that the pictures are taken at night.

Reviews.Title: It works.
Reviews.Author: Timothy Peterson
Reviews.Content: I have several trail cameras, and this one is my most reliable. I left it out for two months without visiting it, and it had taken photos right up until the week before retrieval. It had stopped only because the card was full. Still had 50% battery life. Pictures are clear and sharp,too!

Reviews.Title: Primos Camera
Reviews.Author: Sherry
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera for an excellent price. I would definitely recommend this product to anybody looking to get pictures or videos of nature. I put it out at night and got awesome pictures of coyotes and skunks and deer.

Reviews.Title: Good replacement policy!
Reviews.Author: Thomas James "Lost and Found"
Reviews.Content: The camera is fine for daylight but frankly not worth a hoot at night --- range is fair --Camera lasted 3 months --- returned couldn't figure out the problem kept saying chip full (empty chip) --- took a bit of correspondence -- we returned it and in about 3 weeks total had a new one -- we will see how long it last --I wouldn't recommend if you have it in a remote area -- ours is used relative close to monitor our local black bear and dear population --You get what you pay for and for this price level acceptable performance that's about it  --

Reviews.Title: Good for seeing what's creeping around your farm at night.
Reviews.Author: Fredric Franklin Flasher
Reviews.Content: Easy to operate and works well. Easy to "hide" and takes clean pictures that are easy to view.  Sorry end for Drew the dog.

Reviews.Title: Get the right SDHC card...
Reviews.Author: c&d; landscaping
Reviews.Content: I like this alot but I have had trouble with night pictures.. Tech support did contact me but never  finished with my follow up emails...I was told to buy scandisc SDHC with the camera but read later that this particular product sometimes does not work well with the camara.. I needed to format the SDHC after each use because the camera has trouble with data transfer on these cards  I bought Patriot 8GB and they solved the night problem of the camera not recording pics of the critters I was trapping in live traps..I think this camera is fun and the battery power is super great!!!  I love the camera.. and the price was  great... I would buy the higher priced one with black out for coyote spotting because in my night recordings the coyote retreated when the camera lights came on .. the red beam made the coyote retreat..I  looked at so many cameras before I bought this.. and I am glad with my purchase for the price!!  Now I would like to get one of the fancy higher prices camera that will use cellular technology and send your remote pics straight to your phone!If you do buy this camera or any Primos  they have a great help and info web site to help you with firmware and  updates!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Ed Sakabu "stillslippery"
Reviews.Content: I actually use this in my backyard to see what wanders around in the dark of night.  Also caught intruders that were trying to steal things out of our backyard during the day when no one was home. Great as a security camera if you secure it in a semi hidden place.

Reviews.Title: Its pretty good
Reviews.Author: Alissa
Reviews.Content: I am writting this review and letting you know that I am very impressed with the images. I am attempting to capture anything moving around my house due to some illegal activities, the size of this camera is not very descreat. I like it and hope to capture some really good footage.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Lindsey Smith
Reviews.Content: Set it up where you want it to shoot and get excellent pics. Placed this around my deer stand and got excellent pics, day and night. Just gotta make sure the camera is aimed where the sun isn't facing it and the pics will come out clear.

Reviews.Title: Good value.
Reviews.Author: D. Bottom
Reviews.Content: Performs really well. I use it to watch wildlife passing through my property. Day or night I get great shots in both photo and video modes. Nice color in daytime. Good sensitivity to motion.

Reviews.Title: Very sensitive
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I use this camera for a wildlife project in Colorado and have found that it met my expectations. However with the camera on the "normal" sensitivity setting I found that the SD card got filled in two days. Basically anytime the wind blew pictures were snapped. The camera though records date, time, temperature and takes great infrared pics. Definitely a great product for the price!

Reviews.Title: great cam
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: got this camera because i was new to the trail/game cam world and it was cheap with a trusted name. i was very suprise how good it worked. i was a bit iffy about the cost of D batteries but i have gone 3 months in the vermont winter and batteries and cam worked just fine. i bought another and had same results. bought two more for my father more for cheap security cams. he like them so much he bought another. very impressed with cost, battery life, and how easy it is to use. i have used 2,4,8,16 gig sd cards. have pics up to 30 yards. great buy.

Reviews.Title: Not sure yet!
Reviews.Author: AB
Reviews.Content: When we first used it there were hundreds of pictures and it was just trees or branches moving.  We changed the sensitivity and we'll see what happens.

Reviews.Title: OK Camera
Reviews.Author: Mickey Grasty
Reviews.Content: Have used camera for a few weeks and consider overall experience and camera performance as OK.  Camera is easy to set-up and use, daylight pictures clear and sharp, however have not found a combination of settings that provides a good mix of sensitivity and selectivity in image capture.  Continue to take a lot of pictures for no apparent reason and have missed some game pictures that should have been captured.  Night pictures are poor quality.  Was inexpensive but was hoping for more bang for my buck.

Reviews.Title: A fun unattended camera for seeing what wanders through the yard.
Reviews.Author: Chad Brown
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up, good instructions, can store lots of pics with the right SD card.  I would recommend this to a friend.

Reviews.Title: I bought 5
Reviews.Author: Henri Rochette "HRochette"
Reviews.Content: I hope that it will work fine. I have been robbed and with these cams, I hope that I will be able to identify the robber.I cannot tell actually if it works well with a 32 Gb Flash Memory. I will give a try.

Reviews.Title: Does not capture Turkeys!
Reviews.Author: Bryan Luikart
Reviews.Content: I have had this set up for several weeks now with very little success.  I keep it set at high sensitivity and it always seems to get my dog (a great dane) and me when I go to collect the SD card.  We had a snowstorm yesterday and when I went to check the camera there were tracks from a LARGE GROUP of TURKEYS right in front of the thing.  I was very dissappointed to find no pictures of turkeys.  The fact that it captures me and my dog is good.  But if you want a picture of anything smaller than a great dane or a deer... look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: a gift
Reviews.Author: cared99
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my hubby for Christmas because it wasn't expensive. I was worried that the quality would suck, but we tried it out in our backyard and the pictures were very good. I am very happy with the purchase, as is my hubby who is an avid hunter. Plus it works well in all 4 season type weather, even in cold N. ME.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35 Camera
Reviews.Author: Anne-Marie
Reviews.Content: This camera worked so good we purchased an additional one.  Now we can see what wildlife we have on our property and what they are up to :-)

Reviews.Title: Nice camera great pictures !!!
Reviews.Author: Ranchgirl66
Reviews.Content: We love this camera. It picks up everything that moves. We now know about our neighbors pesky dog. Nice dog but loves our pets food. Lol

Reviews.Title: Works ok, not top quality!
Reviews.Author: Angela Dawn Hendricks
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband. It does the job and we havent had any problems with it but It is not the best quality. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Awesome trail cam!
Reviews.Author: Dan W.
Reviews.Content: We have a salt block in our yard and my wife wanted to see the deer that came to enjoy it. After some research and a great price I decided to get this one. Setup was extremely easy, and positioning it was a breeze. I originally set it on its most sensitive setting and was capturing cars on the road 100 yards away. Normal setting works fine and I could probably stand to set it on its lowest setting. Timestamp and temperature shows up at the bottom of each photo along with moon phase. This is a rugged unit and will definitely please you for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Blake
Reviews.Content: Had others the past few years and have no problems with it. In the winter works amazing and durring the summer as well.

Reviews.Title: Works Perfectly!
Reviews.Author: dunn
Reviews.Content: Super easy to put up!We used an 8G memory card and it provided tons of recording time.Picture quality is wonderful.Best product for you money.

Reviews.Title: Trail cam
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: recieved in a timely fashion ...easy setup..clear pictures and videos....good range of settings to choose from...would buy again...good rerasonable price

Reviews.Title: Yuk!
Reviews.Author: Curious-MIke
Reviews.Content: The camera has produced many pictures helpful to my hunting trips for a while, but then it just quits ... the video first and then later the stills ... bring the camera in the house and let it sit for a while and the camera starts working again for about a day (maybe)... a real pain in the neck!  Way to much work! I do not recommend this camera ... customer service would not answer my emails and I purchased a replacement from a different manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: william mccann
Reviews.Content: works well takes great pics during day the color pics are clear and sharp the night pics needed the contrast to be edited because they where not as sharp but that could be attributed to camera distance will need to experiment alittle more

Reviews.Title: Cool
Reviews.Author: William L. Wright
Reviews.Content: This is more than a camera for me. I don't hunt but it is a great camera to put out in the woods on a game trail just to see what is using it. It takes neat videos to, I took a ribbing from some of my friends for buying it because I don't hunt but when I show them the pictures and videoes I get of wildlife they now understand why I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Easy set up
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a gift for my husband and it was very easy to set up and it works great.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Kim P. Wied
Reviews.Content: does everything I wanted,low price,long battery life,have had no problems with it,shipping was excellent,easy to use,picture clarity very good,would recommend this to anyone looking for a reasonably priced camera

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: C. J. Arndt
Reviews.Content: I like it so far, used it past few months every day.  Very sensitive, so windy days will pick up the tree branches moving.  Like that it uses D batteries, they last longer than my other camera that uses 2 C's.  Haven't used the video part yet so can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: Game camera
Reviews.Author: Wendy J. Ryan,  D.V.M., M.S., B.S
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to operate and has performed very well.  I use it to see what animals are in my backyard and to observe my own dogs while I'm not home.  It's fun to see what they are up to.

Reviews.Title: SD Card
Reviews.Author: Danny Brown
Reviews.Content: Nice, accept the SD card is in an bad place.  Under the bottom door, the door has to be open and rubber gate, which you can't see has to be pulled out, then the SD card is there.  In the dark or when you first start using the camera is odd to say the least.  You either have to know where and how to remove it or pull it from it placement.  Pulling it is a bummer.

Reviews.Title: Gife to my bicycle mechanic & he loves it!
Reviews.Author: Serene Seeker "boringbeaver"
Reviews.Content: Gave it to my buddy who has a couple acres of dense scrub & forest behind him; he's been enjoying seeing all the coons, whitetails, and an occational Axis deer and a couple coyotes!

Reviews.Title: Turth Cam35
Reviews.Author: Bobby L Hebert
Reviews.Content: With only one night under my belt with this camera I can say I already am impressed. I have been a moultrie fan for years but the cameras are like they use to be (flash blows out fast) so I was looking for a new brand. These are made in USA YAY and in my home state of Mississippi. I didn't know this till I received the camera. Major plus right there.The daytime pictures are chystal clear and the depth is unbelievable. IMpressed for sure.  I only had a few night pictures and they were fantastic too. The rapid fire of the picture is so fast I actually caught 3 pictures of the coyotes. Never had more than one because of the slow moultrie response.I love the Primos camera for the rapid fire of the pictures. Happy camper so far. Will update after using for a  while.

Reviews.Title: cam cord
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: not to good i tried it in the back yard and got a lot of trees blowing and the pictures were blurrie. even when i staged them from different distances

Reviews.Title: Good pictures taken of wildlife animals
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Captures lots of wildlife animals out in the pastures and kept those pictures and pass to my friends. Thanks it helps

Reviews.Title: out in the dark
Reviews.Author: bigfoot
Reviews.Content: The Primos Truth Cam 35 takes an outstanding photo or video, depending on which you choose.  The main fault I have with it is nighttime illumination.  The target neds to be 4-5 feet from the camera or all you'll get is shiny eyes in the darkness.  Maybe someone can offer a suggestion to correct this situation.  The camera is easy to set up and progrqm in a matter of minutes.  If I can handle that, anybody can.  If you want a reasonably priced trail cam that's simple to use, this is the one for you.  Joe Harrison  Vanceburg,Ky

Reviews.Title: Primos truth cam 35
Reviews.Author: Curtis  Hamby
Reviews.Content: this camera does not come close to the Primos 45 camera it is the settings for operation are not specific enough,it takes pictures of nothing!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: chrometoyota
Reviews.Content: I would have given it 5 stars but I'm not exactly happy with the delay. I have a feeling a lot of things don't get picked up on because of the minimum of a 10 second delay. Also if you run it on the 60 second video mode, it cuts the quality way down.

Reviews.Title: Truth Cam rocks
Reviews.Author: ed russell
Reviews.Content: Used the camera Dec. 20 2012 and it performed according to all advertised expectations. Got some nice photos of deer.

Reviews.Title: Cost effective trail camera
Reviews.Author: E. Strause
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great day and night pictures.  Its captured multiple deer and smaller wildlife as they pass by.  Some have been looking directly at the camera when the picture was taken, which is nice to see.  The images are fairly low res, but look great when viewing on a laptop screen.  I'm sure they would be very suitable for smaller prints, if you desire to print them out. The battery life has been excellent so far, with about a hundred pictures taken on the first set of new D cells.  Overall, we're happy with the camera.

Reviews.Title: What Have We Seen?
Reviews.Author: 1926 USAF 83-87
Reviews.Content: First, we began with photos that were so cool.  Then, we switched to 10sec videos and could not believe the animals that stop by in front of the camera.  We put out corn and salt block.  In one month we have a herd of wild turkey, two foxes, one racooon, one coyote, squirrels, blackbirds, and12 point - 10 point - 8 point -2 point bucks.  Extended the videos to 30 seconds and caught the 12 point and 10 point locking racks.... and to see that was amazing with our home in the background.  Excellent product!

Reviews.Title: Better Than I Expected
Reviews.Author: Joe M. Moberley
Reviews.Content: Blown away by performance. Could have spent a lot more money but doubt it could have beat out this Primos. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera
Reviews.Author: yooperanna
Reviews.Content: Have had my Primos Truth Cam 35 Camera since first week of Nov.  Watching the deer through photos both day and night.  Daytime videos turn out well but night time videos are black with just glowing eyes.  At first I wasn't pleased with the night photos either until I learned that (I use 'Shotwell' for loading pictures into pc) if I use the 'enhance' button and if need be adjust the lighting I get very nice night photos.  Unfortunately this does not work with the videos so due to the glowing eyes only and black background I only gave camera a 4 star rating.  Over all am pleased with it and would recommend one to anyone interested in field pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good economical Game Cam
Reviews.Author: Christopher S. Zaleski
Reviews.Content: It is a little large, but it is easy to operate and works well.  For ~$80, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Basic camera for DAY
Reviews.Author: Randy Googins
Reviews.Content: This is a good day camera - night capability is POOR,I would not buy this camera again.You get what you pay for in game cameras.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: Matthew Herbert
Reviews.Content: I've bought 2 and my brother bought 1.  I'll keep buying these at this price.Why?  1 reason, battery life!  I have the same batteries for 2 years now.If money is no problem, you can probably find better options but on a budget this is great.  I'll take 3 of these ($80) over 2 of the $120 models.  And I'll have more of the property covered with cameras.The pictures are great.  The further shots at night can be difficult to see antlers.I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great camera. Price makes it even better!
Reviews.Author: KarateMIke
Reviews.Content: Purchased two of these Truth 35 this summer. This is my first year of photo scouting. I couldn't be more pleased. I have had a veritable wildlife show ever since, bear, buck, doe, yearling, turkey. Night photos are good. Day photos are exceptional. This camera has greatly exceeded my expectations. I am buying two more, today!

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup and use. Great results
Reviews.Author: Bernard Farrell
Reviews.Content: I'm not giving this 4 stars because the camera comes in a large transparent plastic clamshell that is NOT marked for recycling. It's terrible that any company is not making packaging easier to recycle.To setup the camera you'll need 4 D-size batteries and an SDHC memory stick. I found an inexpensive 16 Gb stick. Once those are inserted the camera is ready to use.I attached the camera to a tree close to our chicken coop. I want to catch video of the predator that's taken some of our chickens. The enclosed strap is plenty big enough for the tree I used which is about one foot in diameter. I set the camera to take 30 second videos, and set the motion detector to normal.The results are excellent, though I haven't seen the predator yet. Lots of daytime video feature the dog or our chickens setting off the detector. I think it was also set off by some heavy snow last week. Night-time video so far just features me closing the chickens in for the evening. The video quality is very clear -- there's no sound, but I didn't really need or want this.I've removed the memory stick to look at the results, this is easy to do without moving the camera. So I'm very satisfied with the camera, and happy to find something to solve our problem.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: LisaH
Reviews.Content: My husband loves to get the feeling of the deer's habits he's hunting. He ordered 3 of these and is very happy with the quality. He loves nature and we have fun going thru the pictures and especially seeing familar deer coming back again and again. Great product and great price.

Reviews.Title: primus truth cam 35
Reviews.Author: rocketman
Reviews.Content: Pros:  easy setup, battery life, decent pix and videos, weather proof enclosure, easy media removal/installation.Cons: night leds are visible, 10 second delay in starting video/pix.It is a solid device, however the cons are very significant n a security application.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the camera. It seems to hold a battery charge very well and also has the ability to run off house power with an adapter which is not provided. The battery life is very good.It seems to capture motion very well and have had no problems capturing the picture at the right time.The picture clarity is also very good.I have no complaints

Reviews.Title: Average Camera
Reviews.Author: Stumpykemp
Reviews.Content: This camera takes decent pictures. I have yet to play with the video recording option. As stated in a few reviews allready, there are issues with pcitures taken right at dawn/dusk (it didnt matter if it was pointed north, south, east, or west) pictures are either very dark, or "whiteout" pictures happen.
