I own two of these, and two Stealth Cam 8MP cameras, and would say that they are about equal in quality pictures. I would recommend this camera to hunters that are just starting out to use cams (me). More experianced hunters that have used cams in the past and want a better quality picture may want to look elsewhere. Overall it is a good camera for the cost.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money!
Reviews.Author: Bitsy Bernat
Reviews.Content: I got this to see if cyotes are in my yard at night. Sadly, I've now got many pics of them. The camera works great both day and night.

Reviews.Title: its perfect
Reviews.Author: deerman1
Reviews.Content: I bought this to monitor deer movement prior to the season and it works great !I used it in my backyard for a week or so to familiarize myself with it. The photos'were clear and the video worked great too. It captured some backyard critters as iexpected.It's now positioned in the woods and I'm looking forward to retrieving the photo's.A great and fun item for the price. I may even get another one.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: MIhunter
Reviews.Content: Great product for the price! Very easy to setup and use. Just pick your setting, put your sd card in and turn it on. Sometimes the night pictures aren't the greatest and the trigger speed is a little slow but, it gets the job done if you are baiting the sight. I do NOT recommend this cam for trail use.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: patom
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this camera, it takes great pictures and works well out in the wild, have captured great pics of deer turkey and coyotes.

Reviews.Title: showed what was there
Reviews.Author: jesse
Reviews.Content: Works very good for day time pics but the night ir seems to beam a little ti the left side in my picture. Some of the farther deer all I could see where eyes glowing. But very good daytime picture and I am happy with it. I have a stealth cam bushnell and moultrie cameras. It is for sure the easiest to use

Reviews.Title: Great for the Price
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: I have never bought a trail cam and neither has my Dad. I did a bunch of research and settled on this one for him based on reviews and the price. I didn't want to shell out too much for our first trail cam.I have not used this item too much personally since it was a gift, but my Dad was able to figure out how to set it up and use it effectively. The images are sufficient, they are better than I expected. They are not the same as say a point and shoot camera, but definitely good for what we are trying to do.Having some patience with some of the settings, especially the sensitivity, will go a long way in your satisfaction with this product.I would definitely recommend this if this is your first entry into buying a trail cam. I would buy another for my own personal use.

Reviews.Title: Finally able to see the party going on in our yard at night!
Reviews.Author: Jakbenimble
Reviews.Content: This summer had been hard on our garden and yard.  Something was eating the tomato and pepper plants just set out; something was turning over the flower pots every time they were planted;  something was eating the blossums and small fruit from  the squash plants;  and something was draining the hummingbird feeder every night.  We had no idea what or who might be throwing a party in our yard every night.  In order to stop the shenanigans, we needed to find out in order to develop a strategy that would work against them. A friend suggested getting a "Critter Cam".  I did some research and found the Primos Truth Cam 35 to be reasonably priced with good reviews.  We have been using it in several different parts of our yard to catch the culprits in action.  It's been exciting viewing the pictures and video each morning.  Very clear pictures especially during the day, but at night as well.  I mostly use the photo setting and take 5 pictures at 30 second intervals.  I would not hesitate recommending this camera to anyone.  The motion detector works well, and the critters photographed are not startled or aware of the pictures at all...oh, the perpetrators?  I've captured the opposums in the squash, the coons in the flower pots and hummingbird feeder, and an occasional neighbor's cat out for a prowl.  It's very convenient being able to move the camera wherever needed.  We'll be using it into the winter too I'm sure!

Reviews.Title: Tank
Reviews.Author: Tank
Reviews.Content: This camera is not that great it goes through batts quick and has issues with chips all diff kinds. Time is mulitary and still makes noise all game is looking right at it on sec pic...all big bucks are now not coming in...went back to moultree and they are coming back to corn...I would look up the moultree 55

Reviews.Title: Not Happy
Reviews.Author: Darron P.Castiglione
Reviews.Content: Loved it when we first got it. Stopped working after one month. Was able to return it, at my expense, for a new one, but after almost one month was told that it's on back order. Don't feel this is a reliable product.

Reviews.Title: Cam 35 is good
Reviews.Author: Jitney "The Jitney58"
Reviews.Content: a very good camera ...glad I purchased it now I know what is walking around my backyard at night.  The video & Pic are fun to watch.!

Reviews.Title: broke after one year
Reviews.Author: JB "jb6606"
Reviews.Content: This was an ok camera for the price, the only thing I didn't like about it was the delay between sensing motion and starting to record photos or videos.  The shortest time you can set it to is (I think) 10 seconds, and I would have preferred 2-3 seconds.  But it broke after about 14 months, is completely dead.  I'd spend more money on something reliable, but I haven't had much luck with game cameras.

Reviews.Title: it rocks.  Bought 3 then a 4th
Reviews.Author: Erik Petersen "Techbaker"
Reviews.Content: ok - I've owned several brands. I bought 3 initially, two for me and one for a friend who wanted one that was "easy to use".  This is both EXTREMELY easy to set up AND takes great pictures.  I bought a 4th one.  I also bought the Bushnell for $155 and it works ok too -  but for half the price I'll buy these from now on!  Make sure to turn it off and then back on when removing/replacing the SD cards.  Flash doesn't go out more than 10-15 yards but still good enough to clearly see what the critter is.  Batteries (duracell) went to 70% after about 6-700 pictures on 10 second delay between pics - and there were a lot of night (i.e. flash) pictures.  Very happy with these!!! Highly recommend !

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Camera works great and takes good quality pictures. lens sometimes get a little foggy in the mornings but eventually clears up.  i would definitely but another.

Reviews.Title: primos truth camera 35
Reviews.Author: jeffery
Reviews.Content: Im very pleased with the product and the service. I would recommend this camera to anyone. For the price you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth cam 35
Reviews.Author: Wyldwulf
Reviews.Content: Good deal for the money. Takes great pictures,and videos as well. A little slow on the trigger for some applications, but a good value all around.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Walls
Reviews.Content: Easy to use seems to be made well photos are good and clear haven't used it to much yet but plan to use more in the fall.

Reviews.Title: crittercam
Reviews.Author: dd
Reviews.Content: Best pics at night. Daytime several pics with no critters.  I think the leaves or birds set it off.  Am continuing to adjust its placement and I think once I get it correct it will be great.

Reviews.Title: For the price, everything I expected...
Reviews.Author: Alexander Krizel "Sasha"
Reviews.Content: This is my first trail/game camera.  I didn't want to drop several hundred dollars to find out it's not for me.  This camera takes great pictures.  Time, temp and moon phase all get stamped on the photo.  Battery life (on lowest setting) lasts months.  It has a video setting, though I have not used it yet.Some photos are out of time, meaning there are IR photos taken during the day while some night photos are sometimes not taken in IR.  Also has quite a few (about 30%-50%) false activations.Definitely worth the money.  I could probably get 2 or more of these for less than a real expensive one and set up a perimeter around a deer trail.  Actually, I may just do that.

Reviews.Title: Great Trail Cam!!!!
Reviews.Author: Calvin
Reviews.Content: This trail cam was very simple to rest up date/ time. The pictures were amazingly clear and crisp. Overall performance is great and the price is right. I would recommend this product to anyone that is looking for a well priced cam that won't hurt your budget.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: PK
Reviews.Content: The truth cam 35 is easy to set up and use. I have had it a month and have not had any problems. The only negative comment that I will make is that the night pictures are not bright enough. All you see is eyes. I open the pictures with Picasa and adjust the settings to see what is actually in the pics.

Reviews.Title: Very sensative, fantastic pictures.
Reviews.Author: The Best Out West
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera.  It takes very nice looking pictures, and it's extremely sensative.  So much so that it took 1,500 pictures of a stick moving back and forth in the wind.  The night photos came out very well, also.  I really like this camera, and for the price it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: Second time was a disappointment - amended
Reviews.Author: S. White "ex nuke sub chief"
Reviews.Content: I had an identical camera that died after about 8 months.  It took good pictures day and night and I was satisfied enough to purchase a second one when the first started doing funny things to the SD memory card.  The second works well enough, but the pictures are not near as clear as the first Primos 35, nor are the night shots as bright.  If/when this one fails, I will likely look at another brand.Amendment to the original as written.  I now find that the camera takes fairly good photos and the batteries last longer than the first (same) unit I purchased.  I probably would buy another one if needed.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Toni Nix
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in Sept. just to see what was going on around the acreage when I wasn't looking.  Have not been disappointed.  Still on first set of batteries (50% left on them) with hundreds of photos taken of deer, various birds, a squirrel or three and a fox.  Great fun for nature watchers.  I have recommended this camera to others.  Hope I'm not jinxing it by bragging on it!

Reviews.Title: Great for the Price!
Reviews.Author: TexasRiverPirate "TexasRiverPirate"
Reviews.Content: The Primos Truth Cam 35 Game camera worked great. I had like 300 pictures the first week. As others stated, night picture's are not as good. I had mine on an iron fence post, 20 feet away from feeder. (I'd cut a 2x6, the length of the camera, cutting a vertical slot in the 2x6 to fit on post, and wiring it with wire, and attached camera to it, with the strap and a rope. Waist high. Worked great.) I could still make out the animals, but should have put it at 15 feet. Day picture's great. Coon's,wild hogs, crows, tore my corn up. They ate up 4 bags of corn. It's great to see what's out there. This was my first game camera. Had been putting off buying one for years.  I would buy another camera like this. What are you waiting on? Can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use; Good quality pictures
Reviews.Author: R. Strickland
Reviews.Content: The Truthcam 35 is extreamly easy to use, with four 3-way switches that are easy to set. All settings can be viewed at a glance.  The Truthcam 46 has more options, but you have to navigate through the menu to choose the desired setting. For those who do not use computers or shy away from electronic devices, the Truthcam 35 is a logical choice.The one thing I had trouble finding out before purchasing the unit was how to view the pictures.  There is no viewing screen on the camera, just an LCD screen for viewing the number of shots. You must remove the flash card from the unit, and plug it into to a device that reads flash cards, such as a digital camera, laptop computer, digital picture frame, or DVD player with a flash card slot.The unit is typically used by hunters to determine the type of animals freqenting an area, but we use it to see what kinds of critters are eating the scraps of meat at the compost pile. So far, we've seen o'possums, raccoons, foxes, cats, and a coyote. This has turned out to be a very enjoyable hobby, and friends like getting emails of the animals.

Reviews.Title: Looking for MAC compatible camera
Reviews.Author: Karen Mitchell "Tucsonkaren"
Reviews.Content: I can't seem to find out if this camera is MAC compatible...I brought home another type and it didn't say is was NOT Mac compatible until I had put it together and read the last page of the instruction manual.

Reviews.Title: Amazing battery Life
Reviews.Author: cxd4
Reviews.Content: After over 3000 photos the original Rayovak D cell batteries I used were still at 1.5v.  This camera could go all year on one set.  See the moose pic.

Reviews.Title: deer camera
Reviews.Author: val
Reviews.Content: I received item in a timely manner.  Very happy  with the camera.  It takes great pictures and give all the information that was wanted.

Reviews.Title: Good camera!
Reviews.Author: Widge'
Reviews.Content: This is a nice and easy to use product. I got two night pictures and one during the day, both where clear shots.  I had only gotten a few pictures before someone stole it off the tree it was attached too,so definitely buy a security cable if buying one of these cameras!!

Reviews.Title: Truth Cam 35
Reviews.Author: Kirk
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a very good camera.  The reason I gave it only 3 stars is because of the night video.  It is very poor quality and very dark video.  The night still pictures are great and very easy to set up.  The sensitivty and multishot settings are a real plus.  I would recommend this camera ONLY if the user didn't intend to use night video.

Reviews.Title: The Perfect Present
Reviews.Author: D. Bartlett
Reviews.Content: We really were not sure what to get my Father-in-law for Christmas.  During our first evening at their house for Christmas vacation it hit me that this camera would provide some outdoor entertainment while you stay inside.  The pictures are very good both during the day and at night.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: Chrisopher S. Sorsdahl
Reviews.Content: I have had this out for a week or two. Got a lot of pics, only complaint is a lot of pics are due to wind blowing the branches or an animal moving too fast to take a pic of (not sure which but I leaning toward the first). Good battery life and good picture quality though.

Reviews.Title: Great cam
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great pictures and highly recommend.  Placed at about 5 yards away from target (deer) and got hundreds of pics and battery last  a long time.  Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: trail camera
Reviews.Author: Cindy Ray-Byrd
Reviews.Content: easy to use, long battery life. Pictures are clear and capture all changes in movement, including light to dark. Very happy with the camera

Reviews.Title: Great Product for the Price
Reviews.Author: Dustin
Reviews.Content: So I bought this unit mostly because I am a "cheapo" and didn't really know how I would like using the trail cameras and let me tell you this thing is great for the price. I'm just going to list out the pros and cons and make this easier on you to read.Pros:High quality pictures during the dayThe ability to switch from video/pictureBeing able to change time of video recorded/amount of pictures takenVery easy to use and setupDecent battery lifeCons:On many of the videos the camera didn't start recording till the deer was dead in line with the camera (which makes me wonder if a deer didn't walk right in front of it did the camera even see it?)Night pictures aren't the greatest and if the deer isn't extremely close it's hard to tell the spread, points, and size of the deer. I assume this is because the LEDs aren't bright enough.Deer can definitely see this thing when it takes pictures at night. On the second picture the deer was always looking right at the camera.Overall, I would recommend purchasing the Primos Truth Camera 35 and I will be purchasing another for next season.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 25 game camera
Reviews.Author: ravot
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price. Easy to use. Once you insert four batteries, you can have the camera up and running in 20 seconds. Takes photos or videos.It's quiet when it takes pictures. However, it has a red and green light that turn on when it detects motion and while it takes a picture. I place electric tape over both these small lights. The deer and foxes don't seem to mind the lights though when I leave them uncovered.The best part of the camera is the fast wake up feature. You won't have many missed animals and blank pictures. I will buy another one.Tthe only negative, is the buckle seems cheap. I haven't broken it yet, but i'm gentle with it when securing it to a tree.

Reviews.Title: Helped my dad get a buck this year! (me not so lucky)
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Pros:  This trail camera is a great buy for the price.  We've caught several buck and doe on the camera this season with great detail.  We could easily count the points on a nice 8-pointer that was probably 20+ yards from the camera. The card is easy to remove and place in a camera or computer to quickly view the shots you got.Cons:  The SD memory card is easy to get to, but make sure you always keep the rubber protector gasket in place, with or without the card in.  Water easily wicks up into the memory card slot and can damage the card or the reader.I'll probably be getting 2 more of these for next season since the first one worked so well.

Reviews.Title: trail camera
Reviews.Author: slippery rock
Reviews.Content: wonderful camera very accurate description would order again from amazon the trail camera was very easy to operate and takes great pics.

Reviews.Title: Can't Handle the Truth
Reviews.Author: Lee C. Georg
Reviews.Content: So far I am very pleased with this product. It has performed very well.Night pictures are good and the video clips are very good. It is very easy to set up anduse. The clip for the strap broke after second use. The biggest problemI found so far is finding the animals in the pics. Some real good surprises.

Reviews.Title: My 1st Field Camera!
Reviews.Author: kthuerk
Reviews.Content: Having never owned a Field Camera I did a little reserach ahead of time.I wasn't sure what to expect from the Camera.... I am quite pleased with the qualityof the pictures and the unit itself. Nice work Primos

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: K. Hirsch
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my father.  It works well in capturing a lot of pictures, gives a lot of data on time and conditions and the battery life seems quite good.  I am disappointed in the quality of the night pictures and that, when I look at them in a camera to view, it won't display some images even thought they look like they should be good.  For the money, it is probably as good as you should expect.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35
Reviews.Author: getoutandexplore
Reviews.Content: First night out in the woods, the camera worked perfectly.  The camera quit recording date/time data on second use.  Left the camera out in woods over the weekend and now it no longer records identifable subjects in night time shots.  Night time shots are almost all black even though led's glow red indicating it should be working.  Day time shots are now completely out of focus at all ranges.  Bought this camera because of price and reviews but it's gotta work or it ain't worth anything.  I'm giving it one more try.  Not AMAZON's fault but they may get it back.

Reviews.Title: Primos 35
Reviews.Author: Big Mike
Reviews.Content: This trail cam works well, the Pictures are good and you can really tell what your looking at. The batteries last about 10 day then they were down to 40% so I changed them just to be safe. All and all I'm very happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Pleased for the price
Reviews.Author: Scott A. Houlsey
Reviews.Content: I was sceptical at first, but after reading the reviews others had posted I decided to take a chance on this camera. Within minuts of opening the box I had the camera set up and ready to go to work. The following day I took it to our hunting land in centeral Georgia and mounted it on a small sweet gum tree. The following day I had 181 pix! I then changed the timing of the shots. The quality of the pix were as good as I expected.The battery life is excellent. I have recomended this camera to a couple friends and will be purchasing another for myself for next season.Pleasantly pleased,Scott

Reviews.Title: best trail cam for the price.
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: This is the best trail cam that you can buy for $80.  I don't know why you would ever pay more for one.  The picture quality is great.  it looks just like the images above.  The battery life is extremely long, I have had mine up for a week now and battery still says 99%.  It is also extremely easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: John W. Jones
Reviews.Content: Pros - Excellent day time pictures  Battery Life  3 weeks over 1000 pictures still 85% battery life)  PriceCons - Night pictures are grainy.  Poor quality photos at dust and dawn.For the money it is the best camera I have tried. I would definitely recommend this to someone looking a good economical trail cam.

Reviews.Title: night vision not so great.
Reviews.Author: Jamesh75
Reviews.Content: The first time we used this cam we had it on video and were amazed how great the videos came out. Then we put it on the photo on the high sensitive setting and we were getting great pics during the day but a lot of just black pics at night. For the price we expected better.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value, Great battery life.
Reviews.Author: H. Goulette "HG"
Reviews.Content: This camera is excellent. My first weekend I put it in the woods it capatured 140 images of wildlife.  I returned 4 days later and even after taking over 500 shots I still had 98% battery life.  It runs on 4 D batteries and takes great images.  If you are looking for an inexpensive camera that takes great pictures and has excellent battery life, this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Andrew Zanow
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if this is as fast of a trigger as a cudde,  but it catches walking deer.  The burst is nice.  It won't catch deer at night more than 20 feet but the rest of the pictures look good.  It took 85 pics the first night and didn't loose any battery.  I would buy this again.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35
Reviews.Author: JT
Reviews.Content: It's the first game camera I ever purchased so I can't compare it with any others.  I noticed it does make a little noise when taking nightime pictures but doesn't seem to bother the game. I wasn't aware that the LED's light up red when taking night pictures which I think the deer notice, I just really didn't know how it worked but I do now.  Had to set the sensitivity to the highest setting for it to capture any pictures.  I think it takes great pictures, a few slightly blurry ones at night.  Takes color pics during the day and black and white at night.  For the price and reliability, I like it enough that I have two now.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: Cant go wrong buying this. It has work perfectly as described. Good on batteries too. MyUnfortunately no animals where I put it

Reviews.Title: So far so good....
Reviews.Author: jc
Reviews.Content: It has worked fine, easy setup, only used bout a month on trails have first set of batteries still in camera..

Reviews.Title: Works Well
Reviews.Author: W. Nasuti "Bill"
Reviews.Content: This camera has worked out very well for me.  It was a breeze to set up and it takes very nice pictures.  I like the strap it is long and works well securing the camera to a tree or anything like that.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera on a budget!!!
Reviews.Author: WebHead21
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting to purchase a trail/scout cam for quite a few years, but could never justify spending the money that was required to get a quality camera. After doing some research, I decided on trying out the Primos TruthCam 35 because of the price, features, and success I've had with other Primos products. This camera is great, much better than some of the higher priced ones I've seen my buddies use. The only reason this cam doesn't get a 5 star rating is because the night pictures can be slightly fuzzy if the animal is very far from the camera. For the price, I would recommend this camera to everyone, and will probably end up purchasing one or two more of them.

Reviews.Title: primes truth cam 35
Reviews.Author: mountainman716 "mountainman716"
Reviews.Content: For the price I believe the camera is a good buy. I was having some problems with the camera that I thought was a defective camera but it was of my doing that the camera didn't work. (I neglected to insert the sd card).I did find out though that if it was the camera being defective I would have had to pay for the return shipping and they said they waived the $20.00 fee that was supposed the accompany the return ?Hearing all that did not sit well with me.so here's hoping you do not get a defective camera..

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35
Reviews.Author: smithers0990
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to catch a thief that was stealing tools from me and other employees at work (Automotive servie center). I put the camera up about 12 feet high and attached it to a peice of conduit and angled it down so it would capture anyone in the vacinity of my tool box or the tool box next to mine.  Since it has been up nothing has gone missing from any of the 20 technicians in the shop. I even went so far as leaving tools out on my tool box as bait. I feel much safer knowing that the camera is guarding my personal property and have great confidance it will catch the perpetrator.The camera itself is very easy to use and takes pretty clear pictures. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is, it seems to have trouble switching from night (black and white) pictures to day time (colored) pictures. Other than that it is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Some good, some not so
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great day time pictures, has amazing battery life but night pictures are not good at all.  I have to use software for every dark picture to lighten it up to see what is on the picture.  Camera also really struggles at transition time between light and dark.  For the price you save on the batteries and the little effort it takes to fix pictures I say it is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've ever purchased.
Reviews.Author: T. Fox "TFox"
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera for a few weeks, but so far it has performed well.  I hung it and left it for a little over a week and when I went to check on it, I had 594 images.  Most of the images were of raccoons, but I did manage to get a few pics of a nice 7 pointer.  I was really surprised to see the battery still registered 99%.  Well worth the price!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera and price
Reviews.Author: tvcasey
Reviews.Content: Been chasing rabbits here in New Zealand. This camera cost NZ$300 here and decided to go with Amazon. Fantastic price-read all of the reviews and the camera works perfectly!! No problems. Beautiful dayside color (colour) photos and great night shots!! Wish I could afford shipping for 4 more as I have 30 acres to cover. Heard that Cosco had them for $US135.00 and got it for $83.10 on Amazon. Can't beat the price and the wonderful shots!! Easy to operate and card works in my camera and then on to my computer. Very Happy with all!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Just installed the camera at our property about 3 weeks ago.  It takes great day and night time photos.  Can see all the details of the deer and other animals in the pictures. It is very simple to use and the instructions were very helpful.  I wouldn't hesitate to purchase another one if I need too.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35 - Working fine for me
Reviews.Author: skyscraper
Reviews.Content: So far the camera is working fine.  Takes really good video clips.  Daytime color photos and videos are of good quality.  Nighttime IR photos look like negatives, but good enough to show up the game activity.  Have experienced some cases where we had lots of "empty" photos, apparently due to wind blowing tree limbs in the camera's view.  Remounted the camera to a different angle and that seems to have resolved the problem.  Camera is fairly big and bulky, but that's not an issue for me.  Battery life seems to be holding up quite well.  Havent had it in any hard rain yet, so can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: Primos TC 35
Reviews.Author: Jaybryk
Reviews.Content: It works like intended fast delivery. It does the job for me I will probably get another one for the price you can't beat it...

Reviews.Title: 35 Cam
Reviews.Author: wardbr549
Reviews.Content: Daytime pic's are great ,nightime pic's alittle dark. It only have 35 lights so?? All toghter I will get another one ..Good buy for the money..

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: It is a great trail camera.  I have had no problems.  It is a good deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: Works Great - Buying Another
Reviews.Author: Chuck "HawkFan4Ever"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use and works as expected.  I have tried others but this one is my favorite.  Plan to purchase another one.

Reviews.Title: So Easy to Use!! (And no issues with Mac)
Reviews.Author: S. Davies
Reviews.Content: This is the third motion sensitive camera I have tried and it was really intuitive and easy to use! The first was a pain to set up and then I couldn't see the pictures using my Mac computer. The second was impossible to figure out, and again, the fact that I have a Mac as opposed to a PC didn't seem to help any. This one was really easy and intuitive, set up took a mere minute.  Even my 9 year-old son figured it out.To set up: Open easily with just a simple latch, insert 4 D batteries, if you want - set date and time (again, really easy on this one), set options that are clearly labeled on the switches and then you're done!I needed a camera to try to figure out which of my cats was remiss in litter box use (I know, eewww!! TMI!) and this one finally did the trick. By the way, I almost never bother to write reviews but this was such a pleasant surprise I just had to for this camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Diana Etchberger
Reviews.Content: works amazingly well, can't believe the number of photos and videos and batteries are STILL at 99% power. Great product

Reviews.Title: GET THE MOST FOR THE MONEY!
Reviews.Author: Timothy S. Butler "sbintn"
Reviews.Content: I own 7 or 8 trail cams and am over 75 minutes from my hunt club. Therefore I do not check my cameras every week and battery life is the single biggest concern I have. In this regard I have not had a better camera. I've had over 500 pics with more than 50% battery life left. It takes good 3mp quality pics. I'm not making 16x20 framed photos so I think it's silly to spend money to get the 8mp cameras. The first pic may take a couple of seconds to take so this is not the best for trail use, but I put my cameras over mineral licks here in middle Tennessee and this cam is fine for that. I love being able to leave a camera for 6 weeks. I set mine for 3 pics every 30 minutes so that helps conserve juice. The best $80 I've spent for a trail camera especially for an infrared flash.

Reviews.Title: Truth cam 35
Reviews.Author: Hunter4life
Reviews.Content: Very good camera takes excellent pictures we have tried several brands of cameras on several different farms and these cameras give better results than even higher end cameras very pleased with results will buy several more of these!

Reviews.Title: Good Trail cam for the price
Reviews.Author: MT13
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, but a good value for the price. Very easy to use. I've had a few issues in very cold weather, but it seems they were due to the SD card, not the camera.

Reviews.Title: performs well
Reviews.Author: hilcntry
Reviews.Content: Camera performs as advertized, like the fact that it uses "D" batteries.It has now taken many hundreds of pictures during the testing processand it still indicates the batteries at 85% power.Only fault I would mention is that an occasional picture is out of focus.hilcntry

Reviews.Title: Garden Saver
Reviews.Author: A. Smith
Reviews.Content: Great way to find out what's been invading the garden and bird feeders.  Worked perfectly and my 8 year old grandson set it up flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: Poor Performance!  Quality Pictures--if it took them!
Reviews.Author: Tim Dunham "BARGAIN FINDER"
Reviews.Content: I have used several game cameras and this has been the most unreliable!  It did not take pictures when required and was as inconsistent as Shaquille Oneal at the free throw line!  The product took quality photos. . .it just did not take them.  I purchased two of these and had to send them both back.  Not sure why all the praise about this in the other reviews. . .just needed to add my 2 cents.

Reviews.Title: Terrible item
Reviews.Author: Peter Robinson "cabotool"
Reviews.Content: From out of the box it didn't work and I returned it for a refund. Don't bother to try it out. You will end up returning it.

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: Vanessa Carroll
Reviews.Content: This unit quit working after one week. I would not recommend this to anyone. Eats D batteries very quickly also.

Reviews.Title: you get what you pay for here
Reviews.Author: truth cam
Reviews.Content: This camera takes a lot of pictures that says corrupt data.  The dusk and dawn pictures are back and forth from regular to it one after another.  The camera does take a lot of pictures and is very easy to use.  Would be a good camera without the other two big issues.

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35 Camera
Reviews.Author: Theodore Kroll
Reviews.Content: While it worked, I liked it. It worked good on the batteries, but when I would use the memory card in, it would kill the batteries in an hour or so. So I would have to remove the camera and plug it into my computer to get the photos. I sent it back.

Reviews.Title: Junk!
Reviews.Author: Not a fake reviewer
Reviews.Content: First I bought the popular Bushnell camera and that had a bad shutter. So I bought this one thinking it got good reviews and its about 1/2 the price. The red light lit up to show it sensed motion, but the green light never lit up and it never took one picture. Back it goes. I don't know if the manufacturers are making junk or if it's Amazon selling 2nd hand merchandise, but I'm NOT buying a third camera here, I'm buying it elsewhere. Soooooo done!

Reviews.Title: Must Have! Primos Truth Cam
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these cameras and must say that they operate as expected and are extremely easy to use!!

Reviews.Title: very frustrating
Reviews.Author: D. B. "D.B."
Reviews.Content: When I first got this camera for viewing wildlife in my yard. I could not read the card on my computer or camera so would take it to the drugstore photo kiosk to see what images were on there. After 2 weeks, the camera would tell me the SD card was full when it wasn't and would not take or store images. I called the company and they were very polite and sent me a new one (after having to purchase a new SD card in case that was where the error was). They even sent a return postage sticker. It again only worked for about 2 weeks and now even though I reformatted the card and it says there are images on it, NOTHING will read them and I was thinking of buying a game camera viewing device but I now think that the camera is doing something to the cards and it would be a further waste of money. I am very frustrated because I have a security issue that this camera could help with but it is once again worthless.I wish the company would fess up and fix the problem and give us all a refund who have had these issues.Since writing this review, I again called the company and was not treated well, was told it was my error, which it wasn't. Nothing was done to rectify the issue, much less admit defective or underachieving product.  I have since purchased a Tasco and it has so far proved wonderful. I called tech support to ask a question, it was fast and easy information AND the card used in the Tasco, Bushnell product, can be easily read on an iPad using an Apple card reader connector, which I purchased on Amazon. The pictures and range have been excellent with the Tasco...don't waste money and frustration on the Primos.

Reviews.Title: Great at first BUT
Reviews.Author: Hunter_41129
Reviews.Content: After the first year it wouldn't work right and it would show SDFUL on display saying SD card full when I just reformatted it. It doesn't work right anymore just a waste of time and money on this product. I would recommend bushnell or moultrie over primos.

Reviews.Title: Great Value / Easy to use.
Reviews.Author: D. Carpentiere
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this camera.  I bought this camera on recommendation from a friend who had researched a number of them prior to purchasing this one.  I bought it solely to see what was living in the woods on my property (I don't hunt).  Within 4 days I had great night shots of a raccoon and dinner-time (daylight) very clear shots of a LARGE BEAR.  Very clear pictures.  The camera is very easy to use....not fancy at all but honestly it gives you the features you'd want for this purpose.  My kids and I are now excited to check the memory card to see what is on it from the night before....Also - it is a great gift for someone who likes wildlife and lives in an area that has wildlife.  Or for someone who enjoys the outdoors.  I suppose it could also be a bit of a security camera if needed....but don't rely on it for that.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Joshua
Reviews.Content: This camera has to be one of the best on the market. I left it out for 7 days and it took about 1700 pictures. Not a single picture was blurry or distorted. I absolutlty have no complaints. It's nice to be able to see all the wildlife that is actually on our property! Thanks Primos for making a great product!

Reviews.Title: Waited a while for the technology to improve, this camera is there!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Latkey
Reviews.Content: The is a great performer and the price is unbeatable.  I had a Bushnell brand that I purchased from Walmart last year. The number of pictures, and quality of photos is twice that of the Bushnell,  plus the Bushnell quit working properly.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good.
Reviews.Author: Daniel D. Farley
Reviews.Content: Bought 5 of these and have had 2 of them out for the past 3 weeks. Best camera for the price I've ever owned. IR camera for under 80 bucks... no way you can beat that! The cameras have been good so far; quick trigger (which is the main thing I was looking for), decent pics, alright night photos, and really not that loud like other reviews claim. Not saying it doesn't make any noise, but makes no difference in the woods. Out of 830 pics only 2 were snow white. Not sure what causes this. Battery life may be the only down fall. Of the 830 pics, 700+ were from one camera over an 11 day period and battery life is down to 70%. Not horrible, but deffinately not that good. If battery life was better I would've rated 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: found out whats eating up my food plots
Reviews.Author: raymon
Reviews.Content: took over 1700 pictures  without changing Batteries easy to set up had some problems pulling up pictures on my lap top something to do with format I don't really know what that is but my daughter in law got it working I have two of them now cant wait for the next hunting season

Reviews.Title: absolutely will not pick up motion! buy another of better quality.
Reviews.Author: tracey simpson
Reviews.Content: this unit has never worked for me reliably.it never picks up motion is the main flaw.I have walked in front of it trying to get pics and nothing! what pics it does get is very poor quality.i would not buy anything primos again.

Reviews.Title: Misc.
Reviews.Author: B. Price
Reviews.Content: Read several reviews on this camera, but was concerned with the low price ($78)....price often times equates to junk. I have been thoroughly surprised by the sharp pictures and its consistency. Would  surely by another.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as I would have hoped.
Reviews.Author: JBP
Reviews.Content: The sensor just did not seem to work right. I am not sure if it was just the one I received or if it was just the sensor the put in these.

Reviews.Title: Purchased 2 of them
Reviews.Author: jeff church
Reviews.Content: I am a person that does alot of reseach and reads reviews.  I take the review serious since that is the only true information I can go off from.  I would recommend these to anyone.  Great product.

Reviews.Title: great for the money
Reviews.Author: Liz W
Reviews.Content: got this in and it is actually better than i had expected it would be! takes great pics and not too sensitive like some cameras. dont end up with a lot of blank pics. i would recommend it for sure!

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Susan J Neamon
Reviews.Content: Have used 2 other older model trail cams that went through AA batteries by the ton- this camera takes nice, clear photos night or day- very sensitive & gets photos a long way out there- battery life is phenomenal - will buy this same item for my next trail cam- I like the time, date, and moon phasse on each photo as well- really lets you know when game are traveling.  Quiet and the infared photos for dark are much better than the old flash on my prior trail cams that would sometimes wash out the picture if game too close and spooked game as often on older trail cams I had pictures of the back end of the animals!Cant say enough about this great product & was good price and quick shipping as always thru Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Best Value
Reviews.Author: James Koch
Reviews.Content: Very long battery life.Excellent range.Night pics are pretty good.Very easy to use.Best value for the price.Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I have owned
Reviews.Author: J. C. Brown
Reviews.Content: Makes plenty of picturesBattery life is goodNight performance is goodTrigger is excellentOnly con is the images are somewhat grainy.Previous cameras:  Moultrie, WGI, Stealth Cam (film)

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35
Reviews.Author: Riverbill
Reviews.Content: Everything was as advertised! Brand new camera in the box, delivered on time! No surprises, camera works great. The price was the best I could fine, this is my second camera, I use them for home security and they do a good job both in video & still shots!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TrailCam
Reviews.Author: Alison Hollister
Reviews.Content: The pictures show the date and time which makes it critical to hunting success and the picture quality is great

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: coastalcommodore
Reviews.Content: We use it all the time at the camp and had ZERO problems with it.  It takes amazingly clear pictures even at night and this is our 13th camera we bought for the camp (other brands and models as well).  We can count the number of points on a buck on every picture!

Reviews.Title: Working well
Reviews.Author: BobStone
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace one that I broke. It is so much better than the old one. Easy setup. I put four D copper top batteries in it 14 days ago and it still shows 98% battery. It took 19 pictures, 2 of them at night during that time. I expected to see shorter battery life due to the freezing temps. Doesn't seem to have happened. I placed it into a container with cutouts for the flash, camera and sensor with very good results. The 40' range for the IR flash seems right. I can bring out things beyond that using the contrast settings on my computer software. The trigger time is good too. My old one took many seconds to trigger and often game had time to get out of the picture.

Reviews.Title: Great Trail Cam
Reviews.Author: product reviewer
Reviews.Content: Love this trail cam. You can set it for still pictures or full motion video.  It has enough easy-to-set options to provide you with a variety of uses.  Whether you are tracking deer movement, or want a home, or business security system, this one can do it all.  I spent a lot of time researching the different motion, IR cameras, this is one of the best choices on the market.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this product. Customer service from th company SUCKS

Reviews.Title: Great Unit For The Money
Reviews.Author: Affordable Wildlife Management
Reviews.Content: The Primos Truth 35 is priced right and works pretty good too.I have more than one and I like them. One needs to be aware of location and lighting when using them but they have been great for patterning the deer for hunting and also tresspassers for prosecution.(you just never know when your on camera)

Reviews.Title: Primos Truth Cam 35 Camera Review
Reviews.Author: RA Long
Reviews.Content: This camera works well for the money and my needs. Battery life so far is great. Used cheep evereadys and still at 85% after 2 months,and over 800 quality photos. This camera does make some shutter noise when triggered, most deer will look to it on the 3rd or 4th pic. in multi. mode. overall am happy with purchase.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Minnesota
Reviews.Content: This is my first trail cam and I found the pics to be clear and the video nice. It was so easy to set up and operate. I'm having so much fun with 2  I'm going to get another 1 or  2!

Reviews.Title: Deer Ca
Reviews.Author: Sandra Anderson "Sam"
Reviews.Content: We have owned other manufacturers and did not last long.  The Primos Truth has worked beautifully.  However, does go through batteries quite quickly and must wake each time the SD card is put back in.  Picture quality excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great quality for private land.
Reviews.Author: callmecamo "Brad"
Reviews.Content: Easy on batteries with good picture and video quality.  The only knock I have against it is that the SD card is accessible from outside the housing.  This means that any ol' public land Jethro can walk up and jack your card!  You hunters out there know the type!

Reviews.Title: Michael
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I am having a good time using the Primos Truth Cam 35 seeing what animals are traveling through our yard.  The pictures are very clear. So far I have seen deer, fawns, and racoons.  It is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: REPLACEMENT BROKEN TOO
Reviews.Author: robin*armstrong*seeber
Reviews.Content: LATEST UPDATE~ Amazon refunded the restocking fee and apologized, this company rocks, I will shop with them forever, for now... I still would never buy another trap cam of this brandUPDATE~ ok so they sent me a replacement, I didn't open it right away because I didn't need it. So probably 5 months after receiving the REPLACEMENT camera, I used it, maybe 5 times, or less... IT ALREADY broke again, so I called amazon, they said the return date was over due, I explained the sitation, so they said ok you can return it... so I did, they CHARGED ME RESTOCKING!! so watch out, because they put BROKEN ITEMS back on their shelves for sale again, that's probably what happened to me.. I got an old broken one for my replacement.. so i am quite unhappy!OLD REVIEW, before I knew any better;Love this camera, used it for quite  afew nights upon receiving it in Feb. It has been resting on a shelf for april and may, and I went to use it, and no photos, so I changed the batteries, which last time it worked said there was 85% battery power left, and nothing...no screen came up and no anything...calling the company tomorrow as they are closed weekends.. hoping they do a good customer service job, then I will be back to edit or make a new review, if it's already broken and I wasted $90, then I will put a 1star up and scare everyone away that wants to buy one...so back in a bit...THE COMPANY sent me a brand new trap cam, so we will see how long it lasts this time, good company possibly not a great product though when it is working it's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: old Crow
Reviews.Content: Takes beautiful, clear pictures in a.m. and captures creepy nighttime photos of critters too close to our house. Has a long battery life. Easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Best scout camera!
Reviews.Author: AT "MA"
Reviews.Content: The Primos Truth Cams are the very best scout cameras going. The company stands behind their product,the price is right and the camera is easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Need more Range
Reviews.Author: DB
Reviews.Content: Camera has great battery life but seems to need more flash range on the IRs. The picture quality is ok. Seems to have a hard time deciding to use the IRs or not during dawn or dusk hours. Some photo's dark and some great, depends on the the IR flash or not. The trigger seems to be great. Would problably buy a different camera next time.

Reviews.Title: night pictures were "BLACK".
Reviews.Author: P. J. Mottershead
Reviews.Content: Tried this camera  first inside the house to see if it worked, and then outside in the real world.  Both times any pictures at night were completely "BLACK", could not make out anything.Disappointing as I have other Primos cameras that I am very satisfied with, not this model.

Reviews.Title: Don't waist your money
Reviews.Author: Linda Thornton
Reviews.Content: Used this trail camera for a week and started flashing SDFul, call support.... No help at all! Never again will I buy from Primos or Bushnell

Reviews.Title: sucks
Reviews.Author: sid
Reviews.Content: don't work have to send it back wont take any picture have to drive 1 and a haft hours to go get it this suck

Reviews.Title: okay
Reviews.Author: Becky
Reviews.Content: i bought it for my boyfriend and he told me i shouldn't have bought it used. it didn't come with a box.

Reviews.Title: Please help!
Reviews.Author: Help!
Reviews.Content: I'm looking to purchase this camera to catch the fools that keep messing with my mailbox.  Could someone please give me an idea of what kind of flash this produces at night?  We would obviously have to put it up high on the pole so they couldn't get to it but didn't know how bright of a light it made, if any. Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: Wildlife Camera
Reviews.Author: Howard Clift
Reviews.Content: This camera works great.  It has been taken pictures, but unfortunately It has been only taking pictures of me.  I am moving it around to catch pictures of deer.  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Truth Cam 35
Reviews.Author: Hunter
Reviews.Content: Purchased the camera for security purposes. Excellent daylight photos. Very disappointing night-time photos/video. Can identify the shape of a person but certainly not any identifying features. Also the reflections from license plates makes them un-readable after dark. It is advertised as infrared but it is not. The "flash" is easily visible after dark. It is not very sensitive as it does not pick up wild turkeys walking in front of it. It is a low priced camera and you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: camera sucks
Reviews.Author: rooster
Reviews.Content: I own and operate a retail sporting goods store.  I recently put 6 of these cameras into stock.  I sold all six of these cameras to my son and nephew for of course my cost.  When batteries were put into one it immediately started smoking.  We put up the remaining 5 last satureday.  We checked them and all 5 were taking pictures.  After putting out some deer attractant we left the area.  We returned today anxiously looking forward to seeing the pictures.  We have some very large deer on our property and were anxious to how much they had grown since last year.  Imagine our supprise and disappointment when none of the cameras had a picture.  All deer attractant was gone.  We know we have abundant wilflife on our property.  I can't wait to see what Primo has to say Monday morning.  I have more of these cameras ordered, they will be returned to my suppliers soon.  Do not buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: doesn't come with card or batteries
Reviews.Author: Susan Hoedebeck
Reviews.Content: This camera doesn't come with a SD card or batteries and this wasn't clear or obvious when the camera was purchased. I was disappointed when the recipient opened the camera then had to purchase their own card & batteries.

Reviews.Title: What has been seen can not be unseen.
Reviews.Author: Run Quickly
Reviews.Content: I bought this originally because I figured it was just a snazzy little camera with a nice name.  But it's not, the Primos Truth Cam 35 lives up to it's name and more.  Simply by snapping a picture it showed me the truth behind whatever it was I took a picture of.  I don't think I'm safe anymore, I'd say that I probably shouldn't be posting this information in a review but there are so many of them that they probably know anyways.  I still can't believe it, they all looked, so Human...

ProductInfo.Features:
Day/night 35-infrared LED trail camera captures still or video images of wildlife
40-foot nighttime range; select the number of active LEDs (more night range or battery life)
1.5-second trigger speed out of sleep; 0.3-second trigger speed when active; multi-shot bursts of 1, 3 or 5 images per triggering
Large backlit LED screen; instructions printed on camera door
Supports up to an eight gigabyte SD card; one-year warranty
ProductInfo.Name: Primos Truth Cam 35 Camera
